story: *The Dream:* - To create a place where mothers & mothers-to-be (& their support person) can stay in good quality accomodation, eat food grown from my organic garden, choose a yoga class or photography session (or both!) and learn how to take time out to rest and again adore the experience of being a mother. *My Story:* - Hi, I'm Hayley. I am a first-time Mum, avid suppporter of mental health and passionate about photography & yoga. My loves combined, my dream is to create a wellbeing retreat that specialises in time out, rest & rejuvenation for women throughout and after their pregnancies. My baby, Taliah, was ten months old before I realised that I needed to take a break and do something for myself - instead of looking after both of us, I had focused solely on her and this had left me depleted, tired and listless - not the ideal 'motherhood' I had imagined. I want to create what was not there for me. *The Plan:* - I can not build a retreat like this with $6000, but what I can do is take the first step. I would like to use the money I raise here to complete my teacher training in Yoga Studies, so that I am qualified to take yoga sessions with pre and postnatal women. Whatever amount I raise here will go directly to educating myself further and start the ball rolling to offer women some quality time out. My skill set is already varied - I am a secondary school teacher, a gardener, I have a graduate dipolma in Psychology and I am a photographer. Completing a yoga qualification will mean I can tailor my guests' retreat program, without relying on other teachers to come for a one-on-one class, which would be expensive. It allows me to run self-sufficiently and reap the rewards of working closely with my guests, rather than calling in other experts. *What you get?* - Please see below for your special 'Thank You' gifts. -*Please pass my message on* - share on facebook, twitter or your blog. The more people who see this the more likely we will find people who are willing to share their resources. -*Regardless of whether you donate today - being a Mum is at times really hard; it is expected that you will know what to do, instinctively know how to balance your life and be able to cope in all situations - Ask a Mum today (maybe even yours) if you can offer them a little help.* *Please make some noise about my campaign - please tell your friends about me and my dream.* Thank you. xo
story_txt:

To create a place where mothers & mothers-to-be (& their support person) can stay in good quality accomodation, eat food grown from my organic garden, choose a yoga class or photography session (or both!) and learn how to take time out to rest and again adore the experience of being a mother. 

*My Story:*       -         
Hi, I'm Hayley. I am a first-time Mum, avid suppporter of mental health and passionate about photography & yoga. My loves combined, my dream is to create a wellbeing retreat that specialises in time out, rest & rejuvenation for women throughout and after their pregnancies. 
My baby, Taliah, was ten months old before I realised that I needed to take a break and do something for myself - instead of looking after both of us, I had focused solely on her and this had left me depleted, tired and listless - not the ideal 'motherhood' I had imagined. I want to create what was not there for me.

*The Plan:*         -
I can not build a retreat like this with $6000, but what I can do is take the first step. I would like to use the money I raise here to complete my teacher training in Yoga Studies, so that I am qualified to take yoga sessions with pre and postnatal women. Whatever amount I raise here will go directly to educating myself further and start the ball rolling to offer women some quality time out.  

My skill set is already varied - I am a secondary school teacher, a gardener, I have a graduate dipolma in Psychology and I am a photographer. Completing a yoga qualification will mean I can tailor my guests' retreat program, without relying on other teachers to come for a one-on-one class, which would be expensive. It allows me to run self-sufficiently and reap the rewards of working closely with my guests, rather than calling in other experts. 

*What you get?*    -
Please see below for your special 'Thank You' gifts. 

      -*Please pass my message on* - share on facebook, twitter or your blog. The more people who see this the more likely we will find people who are willing to share their resources.
      -*Regardless of whether you donate today - being a Mum is at times really hard; it is expected that you will know what to do, instinctively know how to balance your life and be able to cope in all situations - Ask a Mum today (maybe even yours) if you can offer them a little help.* 

*Please make some noise about my campaign - please tell your friends about me and my dream.*

Thank you. xo

story:
Aloha and mahalo, for taking the time to come visit the Fund Fenwick website, in honor of Sam Fenwick. Sam has the opportunity to join the ISA (International Surfing Assocation) tour for professional surfing athletes. For those of us who are lucky to know Sam, and watch him surf, will testify to his well rounded and stylish power surfing. He is no stranger to adapting to the new and demanding radical moves in the ever changing surf world. By the same token, his iconic and old school wave riding skills, make him such a unique surfer. This combination of talent that Sam posesses is a style that is admired and loved by so many and is a rare treat for those who love the sport of surfing. Sam has proven himself to be a fierce competitor, an ambassador of cutting edge surfing, and descends from a rich heritage of Hawaiian waterman. In addition, Sam is extremely proactive in coaching, guiding, and encouraging Hawaii's surfing youth. He passes on his knowledge of Hawaiian culture, hunting and gathering, and environmental preservation.

Sam's life revolves around the ocean, the reef, and his dream to join such a surfing opportunity. He is genuinely asking for your help/support so he can join the best surfers in the world on this tour, and follow his dreams. With what ever small donation you could so gratuitously donate to his cause would be so gratefully cherished. Sam needs your donations for his airfare, food, lodging, entree fees and transportation while he is surfing the with ISA team on the Masters Championship Tour in Ecuador this year. The estimated cost of doing this entre tour, ballpark range, came to be about 10,000.00 and were trying to pull together all our resources to make this happen. With your donation you will be supporting a caring and giving person who truly deserves a chance at his dream.  The fund is so important to the people of Hawaii, especially the youth, because they can see the power behind believing and working hard. No matter what age, what gender, financual status, just hard work and believing can make anything happen. 

The International Surfing Association (ISA) is recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) as the World Governing Authority for Surfing and all other wave riding activities. Along with its World Championship Series, the ISA works to develop global surfing by providing educational programs in the areas of Judging & Officiating, Coaching & Instructing, Surf School Accreditation, Adapted Surfing, and also provides an ISA Individual Scholarship Program for Junior (under-18) surfers. ISA includes the surfing National Governing Bodies (NGB’s) of 72 countries on five continents. Its headquarters are located in San Diego, California. For more information please visit http://www.isasurf.org 

The ISA’s Over all mission, which is for a better surfing future.

story:
Hey Yo, The Bad Guy Needs Our Help 

Long time fans of Scott Hall, aka "Razor Ramon" have hoped and prayed for his well being for over a decade.  Scott was among the greatest professional wrestlers of all time, and his tragic fall from grace has been widely publicized in the media.
 
Many wrestling fans have feared he would be the industry's next tragic loss.  But now there's a glimmer of hope.
 
Scott's longtime friend Diamond Dallas Page, together with the support of Jake "The Snake" Roberts, Kevin Nash, and Sean Waltman, have come together to help Scott get healthy and find a purpose in life with his inspiring story of redemption.
 
 
Unfortunately, we didn't know just how broken Scott's body was.  At the young age of 54, Scott has had a pacemaker, and difibrillator implanted for his heart, and he can barely walk due to extreme arthritis in his hip.  Unless he gets a hip replacement, he will be unable to do the necessary exercise in order to get his health back.  Without medical insurance, Scott's inability to pay for the procedures he needs are a major hurdle to his physical recovery.
 
DDP has welcomed Scott and Jake into his home, not only to help them maintain sobriety, but to rebuild their lives from the ground up... physically, mentally, professionally, and spiritually.  
 

 

 

40+ Days Clean and Sober

Today, Scott has been clean and sober over 40 days - longer than he can ever remember outside of a medically supervised environment.  He believes something is very different this time, after 11 trips to rehab.

What We Need & What You Get

We're doing everything we can to rebuild Scott, but we're hoping Scott's longtime fans will rally around him, and show him how much love there still is for him.  

Our goal is to raise $80,000 to cover his hip replacement surgery, physical therapy,  dental work, and his continuing medical expenses.  

We believe that with some persistance and encouragement, Scott can rebuild his body and become healthy and happy again.  In return for your donations, you'll get some of the amazing perks listed to the right.  Best of all, you'll be able to be a part of this inspiring story.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, we understand, but please share this link with your friends, be it by e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, etc.

Thank you so much and God Bless.

How the Funds Will Be Managed

Diamond Dallas Page and his team will ensure all funds raised through this campaign are used solely for the benefit of Scott Hall's process of recovery and physical rehabilitation.

story:
DO NOT DONATE ONLINE IF YOU LIVE IN PORTLAND, OREGON! DONATE BY MAIL OR IN PERSON AT PORTLAND ROCK GYM!

The Fact: $12,000 in medical bills!!!

The Epic Story:

It was April 8th, 2012, a Sunday, Easter Sunday. Anna was working a problem in Joshua Tree on her first big climbing trip of the season, when the unthinkable happened. The thing that every climber knows is a possibility but never thinks will happen to them.
 
Anna fell from about 15' and landed on the seam of the crash pad.
And...BAM! EXPLOSION! LEFT ANKLE SHATTER FEST!

The Medical Diagnosis:

Injury: Left posterior talar body fracture. Left talar head fracture. Left posterior tibial tendon sublaxation.
 
Treatment: Surgery #1: insertion of an external fixator (now removed and in a bag in her closet). Surgery #2: insertion of nine screws and two plates. Several months of physical therapy and gimping around the gym. Now, Surgery #3: removal all the hardware they can and partial hindfoot fusion (???) and muscular hernia repair.

The Reality of the Situation:

Medical bills suck for an epic series of operations like this. Medical bills suck more when you are 25 years old and work at a climbing gym full time. If you have good health insurance, you've probably never even seen a full hospital bill. Count yourself lucky. Listen to this NPR Planet Money podcast to get some perspective: Episode 439: The Mysterious Power Of A Hospital Bill.
 
We all live hard lives as climbers, but if you're one of the lucky ones who is still sprinting up rocks with BOTH FEET, take a minute to think about what you would do if you fell on the seam and shattered your ankle.

The AWESOME Prizes:

Give what you can, and we will give you what we can...which is a lot of sweet swag donated by companies who LOVE CLIMBERS and ANNA! 

On April 13, 2013 at Portland Rock Gym, we will host a Climbtastrophe Relief Fund prize party* to share the love and say thank you. Some of the prizes include:

  • La Sportiva shoe gift certificate and discount cards
  • Petzl GriGri
  • 70m, 9.4 Petzl fusion rope
  • Petzl backpack (multipitch size)
  • Jackets from Adidas
  • Julbo sunglasses
  • 50m, 9.4 Sterling nano
  • One Year Membership to Portland Rock Gym
  • Next Adventure gift certificates
  • One Year Membership to The American Alpine Club

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help: get the word out and make some noise about the Climbtastrophe Relief Fund!!!

*Email funkjunk@me.com for information regarding prizes and your donation.

story:
You know that song, “you are my sunshine”? That’s my daughter Bella, she will be 7 next month. She is the love of my life, my sunshine, she makes me happy when skies are gray. I’ve been in a custody battle for her for 3 years now. The sad part is, well, the whole thing is sad really. Her dad is trying to take her away from me. He wants me to only have her every other weekend, supervised. Not because I do drugs or drink because I don’t, but because he is still hurt. His way to hurt me now is to take my daughter from me. I’m a great mom! I take her to girl scouts, she is a daisy! I help her with her homework. I make her cute bento box lunches because I LOVE to. She is bright, caring, and gentle and she loves both her parents, just as she should. All she wants is equal time with both her parents, that’s what I want to.

 

I haven’t had my daughter for a weekend since February 2011. I haven’t been able to take her to any of the local festivals, like the strawberry fest, the chocolate fest, or even Aiken’s Makin, a local arts and crafts show. I haven’t even been able to take her to a birthday party! I get her for her birthday this year, it falls on a Tuesday, when I asked to have her on a Saturday for a few hours to throw her a party and have some of her friends over her dad said no, because it is HIS time. I get that a lot, HIS time. I think it’s HER time.

 

This is why I need help. I cannot pay my legal fees. If I don’t pay them I lose my lawyer AND I can be held in contempt and serve time in jail. If I lose my lawyer I have to represent myself in court, even with a case as good as mine I don’t know how to do this. I also have to pay for her Guardian ad Litem, the woman who is responsible for deciding what is in Bella’s best interest. Along with her I also owe to a judge who attempted to mediate between her dad and I to try and come to an agreement. I BEGGED to avoid this step, I knew he would not agree to anything reasonable and it would just be another senseless bill, but the court said it had to happen. I can’t tell you what happened because it’s still a pending trial; let’s just say “reasonable” is not in his vocabulary.

 

 I lost my job in December 2011, due to health reasons and lack of Paid Time off and an error when filing for FMLA. Companies have rules and the company I worked for was unable to re-file paper work to correct the error. I’ve been looking for work since but I can’t just take a normal job, that’s what got me to this point to begin with. Until the custody is settled I need to have a job where I am home with her when she is with me. I haven’t found one yet. (I do have an interview on October 8th though! So keep me in your thoughts and prayers please!)

 

Here’s where it get’s worse. My husband also has not been able to find work. We had to move to this somewhat small town in order for me to be close enough to Bella. I used to have to drive her 25 miles to get her to school, 25 back home and unless I wanted to sit around here for 6 hours waiting for her to get out of school it was a double trip. So he has been unemployed, and his unemployment ran out 4 weeks ago. Mine will be up in 3 weeks. So to add to the legal bills I have no idea how I am going to pay our rent, our electric or our phones to hopefully get that job call.

 

What finally put me over the edge and the reason why I am now typing this is because my lawyer called today to tell my that my ex is now filing a contempt charge on me for a joint credit card he and I used to have that I have been unable to pay off. Of course it is affecting his credit too (never mind that this man has never held a full time job in his life and he is 37, or that he lives rent free thanks to his parents, who also pay all his legal fees. Had I had a lawyer for our divorce you better believe I would not have taken all our marital debt, debt that was accumulated because the only way to pay for groceries was to put it on a credit card because he barely worked and I couldn’t do it on my own). So because I can’t pay the card, I’m going to be sued for the amount of the balance plus his legal fees and since I can’t pay those either I’ll go to jail.

 

I am not a bad person. I am down on my luck so to speak. I’ve been in tough times before but I always find a way to pull through them. I know that there are people far worse off than me too, which is why it is very hard for me to do this. I HATE that I am asking for help, but what other choice do I have? I can’t lose my daughter. I can’t lose our home. When I say that I will pay forward everything that comes from this, I mean it with every fiber of my being! I believe that God does not take you to something unless he can take you through it, maybe this is how, I don’t know. I just have to believe that a small miracle is here waiting for me. We already have one, my husband was contacted this week about a great job. A job that would turn our lives around for the better. It’s in Virginia, though and that has it’s own obstacles.

 

If you can find it in your heart to help me and my family I would be so grateful. My daughter will be grateful. It might just be the small miracle we need to move past this chapter in our lives and into one full of promise and hope. I’ve seen the good that comes from communities reaching out, I’ve been part of that good in helping do my part many times, and it’s a great feeling. I hope you know what I mean. I hope you can see my plea for what it is. If you feel moved by this but cannot contribute please pass my story along, you never know, and please keep my family in your prayers! Thank you for taking the time to read this and God Bless you!

story:
Natalie Meyers is living in pain with rapid tooth decay that doctors can not explain. She has trouble eating and even talking because of the pain in her teeth and gums which also leads to migraines. She's only 22 and is a kind hearted, wonderful woman. She deserves to live a happy pain free life.
 
The Dentist estimated it would cost $5500 to remove all of her teeth and make dentures. All funds will pay for dental costs and anything over will help cover costs when she is out of work.

You can help even if you cannot donate, please share this or leave Helpful suggestions. Thank you very much for your support. 

                                                                                   -Jonathan Estes

 

 8/26/2012

Message from a friend.

My beautiful friend Natalie requires emergency dental work due to a severe infection. She works hard every single day to provide not only for herself, but for her family. She hasn't been able to get this critical dental work done because of cost constraints and was deemed ineligible for government aid. This is a perfect example of what is wrong with our health care system...Natalie gives everything she has to others, and leaves little for herself. It's time that we come together and give back to this wonderful, loving, and most deserving woman.

    
                                                                                     -Rita Quiggle
story_txt:
Natalie Meyers is living in pain with rapid tooth decay that doctors can not explain. She has trouble eating and even talking because of the pain in her teeth and gums which also leads to migraines. She's only 22 and is a kind hearted, wonderful woman. She deserves to live a happy pain free life.
 
The Dentist estimated it would cost $5500 to remove all of her teeth and make dentures. All funds will pay for dental costs and anything over will help cover costs when she is out of work.
You can help even if you cannot donate, please share this or leave Helpful suggestions. Thank you very much for your support. 
                                                                                   -Jonathan Estes
 
 8/26/2012

story:
We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we're curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths. -Walt Disney

                                           Our Story

 Hello! Thanks for visiting our page! Some of you know us, and some of you don't so here's a little more about us. My name is Jamie, and I'm married to a wonderful man named Christopher we have been together for six years and married for two years tears swell up in my eyes as I write this letter in hopes that others will see the pain, I have endured the dream we once sat down to talk about is still just a dream.

Not so many days have passed since the last baby shower I attended to realize that it wasn't for me yet only a reminder of what I want and still do not have the smile across my face when I hear the great news of others expecting suddenly is over taken by the pain and constant reminder of the battle we have been through am so happy for them yet it hurts me inside, is it selfish to feel pain when others are so happy?

When we made the decision to get pregnant, we had dreams of jumping for joy when the pregnancy test showed positive what the faces of our family and friends would be like when we shared the great news and how the nursery would look like in pink or blue. We never dreamed of the challenges that were placed in front of us from our dream of having a family.

Christopher and i both were diagnosed with infertility causes after over two years with no success I with a ( Pituitary Microadenoma) which is a benign tumor of the pituitary gland with a diameter less than 10mm, and Christopher has unbalanced hormones he has high FSH levels, which cause him to have a condition known as (Oligospermis) or low sperm count your sperm count is considered lower than normal if you have fewer than 20 million sperm per mililiter of semen(he has less than 2 million).

We have put in many years of treatment with no success. We often ask ourselves is it a dream too good to be true? The smile we put on our faces that everyone sees hides the pain we endure. Chris often reminds me that there is always light at the end of the tunnel, but for me that light has dimmed failure after failure my wonderful husband has never left my side for he is the one who pushes me through our failed attempts. For the past nine years, I've worked as a childcare provider as well as a nanny.

I have committed my life to nurturing other peoples children. After years of trying to conceive without i success, IVF is our final option. If I am guility of grievous attachment to one particular expectation for my life, it is the idea that I will certainly, absolutely, have a child, a soft, smiling baby with those curiously small toes who will complete my purpose on earth, and make me whole.


                                        The Impact

Christopher and I have gone back and forth discussing if this was a “good idea” to post this information online and let the world into this personal and difficult journey we've been on. There are pros and cons that always come up. For starters, there is not a guarantee.This procedure might not work. In In addition, many in our lives will be shocked to hear this has been going on for four years.

We hope this will not change the way they treat us and that they will feel comfortable talking about this with us. We must prepare ourselves for the questions and comments that will come,many of which we have dodged by facing theses difficulties with only a few close friends, coworkers and family memebers.

All that to say, we can NOT do this without you. The deeper we get into this, the harder it is to pretend like life is great. If we say no to dinner invites to save money, we want you to know why we are saving money. However,after much thought and prayer, we know the pros outweigh the cons.Sharing our story with you, could result in two things. With your help we could become pregnant and have a baby! That thought in itself is so exciting for us. We could have a child! :) And secondly, if there are any couples reading this that are facing the challenges of infertility, we hope this gives them the courage to speak up, to reach out, to fight!! Overall, this is a scary thing for us to admit and if there are others dealing with this too, we'd love to hear from you!

I know for some who will read this it may be a lot to swallow. But take heart that even though

momth after month our lives are filled with defeat, we are not giving up! Through it all we have and will remain hopeful that, someday, we will have the family we want. We know we are ment to be parents,and when that day comes,all of this will be worth it! With the help of an amazing group of

doctors, the support of our awesome family and friends, and strength from God, we believe we will have a baby! We are choosing not to let the lack of expenses hold us back. We are inviting all of our Family,Friends, and anyone who feels led to support us to become a part of our “ Baby Heard Journey”! 1 in 10 couples suffer from infertility. I am hoping that with this being sent out it will help bring awareness to everyone as well as comfort and hope to those who also are fighting this battle.

Where your donation will go

$ 9,800 will cover :

-Cycle monitoring, including all ultrasounds

-Egg retrieval, including anesthesia

-Insemination of my little eggies using (ICSI) Which is pronounced ick-see, stands for intracytoplasmic sperm injection ICSI may be used as part of an IVF treatment. In normal IVF, many sperm are placed together with an egg, in hopes that one of the sperm will enter and fertilize the egg. With ICSI, the embryologist takes a single sperm and injects it directly into an egg.

-Embryo culture and transfer from cycle (Take the eggies out/put the eggies back in)

-Blood pregnancy test folling transfer

-Fertility Medication around $4,200

We will never be able to thank you enough for the gift you are trying to give us. There are no words that could describe what your donations mean to us. We'll share with our little one(s) each one of your names and the journey we all took together to get them here. More than anything, Thank you for joing us on this Journey! Thank you for being apart of our lives.Thank you for believing our dream could become a reality.

Other ways you can help

We know that times are tough and understand if you cannot donate. However there are other ways you could help by just spreading the word. You can post this page on any site such as Facebook,Twitter,and Linkedin.

Additionally for every dollar amount that we receive over our goal, we will be donating it to other families like ours. Most Couples that suffer from infertility have no insurance that covers treatment and will never have athe chance to try IVF.

We truly appreciate all of your support and look forward to sharing some happy news with everone down the line.

We are more than ready to move on to the Family phase of our life and the fun,stress,laughs,tears,sleeplessness,silliness,love,and joy that comes with being parents :)

To give away money is an easy matter and in any man's power. But to decide to whom to give it, and how large,and when,and for what purpose and how, is neither in anyman's power nor an easy matter...   -Aristole

story:
Greetings to our wonderful organic/sustainable friends~

We are very excited to bring to you again our 4th most amazing tour of them all! Pedaling from Minnesota to Mississippi to enlighten the public of the misconceptions of the organic world.  Our previous tours enabled us to reach out to the nation in venues who may not have otherwise heard our message.  We were very successful in helping the Organic Consumer’s Association in gathering many signatures for the Proof in Labeling petition during our stops on our previous tours. We need YOUR participation to keep our mission alive and the tours going to share the organic awareness to the world.  We need YOU to help us say NO to GMO / Monsanto and we need YOU to help us stand up for our food and health freedoms.

Please view our site: www.fuelforthebody.org  for complete details on the tour.

Do you want to 'Bee' the Change?  Or do you just want to be the ones who sit back and say, “how did this happen”?  TOGETHER help Us Make a Difference~.

Our Fuel for the Body Team believes it would be very beneficial for you or your company to come aboard our team in any way you can.  This will enable us to reach the masses and get some myths straightened out.  We reach a public who would not otherwise hear our message.   This time we are cycling from Minneapolis, MN to Gulfport, MS.   Oct. 1 thru 31. This tour will conclude in 30 days to complete a 1530 mile journey.  We will empower the world again on organic and healthy lifestyles while at the same time speaking OUT against Monsanto and standing UP for your food and health FREEDOMS!  Lynnette brings you enlightenment on these issues.

We want to thank those companies who have already come aboard our amazing mission tours. We look forward to having YOU as part of our team to help us empower the nation.  With out you, we cannot keep the tours going. Let YOUR voices be heard! Please take a look at our fan page on FB to see the excitement of the previous tours.  Also take a look at our website for more details about Lynnette and the mission she stands behind and why.  http://www.fuelforthebody.org%20  You can see the other participants there as well, such as our newest rider: Christy Claybaker of iBody Directory in Springfield, MO.  This awesome directory brings to one place, the true natural health professionals.  We now have, as you will see below, Maryam Henein, producer of Vanishing of the Bees participating with us. 

Please see our UPDATES tab here for the announcements such as this just in:

the HUMAN REVOLUTION band will be touring with us part of the way.  If you have not heard him, then go check out his site today on our update tab.  What a great way to tour with this awesome band!

Now see the latest UPDATES in our update tab to see our next supporter: Liana Werner-Grey; Astralian Actress and author of The Earth Diet, who will be participating. Please read the announcement about Liana in our UPDATES.  :-)

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need the $15,000 to fund the entire 30 day tour.  We have funded the last three tours out of pocket and with the help of a few sponsors. (our other sponsors help with super foods)  This $$ goes entirely to the tour, advertising in papers, radio and etc.  Also we NOW have 5 people touring. (4 riders and support vehicle driver)  Therefore, food and extra gear for each person.  As well as extra hotel room for the extra people.  Of course we do couch surfing as much as we can, however the more people we have the harder it is to find a couch surfing family to host us.
  • We need to make a HUGE impact during October as we push to get our foods labeled. Also pays for the awesome banner we make for each tour, flyers, literature to pass out (as we make many more copies of everything along the tour since we run out often). The $$ also affords us gas for the support vehicle, & other miscellaneous for 5 people and our "Fueling" foods for 30 days.
  • The perks you get are awesome!  Pleasea view all the perks to the side to see what you get for your kind support. Also see gallery for pics.  You get YOUR NAME mentioned in our THANK YOUS on all our blogs, social media pages, website and depending on how much you contribute, you will get your name on our banner. Please see sponsorship on our website:  www.fuelforthebody.org 
  • The only perks that were given to us on sponsorship are:  Manitoba Harvest protein powders and the oil.  All other perks were purchased at a discount from Lynnette Pate already.
  • Even if we do not raise the complete $15,000, then all we raise DEFINITELY helps our mission.  There are always UN Expected expenses that come up, such as brakes for the car, new tires (for car and bikes), oil change and etc as we experienced on our last tour from Washington to AZ.  Due to the rough terrain on the routes in Nevada and AZ mountains.  ;-)  So as you can see, the $$ will be well appreciated.

The Impact

  • Our project is vital to the nation.  We speak in high schools, colleges and different events to enlighten the public on WHO Monsanto is and WHAT GMO's are and MSG's. WE have been very successful in reaching a nation already who would not have had any idea of what is in their food supply.  WE EMPOWER the nation in a POSITIVE way.  Lynnette's book helps you to better understand all this.
  • You can see our success of previous tours via facebook:  http://www.facebook.com/fuelforthebody you can see photos, stops, and all events.
  • You will also 'bee' delighted to know that by helping fund this tour, you will be helping us to help the Project: HONEY COLONY with Maryam Henein, producer of Vanishing of the Bees.  We have joined forces to have an even larger impact on the nation.  We MUST save our pollinators.  Using toxic pesticides, weed killers and GMO seeds, all poison and kill the bees.  DON'T LET THIS HAPPEN.
  • Want to know who puts THEIR TRUST in us? WE have some GREAT national companies who help give us super food snacks for the tour as well as give us samples & coupons to pass out to the public on each stop. Or they are great promotional supporters & sponsors.   You can see them on our webpages and fan pages.  To name a few:  Manitoba Harvest, Celtic Sea Sale, Organic Consumers Association, Guayaki Yerba Mate, Navitas Naturals, Natures Path Organic Foods, Ecco Bella and Core Health Products, Ashley Koff RD (Ashley Koff Approved), NON GMO Project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please post this to all your social media pages.  If you have a local paper in our areas of events, then please share this. If you know a radio host, ask them to invite us as a guest on their program.  If you know of an event in the areas, please talk to the coordinators to invite us to ave a booth or even a small spot to say 15 minutes worth of what we do.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! This is a great way to get our project noticed.

**All promotional items will be delivered to the contributors by Sept. 7, 2012.  Unless you claimed the LYNNETTE Doll, then she will be delivered by Sept. 28.  This is to have all deliveries go out at same time.  :-)

That's it!  Remember our motto:  TOGETHER We Can Make A Difference~

story:
FOR THE 6th YEAR IN A ROW, COUCHSURFING CAMP, or rather, "COUCHBURNING CAMP" IS A GO!

------------------------But only with your help!------------------------

CouchBurners! Assemble! 2012! Hosted by active participants from the ‘CouchSurfing.org’ project and present on playa since 2007, CouchSurfing Camp returns once again and needs your help! The 'great ticket sale debacle of 2012' left many primary organizers of camp from years past without tickets and with no early access tickets or placement occuring for this year we are left the enviable task -believe it or not- of coordinating a land-grab in order to place and operate camp!

We have a functional, developing plan for how this will remain a fun, organic 'home' experience for virgins and veterans alike, but first things first......

WE GOTTA PAY FOR ALL OUR CRAP WE LEFT IN OUR STORAGE!

Tent and shade infrastructure, bicycles, games, hammocks, the ‘Mutant Sofa’ (a wild sofa pyramid, more or less ;-P ) our Couch Bar, and more... It’s all in jeopardy! We gotta HANDLE THIS! This IndieGoGo campaign is to do just that! What costs money....

  • Normal camp participation fees would include paying off the yearly storage fee of $800
  • Server/Hosting fees in the DIGITAL realm
  • IndieGoGo takes a percentage - successfully reaching $900 = $837 after fees!

THE IMPACT

Since we’re effectively re-tooling this year in not requiring dues, the plan is to handle the bare minimum of fees aforementioned, carrying us into next year. Our handling of this here and now, slim on more experienced leadership participants in this year's burn, will free us up to iron out and implement any sort of plan for a danceparty/CSmeet'n'greet/Orwhatever for camp!

CAN YOU PARTICIPATE? REGARDLESS OF ATTENDING OR CAMPING WITH US THIS YEAR? OF COURSE!

First and foremost, you can participate by pitching in and spreading the word! There are ‘incentives’ if that entices you to pitch in at one level or another! Also, for our Camp Mates who may not make it to the playa this year, if you make a donation to this "Save Our Storage" drive, that donation WILL BE DEDUCTED from any camp fees for your next trip to the playa with CouchBurners! 

We understand that some people just can’t contribute directly financially, but that means you can help by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! There are nifty 'share' tools/widgets at your disposal for this kind of help!

Take a look, and then clickity-click away!

 

PLEASE & THANK YOU! :D
story_txt:
FOR THE 6th YEAR IN A ROW, COUCHSURFING CAMP, or rather, "COUCHBURNING CAMP" IS A GO!
------------------------But only with your help!------------------------ CouchBurners! Assemble! 2012! Hosted by active participants from the ‘CouchSurfing.org’ project and present on playa since 2007, CouchSurfing Camp returns once again and needs your help! The 'great ticket sale debacle of 2012' left many primary organizers of camp from years past without tickets and with no early access tickets or placement occuring for this year we are left the enviable task -believe it or not- of coordinating a land-grab in order to place and operate camp!
We have a functional, developing plan for how this will remain a fun, organic 'home' experience for virgins and veterans alike, but first things first......
WE GOTTA PAY FOR ALL OUR CRAP WE LEFT IN OUR STORAGE!
Tent and shade infrastructure, bicycles, games, hammocks, the ‘Mutant Sofa’ (a wild sofa pyramid, more or less ;-P ) our Couch Bar, and more... It’s all in jeopardy! We gotta HANDLE THIS! This IndieGoGo campaign is to do just that! What costs money....

Normal camp participation fees would include paying off the yearly storage fee of $800
Server/Hosting fees in the DIGITAL realm
IndieGoGo takes a percentage - successfully reaching $900 = $837 after fees!
THE IMPACT
Since we’re effectively re-tooling this year in not requiring dues, the plan is to handle the bare minimum of fees aforementioned, carrying us into next year. Our handling of this here and now, slim on more experienced leadership participants in this year's burn, will free us up to iron out and implement any sort of plan for a danceparty/CSmeet'n'greet/Orwhatever for camp!
CAN YOU PARTICIPATE? REGARDLESS OF ATTENDING OR CAMPING WITH US THIS YEAR? OF COURSE!
First and foremost, you can participate by pitching in and spreading the word! There are ‘incentives’ if that entices you to pitch in at one level or another! Also, for our Camp Mates who may not make it to the playa this year, if you make a donation to this "Save Our Storage" drive, that donation WILL BE DEDUCTED from any camp fees for your next trip to the playa with CouchBurners! 
We understand that some people just can’t contribute directly financially, but that means you can help by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! There are nifty 'share' tools/widgets at your disposal for this kind of help!
Take a look, and then clickity-click away!
 
PLEASE & THANK YOU! :D

story:
Our Story

You may be familiar with Tammy Sytch, wrestling's Original Diva (Sunny from the WWE), for her abilities in the wrestling industry, but did you know she's an avid and passionate cook?  We are launching her first cookbook and would love you to be apart of it in a very unique campaign!


 
 

The Impact

This book will include recipes from Tammy as well as stories from the road!  With your contribution to help us raise funds for the publication of this project, you too will be apart of history!  This is the first book that will ever be published with the help of wrestling fans in the wrestling industry where they will also be part of the success!

 
 

What We Need & What You Get

For your contribution, you will receive:


-$15:  8x10 photo of Tammy 

-$20:  Personalized 8x10 photo of Tammy

-$25:   Name listed in Thank You section of book

-$50:   Name listed plus personally signed copy of book

-$100:  Name listed plus personally signed copy of book plus photo of Tammy signing the book

-$500:  Name listed plus personally signed copy plus short video of Tammy signing and thanking you for your donation.  Be a part of History. Anyone who donates $500 not only receives a signed copy of the book, but will also have one of YOUR recipes featured. Yes, Tammy will make you famous!



 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Thanks for supporting Tammy!
Bambi Weavil
Tammy's Agent

TammySytchOnline.com

OutImpactProductions.com

story:
Our Story

My name is Valeria Lopez, I am 25 years old. I met Victor 5 years ago and we were married immediately. We were meant for each other and had been happily married - until February 20, 2012. On our way back from Tijuana with 6 other family members and friends, after traveling hundreds of miles, our driver lost control of the SUV we were traveling in, and we flipped over as we took our freeway exit (E. Capitol Expressway) a few blocks away from our home. Victor, who was 30, died on impact after being ejected and trampled by the vehicle. I was also ejected from the vehicle - breaking my leg and spine at the neck.  I am telling my story to the IndieGoGo community because I need help with covering medical and funeral expenses for this tragic event.  When the accident happened, I was just starting up my own small business.  Unfortunately, I wasn't covered by medical insurance, and so have to face this horrible situation uninsured.

The Impact

Victor and I had just purchased our first home and I more than likely will not be able to maintain it. I will need extensive therapeutic care after the 12-hour surgery to rebuild my spine, and will need constant care. My mother has offered to move to San Jose from Mexico to take care of me. My family and I have exhausted any savings we had and are in need of help.

What We Need & What You Get

Any and all funds raised will go to cover my medical bills, therapy, and Victor's funeral services. Whatever amount I can raise through the help of the online community will go a long way to helping us pay off these bills, which have surpassed six digits. My family and friends will also be holding events, car washes, raffles, etc. to raise more funds.


When you donate, my family and friends will say thank you with a modest act of kindness. I will send you images of the fundraising events, updates on my recuperation/progress, traditional Mexican dish recipes, and anything else we can upon request.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by saying a little prayer, and I ask you to please spread the word for my cause. Tools such as Twitter, Facebook, blogs, etc. will help amplify my plea.


God bless you.

story:
Who We Are

The Boone Planta Water Project (BPWP)-- an Austin-based humanitarian organization -- is attempting to raise money for its second water project in Latin America (*We are in the process of becoming a Texas-recognized non-profit, hence not yet tax deductible). After the death of our friend, brother and son, Boone Planta, a group of volunteers banded together, all in mourning, to find a way to honor Boone's name and legacy. 

Past Projects

In May of 2010, 13 other volunteers and I raised enough money to build a well in the remote Honduran village of El Zapote. The volunteers worked laboriously in the hot Central American sun, side by side with the local recipients, digging PVC pipe trench and getting to intimately know the people whom they were helping. This interaction is a pivotal aspect of BPWP's mission, since it gives a face and personality to an otherwise anonymous donation. Through this interaction, we realize--despite the geographical distance--we are all very alike.

For me, it taught me how good giving can feel; the trip demonstrated how fulfilling it can be when you give your heart to a cause that is bigger than yourself, bigger than personal advancement or career ambition. It made me feel whole.

That is why Meredith (Boone's sister) and I teamed up to put together another trip, this time in Guatemala. We realized how transformative these experiences can be, especially for Americans (like us) who so infrequently get the chance to drop everything in our lives for the sake of giving to others. We understood after Honduras how exhilarating that can be, so we wanted others to feel that too!

What We Need & Why

We also understand the gravity of the situation in Latin America: 1 in 8 people are without clean drinking water--that is about 77 million people. The women in the town of La Avellana, Guatemala have to travel 3 km on bicycle every day in order to fetch clean water!

While we cant help all 77 million--yet--we want the BPWP to serve those we can help, while being ambassadors of our country, and showering strangers with love, care and respect.

But in order to accomplish our mission, we need your help!

We are trying to raise $30,000; $25,000 will go towards the construction of the water well, and the labor and materials that go along with it. The other $5,000 will help cover costs of food, transportation and rental equipment. If we surpass our goal, the funds will serve as an endowment for next year's water project!

These funds will go towards providing a water well for the people of La Avellana and will cover the cost of piping (1800 meters) so that each of the 120 home will have water right at their doorstep!

Please donate whatever monetary funds you can and please share our campaign on social media (as the sharing and liking will help boost our Indiegogo campaign algorithm!).

Peace. Love. Water.

Cheers,

Cameron


#BPWP2015

*Donations are not tax-deductible at this time.  Our goal is to achieve a 501c3 status!

**To share our campaign, use the share tools next to our campaign video!

***We will be providing updates on our journey all the way up and through our trip to Guatemala (we will take LOTS of pictures)!

story:
Birth Rhythms Future Fund

A group of women who believe that Birth Rhythms is an essential service for Saskatchewan families got together and decided to do something about including Birth Rhythms in our futures.  Many Saskatchewan families have shared what it is Birth Rhythms means to them. 

The video tells their stories.

Birth Rhythms Future Fund video--mobile version.


What is Birth Rhythms:

  • Birth Rhythms is Saskatoon's venue for professional, independent, maternal health and fitness supports. Centered on the goal of empowering women with the information and resources that they need during the journey of motherhood, Birth Rhythms offers many indispensable services.
  • Birth Rhythms is an inclusive and welcoming organization, One that delivers the same level of loving care to all women; regardless of income. Because of this, we are asking for your support in order to be able to continue to work with and connect to the families of Saskatchewan.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is $100,000
  • A one-year operating budget is $100,000
  • Administrative staff costs are approximately $2500 per month
  • Support groups cost approximately $1000 per month
  • Purchase of supplies is regularly required, including items for fitness classes, prenatal education, and other outreach materials
  • This money will be the operating budget for one year and will sustain Birth Rhythms until the revamped business plan will cover the costs, again.
  • Your contribution will  help keep all the workshops and programming in place.  All of the money we raise together will go towards enabling strong women, happy babies, healthy families, and supportive communities.
If we do not make the entire goal amount from this campaign, any money raised will keep as much programming as possible in place; the whole campaign amount means all Birth Rhythms'  services and workshops continue to run as they do now.

There is a wide range of fantastic perks available!  

Bracelets, books, cloth pads and diapers, gift cards, clothing, birth pools, infant massage, complete doula packages, and much more!

About Birth Rhythms
Birth Rhythms is unique because it is independent of federal and provincial funding which gives it a wider scope of maternal health services.  It is currently a sole proprietorship that operates like a not for profit, which keeps costs low and ensures accessibility.

Birth Rhythms started as an eclectic mini-mall of birth services and it is shifting to a more centralized approach to reduce costs to families and improve administrative efficiency. Profits, after expenses of this go towards free programming and low cost. 

Some examples of this free programming are:

  • Breastfeeding drop in (weekly) 
  • Parent 2 Parent: a peer group geared towards moms with babies and toddlers
  • Cesarean support & recovery group
  • Perinatal mood disorder support groups and drop in
  • One to one postnatal mood disorder support groups
  • H.E.A.R.T.S, baby loss support group

Some of the courses offered have a fee, but it is set at a dollar amount that a single income family can afford.  This makes the programming accessible.  Some examples are:

  • Birth trauma recovery group
  • Daddy boot camp, for men taught by men
  • Naturally Yours, childbirth education
  • Labour Intensive, childbirth skills for couples
  • Postpartum Survival, for the first three months with baby
  • Breastfeeding basics, taught by a certified Lactation Consultant
  • Cloth diapering workshop 
  • Access to low cost rental cloth diapers and breastfeeding pumps
As well as the regular programming, Birth Rhythms offers on-site drop ins and consulting by lactation educators, lactation consultants as well as doulas. 

Fitness classes are also offered, such as yoga, physio yoga, and dance; all programs prepare a woman's mind and body for birth.

The studio and rooms are also rented out by professionals offering complimentary fitness and maternal health services as well as hosting family-oriented events, for the lowest cost in the city.  These profits are used to fund the core programs as listed above, and rent.

ONE ON ONE services include comprehensive birth planning and birth support, postpartum and lactation support, baby wearing and clothing diapering consultations: again, priced with the single income family in mind.

Birth Rhythms also brings in educators from around North America for their Professional Development Series; A program used to continue to develop our birth professional community.  Some examples of previous workshops hosted at Birth Rhythms are:
  • Jack Newman, Breastfeeding
  • Integrative Neonatal Resuscitation- Karen Strange
  • Midwifery Skills Lab, Ancient Art Midwifery Institute 
  • CAPPA Lacation Educator Course
  • CAPPA Post Partum Doula Course 
  • Advanced doula training in essential oils, rebozo, acupressure, craniosacral, supporting sexual abuse survivors, breastfeeding and lactation education, postpartum, baby loss, 
  • and Birth Rhythms' own certified doula training. 
Future Projects:

Birth Rhythms is currently working with the following organizations:
  • Saskatoon Family Services to expand the Parent2Parent program
  • Saskatoon Tribal Council to deliver doula training and lactation consulting on six reserves
  • Saskatoon West Side Clinic to put support groups in place for HIV positive mothers
  • Saskatoon Sexual Assault Center to provide appropriate support groups for women in their childbearing year.

With your contributions, Saskatchewan families of all financial backgrounds will continue to have access to the indispensable services Birth Rhythms provides.


Visit Birth Rhythms

http://www.birthrhythms.ca

Saskatoon Family Services to expand the Parent2Parent program

http://www.birthrhythms.ca

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for taking the time to consider this campaign. We are a team of family and friends who care very much for Maeva. She is young, beautiful and such a sweet girl who radiates positivity and is kind and generous beyond means. She has recently taken very ill in Panama and was hospitalized and showing no real sign of recovery. She desperately needs to return to Canada so she can receive free health care and critical surgery to save her  life. The reason we are raising money is that an emergency helicopter and emergency air crew are needed to transport Maeva back to Canada and keep her alive. This will cost roughly $45,000 and the funds raised will go towards this to help the family cover these expenses. It's a lot of money but Maeva's life is at stake and is something we cannot put a price on.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funding needed will help cover the cost of the emergency airlift from Panama City, Panama to Canada. Her situation is critical and she cannot take a regular flight nor can she afford the time to wait. We want to have her in the air and on the road to recovery by Monday, February 17, 2014. Time is of the essence.
  • By helping our cause, you will get a personalized thank you letter from Michaelle, her aunt and a customized thank you card on behalf of Maeva's family and friends.
  • Any donations are appreciated and will be rewarded with the perks listed below
  • ANY donation between the value of $100-1000 will automatically be entered into a draw for an additional 2-night stay (including breakfast) in a resort in one Panama's finest beaches.
  • If the financial goal is not reached, the money received will still go towards helping cover the cost of the emergency air evacuation.

The Impact


  • As a contributor you will be helping to save the life of a very kind and generous, helping to comfort her family in this very stressful situation and easing their discomfort as much as possible in this impossible situation.
  • You will be giving hope to her friends and family because we all want to help her pull through this.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can make a donation, but every one can still help and share this campaign to increase Maeva's chances. She is a sweet girl and she would do the same for you if you asked her to. Sharing is caring and all it takes is a click of a button. It's that simple.

story:
Sitting at a desk for long periods of time takes a massive toll on our existence. But that's only because we let it happen!


The human body was not designed to sit.  It was designed to move fluently and painlessly with a full range of motion.  


Repetitive strain injuries are nasty, stubborn animals.  They can be beaten if we take an effective, well-thought-out approach against them.


HIGH SPEED HEALTH will give you a shocking perception of how badly we destroy our bodies every day.  Then, we'll attack the pain with creative, yet fundamental ways of healing and self-maintenance.  Finally, the focus of the book will shift to preventing future injuries.


I've been an athlete all my life, but the most destructive thing I've ever done to my body was sit at a desk full-time. 


The average part-time athlete probably trains no more than 10 hours a week.  That sounds healthy, but what steps are taken to live a healthy lifestyle the other 158 hours in the week?


This book doesn't focus on providing info for athletes during exercise.  It takes a unique approach on how to improve quality of life and physique during your time outside of the gym.  The solution lies in inexpensive self-maintenance and making small, open-minded changes to your everyday life.  


My goal is to raise $1900 to publish my book in both digital format and physical paperback.  For $1900, I didn't pick out the most expensive or elaborate publishing package.  It's just a basic, professional process that will make my message look good while being read at a fast pace. Because we all know, time is of the essence when living the busy rat race.  


If I don't hit my goal of $1900, the funds I do raise will still go toward the publishing of my book.  I will cover the rest out of my pocket.  If I raise more than $1900, the extra money will go into a more attractive publishing option.  Either that, or I'll put the money into marketing/advertising my book (most likely with Facebook ads).  


I've poured blood, sweat, and tears into this project for the last 4 years.  I've been determined since day one.  One way or another, I will get it successfully completed.  It's important for contributors to help me reach my goal to get professionally published.  Once my book is published, my message can be spread across a generation of athletic desk jockeys that are destroying their bodies more and more by the day.  My book will improve quality of life and physique for readers everywhere.  


My mission is to provide quick and direct info that will help you learn how to heal pain and prevent injuries.  We've become stagnant and complacent desk jockeys in today's rat race.  I'm 100% confident that HIGH SPEED HEALTH will make the world a healthier, happier, and better place.


As you'll see when you check out my perks, even making the least expensive level of donation will receive a copy of my book, HIGH SPEED HEALTH.


Please help me make the world a better, happier place.  Make noise about HIGH SPEED HEALTH and introduce me to your social circles.  I promise that I won't let you and the rest of my readers down.  


Help me out by sharing my funding project via social media using Indiegogo's share tools.  


Thanks in advance!

Todd Bowen

HIGH SPEED HEALTH


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Todd Bowen is a wellness coach and former desk jockey.  He's passionate and obsessive about finding the quickest, most effective ways of healing pain.  He's addicted to high human performance, good posture, beach volleyball, and helping people.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
story_txt:
Sitting at a desk for long periods of time takes a massive toll on our existence. But that's only because we let it happen!
The human body was not designed to sit.  It was designed to move fluently and painlessly with a full range of motion.  Repetitive strain injuries are nasty, stubborn animals.  They can be beaten if we take an effective, well-thought-out approach against them.HIGH SPEED HEALTH will give you a shocking perception of how badly we destroy our bodies every day.  Then, we'll attack the pain with creative, yet fundamental ways of healing and self-maintenance.  Finally, the focus of the book will shift to preventing future injuries.I've been an athlete all my life, but the most destructive thing I've ever done to my body was sit at a desk full-time. The average part-time athlete probably trains no more than 10 hours a week.  That sounds healthy, but what steps are taken to live a healthy lifestyle the other 158 hours in the week?This book doesn't focus on providing info for athletes during exercise.  It takes a unique approach on how to improve quality of life and physique during your time outside of the gym.  The solution lies in inexpensive self-maintenance and making small, open-minded changes to your everyday life.  My goal is to raise $1900 to publish my book in both digital format and physical paperback.  For $1900, I didn't pick out the most expensive or elaborate publishing package.  It's just a basic, professional process that will make my message look good while being read at a fast pace. story:
Our Story

AVA is the most comprehensive Autism data collection and analytic software application.  Our vision at AVA is to improve care and outcomes for autistic individuals. Our platform facilitates caregiver collaboration, enables personalized treatments, and improves outcomes for Autism.  We have gathered experts and thought leaders in the field of autism, technology, and data sciences to create a proprietary patient-centric collaboration and data analytic software platform.  Our mobile app is a collaboration tool, intended to make the job of all autism caregivers easier, more efficient, and more effective.  This includes physicians, therapists, special education teachers, and especially parents.

The statistics on Autism are daunting.  Prevalence of Autism Spectrum Disorder has tripled in just 10 years, reaching 1 out of 50 children in 2013.  We still don’t know much about Autism and we have no drugs to address the core symptoms. In many cases, despite several therapies and interventions, we are seeing little progress with our children.  Many of our children need constant care and multiple caregivers.  This care is complicated by a lack of transparency and coordination between caregivers.

      



How it works

We have developed unique tools and a separate portal for each caregiver around an autistic individual.  The entire care team child will create a comprehensive baseline of the child’s diagnosis, treatments and other non-medical interventions on our web platform.  Then each caregiver including parents will input daily care data in a simple and easy to use mobile application.

They can then track their child’s progress along educational and behavioral goals as well as understand their child’s responsiveness to medications and other interventions.  Early intervention is a key aspect of improving progress and outcomes for your autistic child.  The app’s coordination and intelligent tools will ensure that the right people are alerted where attention and intervention is needed.   

           

                                        



AVA is an intelligent platform. When it has enough data about your child and about other children with autism, it develops associations between the diagnosis and all different therapies and interventions used and it will develop ways of recommending potential treatments and interventions and medications that may work best for your child based on the patterns it finds.  This will allow the physicians to create a treatment plan that is outcomes driven and personalized for your child.

This is the true promise of personalized medicine.

       

Where we are

We need to add a few new features to the app and roll it out across a larger community.  We are raising $1 million to grow the product, engineering, and patient support teams. We have raised some of the funds from multiple sources.  We are trying to raise $50,000 from our community - from those that have been impacted by Autism or any disease, from those that understand the complexities of raising a child with a life long disease, and from anyone who is as excited as we are about changing healthcare delivery at its foudnation by focusing on what matters the most - the patient. 

Perks


        

Our Roadmap

                     

      

Our Impact

AVA Health solves an important Autism and healthcare problem.   The platform has a direct impact on improving care for every patient.  Parents can track their child's progress and make more informed decisions about program choices.  Real-time access to patient data enables physicians to intervene early in case progress is slow or treatments are ineffective.   Special Education teachers, therapists, and other care providers can quickly track a child's progress in the context of all other treatments and tailor programs more effectively.  This collective effort and early intervention will potentially lead to improved outcomes for patients.  

Additionally, through advanced analytics on comprehensive data around patients, the AVA platform will help advance our knowledge of Autism and define predictive models for more effective treatments, drug development, and potentially even prevention. 

Use Case   


     

Potential Risks

As with other software applications, AVA faces the adoption challenge.  While we feel that we have addressed this challenge with engaging features and incentives, there is always the risk that parents, care providers, and physicians may not engage with the platform.  Also, similar to other healthcare software companies, while we have built a fully compliant platform and have thought about every potential aspect of compliance, there is always a risk of intervention by regulatory agencies.  Finally, like all start-ups, we always face the challenges of not getting fully funded and having to adjust milestones and timelines accordingly.  This may delay our execution and full roll-out of our platform.


       

How you can help us

There are so many ways you could help us.  You could of course contribute to this campaign and help us get to or exceed our goal so we can continue to build an amzaing product and roll-it out across the community.  You can also join us as a partner or as a member of our Beta Program.  Finally, a great way to help AVA is by spearding the word to anyone who may be interested in supporting us either in the campaign, as a partner, or as a member of our Beta Program.

story:
With your help we have raised over 24,000 dollars and we are proud to announce that prototyping has begun.  We now need to raise funds for the second phase of our project, clinical trials.  For more information, please visit http://igg.me/at/TuckerValvePart2.  The campaign site will go live Saturday December 5th at 4pm.

Thanks again for your support!

Ultravet Medical Devices

Hello, my name is George Kramer and I have been a veterinary cardiologist for over 25 years.  I founded a veterinary medical device company, Ultravet Medical Devices, to create devices which are designed to treat common problems in veterinary medicine which are difficult to treat using current available treatments.  We are currently hard at work on developing a transcatheter valve device which can be used to treat dogs with degenerative mitral/tricuspid valve disease.  We need your help.

Severe Degenerative Valve Disease

Degenerative valve disease is a very common problem in dogs.  Small breed dogs, including Cavalier King Charles Spaniels, poodles, terriers, among others, are most commonly affected.  Currently there is no medical cure.  This disease causes the mitral or tricuspid valve leaflets to become abnormally thickened.  This hinders the valves ability to form a tight seal between the atrium and ventricle.  As a result, blood in the ventricle now flows back into the atrium through the leaky valve (known as regurgitation) instead of moving forward from the ventricle into the aorta or pulmonary artery.  The condition is progressive and over time the valve will continue to degrade until the heart can no longer compensate.  The result is congestive heart failure, a condition in which edema fluid fills the lungs.  Medical therapy can help control the clinical signs, but eventually most dogs die of the disease.

                     

Medical therapy for severe degenerative valve disease is palliative at best in both dogs and in man.  The definitive treatment for severe degenerative valve disease in man is surgical valve replacement or repair.  Surgical valve repair options in dogs have intrinsic limitations and is not available at most veterinary specialty centers or universities.  Transcatheter valve replacement is a potential new therapeutic option that avoids the limitations and complications of open heart valve replacement or repair.  It would also be more accessible, less expensive and much less invasive compared to surgical repair or replacement. 

                               

                  Pictured above is an echo image showing mitral valve regurgitation

Ultravet Medical Devices performed a pilot study in 2013.  The purpose of this study was to demonstrate that transcatheter valve replacement is a viable therapeutic treatment in dogs with degenerative valve disease.  Three Labrador retrievers with severe tricuspid valve dysplasia were selected for transcatheter valvular replacement.  All three dogs had severe right-sided heart enlargement, large tricuspid regurgitations and heart failure.  All of these dogs were on multiple cardiac medications that could not stop the worsening heart failure.  

         

                  Normal K9 heart on x-ray                 Congestive heart failure on x-ray

An experimental, prototype transcatheter valve was designed and manufactured by Ultravet Medical Devices.  The device was named the Tucker valve after my dog Tucker who was one of the dogs in the study.  It was passed down the jugular vein under fluoroscopic and ultrasonic guidance, fixed into the apex at the right ventricle and deployed between the tricuspid leaflets.  Intra-operative  and post-op echocardiography showed marked reduction of the tricuspid regurgitant jet in all three patients.  The Tucker Valve™ was successfully deployed into the right ventricle via the transcatheter jugular approach in all three dogs.  The device resulted in significant reduction of the naturally occurring tricuspid regurgitation in all three dogs.  This study shows that transcatheter valve replacement is possible in dogs and can dramatically reduce the amount of regurgitation.  In addition to the Tucker Valve™ we also have designed a second valve device called the CoApt Valve™.

Here is a video of Layla after having the Tucker Valve™ placed.  The procedure is minimally invasive and patients can be up and walking around not long after surgery. 

Did You Know?

What We Need & What You Get 
We need your help to move this project forward.  Donated funds will be used to create prototypes of the valve and perform clinical trials with the eventual goal of bringing the device to market.  It is extremely important to me that we create a cure for this terrible disease and keep those dogs suffering from it healthy and happy, enabling them to live long lives with their families.  Hopefully, with your help either the Tucker Valve™ or the CoApt Valve™ will allow that to happen. 


Pictured below is a color flow Doppler image from one of the patients in the pilot study.  The color mosaic indicates severe tricuspid regurgitation.


Pictured below is a color flow Doppler image from the same patient after the valve device was placed in position demonstrating a marked reduction in the amount of regurgitation.


To show our appreciation for your support, we have numerous perks available.  Some of those perks include a framed picture of our mascot Ollie (pictured below), a commemorative brick on our pet walkway at our partner facility, Atlantic Coast Veterinary Specialists, a 3D hologram of a K9 heart with chronic mitral valve disease, and two tickets to the 2016 Westminster show in NYC.

The Impact & Timeline
The timing of this project is optimal for making a measurable and significant impact within the veterinary community. What makes our valve so unique is that it is a curative solution versus current standard medical management of the disease. It is also minimally invasive and much more cost effective and accessible than open-heart surgery. By having a more affordable option, we will be able to reach a wider patient population and make a solution to degenerative mitral/tricuspid valve disease much more attainable to dog owners everywhere.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q. What are the most common signs of canine degenerative valve disease?

A. Common clinical signs include coughing, difficulty breathing, lethargy and syncope.


Q. How long does transcatheter valve replacement surgery typically take?

A. The surgery usually takes one hour.


Q. Is the procedure painful?

A. The procedure is minimally invasive and requires only a small incision into the jugular vein.  Patients are given pain medication to prevent discomfort.


Q. When can my pet come home and how long is the recovery period?

A. With most cases, your pet will be discharged 1-2 days after surgery.  Normal activity may resume upon discharge.


Q. What will my pets quality of life be like after surgery?

A.  If the valve replacement is successful, your pets quality of life will be normal and he/she can resume/continue day-to-day activities.


Other Ways You Can Help

While we appreciate your financial support, we understand that a donation may not be possible for all who are passionate about our cause.  If you are unable to donate you can still help us by spreading the word and making some noise about our campaign.  Please share with your friends, family and co-workers on social media and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to make doing so easier!

story:
Please help! Give what you can and make some noise! Sign our change.org petition at http://bit.ly/equalfertilityrights and spread the word!

you can also follow our journey step-by-step on our blog at http://coolestmomsever.tumblr.com/

Hi! We are Jill and Sarah Soller-Mihlek. Hairdresser and music teacher, respectively, married for 3 years. We're just your average Brooklyn couple looking to join the stroller pack. Unfortunately, it hasn't been so easy for us. As of July, 2014, we had already spent close to a year and more than $10,000 out-of-pocket trying to conceive both on our own and with the help of a certified nurse-midwife, and so were referred to a reproductive endocrinologist(RE). The treatments provided by our RE have a higher rate of success, but come with an even higher price tag. Our insurance company will not cover the insemination procedures because their definition of infertility applies only to heterosexual couples. But we're not ready to give up! We need help not only to fund our continued fertility treatments, but also to raise awareness about health insurance companies' discriminatory practices.


Our goal is to raise $5200. This will give us two more chances to conceive a child.

Each month, we have to spend:

$1000 on donor sperm from Cryos International

$100 on prescriptions (Clomid and Ovidrel)

$1300 on intrauterine inseminations ($650 per procedure, two per cycle are recommended)

$50-200 on doctor and clinic fees


Even if we don't reach our entire goal, every contribution will be incredibly helpful in relieving the huge financial and psychological burden that we face.


We'd also like to offer something in return for your generosity! Check out the "Perks" section to see whats in it for you.

And it doesn't stop there! We've also created a petition asking both the governor and health commissioner of New York State to pass a law preventing insurance companies from discriminating against families like ours. In October, 2013, a law was passed in the state of California that requires insurance companies to extend fertility benefits to all insured persons- gay, straight, single, or married. If it can happen there, it can happen here.


We acknowledge and understand that nothing can guarantee that we will be able to conceive and give birth to a child, but we remain hopeful that with a little help, and a few more tries, we will realize our dreams of parenthood!
