$100 on prescriptions (Clomid and Ovidrel)
$1300 on intrauterine inseminations ($650 per procedure, two per cycle are recommended)
$50-200 on doctor and clinic fees

Even if we don't reach our entire goal, every contribution will be incredibly helpful in relieving the huge financial and psychological burden that we face.


We'd also like to offer something in return for your generosity! Check out the "Perks" section to see whats in it for you.
And it doesn't stop there! We've also created a petition asking both the governor and health commissioner of New York State to pass a law preventing insurance companies from discriminating against families like ours. In October, 2013, a law was passed in the state of California that requires insurance companies to extend fertility benefits to all insured persons- gay, straight, single, or married. If it can happen there, it can happen here.


We acknowledge and understand that nothing can guarantee that we will be able to conceive and give birth to a child, but we remain hopeful that with a little help, and a few more tries, we will realize our dreams of parenthood!

story:
Objective:  I need to raise $3,400 for power seat elevator for my power chair.

Short Summary:

My name is Matt Johnston. Here’s a little bit about myself. At a young age I was diagnosed with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy and over the years developed severe scoliosis. I’m now 37 years old. I have a trach and am Ventilator dependent. I’m in my power wheelchair up to 14 hours a day.

The reason I am doing so well is that I have a loving family. My Dad, Charlee Dollens, takes awesome care of me all day. My dad gave up a lot so that I could stay in our home. I also have great homecare nurses 8 hours a day and wonderful friends. All of them keep me going. I like to get out and do things as much as I can. I like to go to movies, concerts and out to eat once in a while. I like going on the trails in the summer. I love going to the shopping malls. I enjoy conversations with people and I’m a computer nut.

I have done a lot of things in my life, including lots of traveling etc.  My biggest accomplishment was in November 2006, when I was 29. After a three year pursuit, I achieved a HUGE first for the adaptive scuba community. I was the first ventilator dependent individual in the world to dive in the ocean. To learn more about my diving achievements go to my website at:  www.divingadream.org


What I need and the reason why:

I would like to have a seat elevator for my new power wheel chair. (model is Permobil M300) My current chair is on its last leg. Medical Assistance won’t cover the 8” power seat elevator, but they have approved everything else for it. The seat elevator would make my life much easier. I need to raise $3,400.  I have tried to have this approved several times with my current chair, but have been refused each time. They are refusing the seat elevator with my new chair also.  Medical Assistance will only approve it if you can get yourself in and out of bed.  I may not be able to use the seat elevator to get myself in and out of bed, but it would greatly increase the quality of my life.  It would help my care givers also.  It would be easier to transfer me in and out of the chair if I could raise my seat up.  Also, it would help with lowering the seat to fit under tables and raising up the seat to sit at counters.  I also get eyestrain and headaches from looking at things higher up.  I also get neck aches from looking at people who are towering over me.  Sometimes I can barely see their faces, I am so much lower in the chair.

Benefits

The elevator would help with eye strain when I am trying to look at things higher up. I get headaches due to eyestrain.  It would help to be able to lower the seat, in order to fit under tables.  It would help in reaching counters.  It would help me when talking to people, and help keep my neck in better alignment. I would be able to see their faces. It would help 8” Power Set elevator It would be easier for transfers in and out of bed, if the seat was able to elevate. It when sitting in a movie theater, or anywhere, when people are sitting in front of me and I can’t see over their heads.  That happens often…

If you are unable to contribute and would like to help please forward my story to any of your social network(s) that you may belong to.   Thanks so much for taking the time to read my story.



"

"So many of our dreams at first seem impossible, then they seem improbable, and then, when we summon the will, they soon become inevitable."

~Christopher Reeve~

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story: Alright everyone. Here's how the fees breakdown. I decided to include the tee shirt in the fee because why not. I figure it will be $10 extra per person after looking around a bit at quotes. We can always figure out the difference or put any extra into barbecue money. This team is based on having 16 people sign up. If more sign up then I can rebate the extra funds.

story:
At   Christmas  the worst thing that could happen..... happened , while cooking french fries in grease a little of the grease caught on fire and went up the side of the pot setting fire to the grease in the pot 
 like most people ,panic set in because the flame was quite big so figuring my extinguisher would do the trick the hubby hit it with the extinguisher and bam grease smoke  everywhere thank heaven he got it put out in time but not before he endured 3rd degree burns on his hands....he is ok 
At any rate the building we live in has made it very clear to us we are going to have to pay upwards of 10-15 thousand  dollars for damages  including the smoke damage and charing of cupboards, floors and appliances as well as the clean up of soot all over...WOW  Merry Christmas to us; and all while it is their insurance that will cover all the damages, it is we whom will be sued for the costs to replace the money to the insurance company.  We do in no way have this kind of money nor do we have people in this small town to  lean on for support financially or emotionally right now.    At this point we are not sure what to do we have nowhere to go nor do we have friends or family in this town to stay with .  We are however , temporairily ,allowed to remain in the apartment unit ,but it is unclear how long this will be allowed to happen and needless to say  other than ourselves ,we have 4 cats as well who are depending on us for shelter ...... we are devastated and we are very overwhelmed at the thought that we may be thrown into the streets with nowhere to go..
It was an accident that could have happened to anybody but unfortunately it has happened to 2 people whom are  terminally ill and unable to work . 
I know you are saying "why should we help them?" and "what makes them so important?"Well let me take the time to introduce ourselves to you all...... my hubby and I are 2  very kind hearted people who have  went out of way to help animals in need find homes as well as fed them all while having to buy extra bags of food each month that came out of our small living allowance.We have also helped several human aquaintances who were in need of immediate emergency housing and were not able to find it till much later but we let them stay with us and fed them til they were able to. We are not by any means saints but we try to give help where it is needed so I am asking you to please help us by donating a small amount to help us as we struggle with this traumatic experience that we now face.


Thank You So Very Much In Advance

Sincerely, Jacqueline and Family


These funds  will be used for the re-homing of ourselves and our 4 furbabies  . We have had to throw out quite a lot of soot and smoke damaged belongings for ourselves and our cats and we have been asked to leave the apartment a.s.a.p ,so that  the building representatives can get started on the repairs ,that we also have to pay for .....  most of the funds will be put into the bank as reserve for these payments . As well we will need to secure new lodgings replace food that was lost and clothing both bedding for ourselves and our cats that could not be cleaned of soot and smoke and or the fire itself.

  We only receive a   1 time per month fixed income ,at the months end and we had already paid the rent at the apartment that had the fire, so this money  is not going to be returned to  us; and we do not have any means to get help from family or friends  to help us with  the replacing of our necessary belongings , so we have created this fund to ask for much needed help financially to cover these costs .

story:
We are Bug-A-Salt.  After our first launch on indiegogo our business has really taken off.  The BUG-A-SALT is quickly becoming a household name and demand is growing faster than we can keep up.  In hopes to expand and develop our business further we ask for your help in exchange for a kick-ass new, more powerful CAMOFLY 2.0 design. $5 of every unit will be given back to support our veterans. Our goal is to donate as much as possible to those who protect our country. This campaign is only available in the United States. If you haven't seen the BUG-A-SALT Click Here


CAMOFLY BUG-A-SALT 2.0 Perk... contributors who purchase one CAMOFLY BUG-A-SALT 2.0 will receive free shipping costs for orders in the continental United States. We will donate $5 per unit to veterans in order to honor those who protect us and our freedoms. Get it while supplies last!



The Ultimate Buddy Deal Perk... includes one CAMOFLY BUG-A-SALT 2.0 and a Yellow BUG-A-SALT 2.0. The Yellow BUG-A-SALT 2.0 has the same look as the Original BUG-A-SALT launched 3 years ago. Although, its power and durability have increased tremendously. 



The Maggot Buddy Deal Perk... includes two Yellow BUG-A-SALT 2.0's and one container of Fuggin Maggots! The cold weather might be stopping you from firing at flies so we are here to help! Practice your skills with your own home grown flies.



BUG-A-SALT 2.0 BBQ Bundle Deal Perk... includes a BBQ Bib, a Mr. Pinch Bottle opener and an Original Yellow BUG-A-SALT 2.0. There stands a man, in front of a grill. He's got two hands, a cut of meat and a bare chest. He wipes the perspiration off of his forehead with his BBQ bib and picks up his trusty Bug-A-Salt. One shot at a time he methodically picks off every fly in sight. His lovely wife brings out an ice cold beer. She leaves the cap on, but not to fear; he has on his hip Mr. Pinch bottle opener...always near.



The BUG-A-SALT BIGGEST Deal Perk...includes one CAMOFLY BUG-A-SALT 2.0, one Yellow BUG-A-SALT 2.0, a BBQ Bib, a Mr. Pinch Bottle opener, an XXL Evolve T-Shirt, an Evolve Hat, and 500 maggots to care for and raise. Start your own fly hunting farm! Free shipping in the continental United States!



CAMOFLY BUG-A-SALT 2.0 Poster Perk…this one of a kind poster shows the iconic salt truck that our soldiers protected while battling for their lives. When the enemy became overpowering and was certainly going to demolish allied forces, the BUG-A-SALT CAMOFLY 2.0 showed up in the knick of time to restore order!



Dont Give a Sh*t bout a Flygun Perk... if you would like to donate to United States Military Veterans without having to purchase a BUG-A-SALT you are at the right place! 100% of the money raised from this perk will be given to those who have helped protect our country's freedom!


About Us

BUG-A-SALT miniaturized shotgun effect is generated through this ingenious design. Ordinary table salt is utilized as a lethal projectile with accuracy range within 3 feet. Bugs will remain whole for easy clean up.

SKELL INC. is a start-up company founded by the Santa Monica artist, Lorenzo Maggiore, as a vehicle to bring his artistic creations to commercial life. The initial product offering of SKELL INC. is the BUG-A-SALT insect eradication device. Through the help of family and friends, Lorenzo has pulled it off!  SKELL INC. is in the process of developing other interesting products in the near future on other planets.  Below is our original campaign - 

Meet the Team

We would appreciate your support!  If you like our idea and project, please spread the word and visit us at  www.bugasalt.com

Campaign Keywords:

BUG-A-SALT, Bugasalt, Skell Inc, A Killer Company, Insect, Insects, Fly, Flies, Horse Fly, Horeseflies, Bug, Bugs, Pests, Pesty Insects, Insect Eradication Device, Gadget, Not a Toy For Kids, Gun, Air Gun, Airgun, Salt, Ammunition, Ammo, Hunting, Hunter, Art, Design, Art and Design Project, Performance Art, Artist, Inventor, Invention, Entrepreneur, Surfer, Mosquito, Mosquitos, Earwig, Earwigs, Ants,  Don't Kill Beneficial Insects, Don't Kill Butterflies, Don't Kill Spiders, Adults Only, Fun, Quirky, Easy to Use, Non-Toxic, No Insecticide, Top Campaign, Overfunded, The Fly Movie, Hellstrom Chronicles, Mr. Pinch,  Limited Edition, Buddy Deal, Campaign Ending Special, BBQ, Special, Lone Gunman Package, Big Game Special, Arms Dealer, Container Load Deal, FPS Russia, Airsoft, Ordinary Table Salt, Pinch of Salt, Grassroots, No Batteries Needed, Patented, Patents, Youtube Channel, Pity the Fly, For the Pest Hunter, No Licensing, No Limits, Insect Hunter, Insect Madness, Bugs Will Remain Whole for Easy Clean Up, Santa Monica, Los Angeles, California, CA, US, USA, United States, Yellow, Black, Adults Only

story:
Deepmala is an only child of parents that believed in educating their daughter to become a teacher. When she got married, her husband forbade her to step out of the house to work. When she argued with him, he threw acid on her- obliterating her face (including her eyes) and ending not just her dream of teaching, but also any semblance of a 'normal' life that we all take for granted. Here is a news report with more information about her situation: http://www.pressreader.com/india/hindustan-time...

It has been 8 months since this barbaric act, and she has not started any reconstructive surgery yet due to lack of funds. Her father has sold his land to fund just the basic care. Now his resources have dried up. While reconstructive surgery could take more than $50,000, my goal is to raise $10,000 initially to help fund her basic upkeep.

The money raised here will go directly to Deepmala's bank account. Red Brigade (a local non-profit-https://www.facebook.com/redbrgd) is supporting Deepmala emotionally and will provide transparency on how this money will be used. I will follow up with them and provide regular updates on this page.

We all read about the atrocities on women and children. Here is your chance to do something about it. I am a single mother of a toddler girl and I want to make this world a better and safer place for all daughters (and sons).

I will follow up with them and provide regular updates on this page.We all read about the atrocities on women and children. Here is your chance to do something about it. I am a single mother of a toddler girl and I want to make this world a better and safer place for all daughters (and sons).

story:
When will they make me leave my home? 

    Will all my possessions be put out on the curb?

    What if I can't afford to move?

    These are all common questions we receive when a tenant calls us requesting assistance in defending an eviction.  For tenants who go to court unrepresented, most are unable to defend themselves and likely be ordered to leave their home in one week.  Tenants who have the help of a lawyer are often able to stay in their home, or negotiate more time to find a new place to live.  The Center for Disability & Elder Law (CDEL) assists clients facing eviction, and many other dire situations.  However, the need for free legal services far exceeds our ability to provide help to everyone who calls our office.  We need more volunteer pro bono attorneys!


    About the Center for Disability & Elder Law

    The Center For Disability & Elder Law (CDEL) provides quality legal services, pro bono, to low income seniors and persons with disabilities who reside in Chicago and Cook County, Illinois. We've been in the community for the past 30 years and last year alone, provided over $3 million in free legal support!

      We're a small organization with a huge reach. Working with thousands of low income individuals each year, we rely heavily on our volunteer network who, along with us, have truly embraced the pro bono ethic.  

      Now, we're bringing together the community to make sure we're meeting their most pressing needs.


      What We Need & What You Get

      Our clients are often in dire situations and need the help of a lawyer to assist them in navigating the legal system. Many of our clients are facing evictions actions and are one step away from being homeless. Others are being sued by collectors and at risk of having their bank accounts frozen which means they won't be able to buy food and medications.

      We need more pro bono legal volunteers and financial support to be able to take on these critical, more complex, longer-term cases!

      Your donation dollars will go to fund a recruitment campaign for qualified legal volunteers.

      With your help, this campaign will recruit 100 volunteers to take on our most critical cases in the next year. 


          The Impact

          • More than 80% of all low income individuals are unable to obtain legal representation.
          • 100% of individuals living in poverty  will experience at least one legal problem each year.

          The services we provide are critical and we need your help to raise funds for a recruitment campaign to secure additional qualified legal volunteers.

          We have an exciting opportunity to match your donation DOLLAR for DOLLAR up to $2,500 thanks to the law firm, Winston & Strawn LLP, and a Governing Board member. 

          For example, if you donate $25, our matching partner will also donate $25 which doubles your impact!


          Other Ways You Can Help

          • Help us spread the word by sharing this campaign!
          • Volunteer as a pro bono attorney with us!  Check out the LinkedIn Volunteer posting here!

          We'd love to hear from you! If you have any questions please contact us at: 

          Caroline Manley - cmanley@cdelaw.org - 312.376.1884

story:
Our Story

Hi my name is Stephanie Piegzik. I am fundraising for a baby angel. This little angels name is Bailey. Bailey is currently 8 months old and weighs only 12 lbs. she has spent all but four weeks of her little life in the hospital for testing, life saving surgeries, and recovery time. 
She has had open heart surgery, surgery to repair a hole in her GI, cranial surgery to reverse the premature fusion of the growth plates in her skull, surgery to repair a hole in her intestines, 4 blood transfusions, and she still needs another surgery to remove and reroute a section of her bowel that is not functioning - this causes her bowels to get severely backed up, bloating her and causing serious pain and she has been on a feeding tube since she was 6 weeks old. Most likely when all of her surgeries are finished, she will need to be on meds for quite some time, then meds to get off of the meds. 
She smiles every day. 
Below is an article from Phoenix Children's Hospital where Bailey was nominated Heart Hero - Mended Little Hearts of the Month. The article, by Mom, explains in more depth what little Bailey has been going through.
The underlying problem is one parent has been unable to work for almost a year now to be by Baileys side. Medical bills are piling up, and the family's insurance year is coming to an end at the end of October. November 1st, the hospital will not be able to treat Bailey until the family can meet their insurance deductible first. 

I know I would be so scared to be in that situation. With a tiny life at stake, and money holding necessary procedures and medical care at bay. It's frightening just to think of the fear my sister and her family must feel right now.

What we need and what you get:

  • The Fletcher Family needs a minimum of $10,000 to pay their annual deductible and to help them pay some of their mounting medical bills. A year in the hospital with 24 hr care is unbelievably expensive.
  • Your generosity will help this baby angel get her bowel surgery she needs. Without this, she may be on a feeding tube for much longer. 
  • If the entire goal is not met, the money raised will still go towards the family's insurance  deductible. They have no choice in the matter. November 1st, the hospital will have to release her wether it's safe or not. This is so serious, I'm not even sure I have the words to explain how urgent the situation is. Hopefully I have been able to share their story and needs clearly.

The Impact

  • Your donation will be helping one of the nicest, most loving families ever.
  • Help me help them by choosing to be a hero. You can make a difference. 
  • This little angel "Bailey" needs your help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share Baileys story on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter or any other social media that could help Bailey and her family. 
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools. Tell your friends, co-workers, and if your way of contributing is through prayer, we gladly accept prayers too.

I just wish this family could focus on loving their beautiful daughter, and spending quality time with her. I hope to take away the stress caused by medical bills and desperation. With the help of many generous people like you, we can lighten their load just a little. 

Thank you so much for reading about our baby angel. I know Bailey would thank you too.

story:
Thanks for considering Legacy Kept as a special gift for the holidays! A few folks have asked how the gift certificates and accounts will work: Legacykept.com will go live right after the Indiegogo campaign ends on January 2nd. At that time we'll email your account access code(s)- one code for each account you purchased- and the writing can begin! In the meantime, when you purchase your account(s), you will receive an email with a Legacy Kept gift certificate you can print out and give to anyone you've bought accounts for (we'll include two different versions for you to choose from). Just email us at admin@legacykept.com with any questions! 

 

Join a Movement to Preserve Family Stories - Including Yours.

Family. 

Roots. 

Identity.

Our parents, grandparents, and mentors have shaped each of us in undeniable but often unexplored ways. In their humanity, they have done their best to give us all they can, even as they navigate their own journeys, longings, and past.

For instance, how well do I understand what it was like for my father growing up as a potential draftee in the shadows of the Vietnam War? In what ways did that impact the course of his life? 

And, what were your grandmother’s favorite stories about your grandfather? What marriage advice would she offer after decades of lessons learned?

We, personally and as a society, are losing the unique, vital, and profound opportunity to process and preserve the life stories of our families and communities. 

But now, you can back a project dedicated to making it possible for everyone’s heritage and legacy to be preserved, including yours. 

“The beauty of the written word is that it can be held close to the heart and read over and over again.” -Florence Littauer

Legacy Kept is a website that makes it simple (and fun) for anyone to answer thoughtful interview questions about their life, and then easily print the finished project as a beautiful hardcover book. These books will be cherished gifts, passed down to family and friends for generations. Their stories, in their own words, preserved in writing.

 

How It Works

Each account provides total freedom in the process. We imagine some Legacy writers will work on their own, answering questions at their pace; some will find a partner (spouse, sibling, friend) to help each other along the way; and some will need support (a son or daughter, grandchild, social worker, or nurse), to type answers during regular visits or phone calls. Here's how the site works:

Step 1: Answer provided questions to help write your life story.

 

 

 

Step 2:  Add, reword, or remove categories and questions as you see fit.

 

 

Step 3: Turn your story into a PDF or hardcover book to be treasured for years to come. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

“Ideas that spread, win.”  -Seth Godin

Our crowdfunding goal of $15,000 USD will be used to cover the following:

  1. Software & Web Development (so we can maintain an easy to use and bug-free product)
  2. Site Hosting (so you can save your writing progress digitally and securely)
  3. Publishing Costs (so we can provide you with hardcover legacy books to share)

Any additional funds raised will go towards extra publishing costs, new feature development, and dedicated customer service personnel so we can immediately assist you with any Legacy Kept inquiries you may have.

We need your help to bring this project to life. The more funding support we receive, the further the idea can spread— and here’s how you can help:

  1. Think about the loved ones whose Legacy Kept books you want to read
  2. Explore our backer perk levels (on the right) and find the best fit
  3. Donate and receive your printable gift certificate designed for the holidays
  4. Receive your account access code(s) via email when the site opens in January 2020

Invest in your family’s story now! Become a reader and keeper of your loved ones’ Legacy books for years to come. Enjoy renewed connection with your family, and be inspired to live a legacy you’ll want to write about.

 

Meet the Team

John Naylor, Co-Founder

It was just a thought. My dad was dying, and over the course of that year I had a lot of time to think. I thought about the time we spent together when I was a kid. I thought about the time we spent together when he moved into my house late in life. I thought about how little I knew of him.

I wondered why we pay such great attention to distributing the "what" when someone dies, but so little attention to capturing the "who." It doesn't seem right. Sure, cars, houses and bank accounts are significant, but maybe life stories, wisdom and advice are equally significant. Perhaps more so.

And from that idea Legacy Kept was born.

 

Heidi Brewer, Co-Founder

For as far back as I can remember, I've loved listening to stories. My grandfather's were among my favorite—I really could listen to him talk about his childhood in England for hours. Something about the sharing of these stories felt sacred to me; I felt connected to my grandfather, and my heritage, when he told them. I hadn't imagined what life would be like without getting to hear these stories whenever I wanted. He was the greatest of storytellers. 

In the wake of losing my grandfather, my dad shared an idea to create a website that would allow people to preserve their family stories in writing, so they could be cherished for generations. I was on board immediately. In creating this website, we've really tried to take the overwhelm out of the writing process and make it accessible to anyone, so that our family legacies won't be lost. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you contribute, there are still things you can do to help:

  • Like and share our Legacy Kept Facebook Page
  • Please spread the word about the Legacy Kept project with friends and family. We want to make sure everyone who would want to write and share their story gets this wonderful opportunity. Use the Indiegogo share tools provided to get the word out on social media!

 

Risks & Challenges

All businesses face challenges, but rest assured Legacy Kept has done everything possible to reduce the risk for our backers. Here are a few things to note:

  • Account access will be ready for you by early January 2020. Even if we don't reach our funding goal, you will still receive access to your Legacy Kept account,

  • We are partnering with an established and well respected custom book printer for the publishing of the hardcover books. While we cannot make any guarantees regarding their products and services, we will be quick to communicate and correct any challenges that arise.

Please spread the word about the Legacy Kept project with friends and family. We want to make sure everyone who would want to write and share their story gets this wonderful opportunity. Use the Indiegogo share tools provided to get the word out on social media!

 
Risks & ChallengesAll businesses face challenges, but rest assured Legacy Kept has done everything possible to reduce the risk for our backers. Here are a few things to note:
Account access will be ready for you by early January 2020. Even if we don't reach our funding goal, you will still receive access to your Legacy Kept account,
We are partnering with an established and well respected custom book printer for the publishing of the hardcover books. While we cannot make any guarantees regarding their products and services, we will be quick to communicate and correct any challenges that arise.

story:
Introducing Clean Air, Clair. Clair B, bring clean air with you everywhere you go. Clair B is a portable air purifier that utilizes dual filtration technology. By combining the power of an plasma ionizer and our patented electret film filter, we are able to exceed HEPA standards and achieve 99.97% filtration efficiency and eliminate 0.1 micrometer (?m) sized particles.

Clair B's unique swivel vent provides 180 degrees rotation providing fresh and clean air in any direction!  

Running at 5 volts gives you maximum portability. Connect to your computer, the cigar jack in the car, a smartphone charger or a portable power bank.

Our Magnetic Air Filtration (MAF) technology filters micro dust particles as small as 0.1?m, viruses, bacteria, allergens, pollen, VOC (volatile organic compounds) and even harmful chemicals.

Electret filter attracting particles through static electricity

Similar to a powerful magnet, Clair B’s unique air filtration system holds an electrostatic charge thereby causing particles to be strongly attracted to it. Harnessing the power of static electricity, the same principle that made your hair stick to a balloon when you rubbed it on your head, Clair B attracts polarized contaminants.

The electret film filter is capable of eliminating ultrafine dust (smaller than 0.1 micrometers ?m), allergens, pollen, mold, cigarette smoke, exhaust gasses and more. The filter is made of an embossed polypropylene film, a self-charging electrostatic material, wrapped in a cylindrical shape, and our patented design allows the polypropylene to hold charged sides. 

The filter’s area is nearly twelve times larger than that of a standard mini-HEPA filter thus, maximizing efficiency. This also gives the filter a longer life span. A single mini-electret filter can last four months, and when it is time for replacement, you simply twist the bottom off and lift the filter out. 

Plasma ionizer and Electret filter working in conjunction


While our electret film filter has proven to be highly effective in eliminating germs, viruses, bacteria, carbon monoxide, toluene, benzene, and formaldehyde, we decided to add a preparation stage that uses a plasma ionizer to be sure that we get every last bit of pollutant. As chemical molecules and other biological agents enter the charging section they collide with ions, gaining that ion’s static charge. The now charged particles pass on to the trapping section and are filtered out of your environment. 

This innovative technology was developed in collaboration with the Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology, the Korea Institute of Industrial Technology and Pusan University through the support of the Ministry of Science, ICT & Future Planning.



Clair B’s attractive design fits with any décor. With its basic two-toned design, Clair B is elegant in its simplicity thereby matching the aesthetic of any environment in which it is placed. Simple, Classic and Portable. That was the emphasis of Clair B's design. 

For the design elements we collaborated with The Korean Institute of Design Promotion. The process was highly iterative with multiple conceptualizations, re-designs and testing before deciding upon a final design.

story:
The TYLT VÜ Pulse brings true fitness tracking to your Pebble Time™ Smartwatch. Using the principles of Photoplethysmography - the same green light sensing technology found in top fitness bands - we are able to bring accurate heart rate measurements in real time. And through filtering the data with our algorithm, extraneous data, as well as "noise" are blocked out to bring results comparable with top selling fitness bands on the market.


The TYLT VÜ Pulse will track your heart rate over a designated period. When in passive mode, your heart rate will be measured every 30 minutes in order to provide you with baseline measurements throughout the day and conserving battery life. When it is time to begin a workout, enter active mode and you will receive readings every 10 seconds to give you a true measurement of your workout activity. 

 

Pebble Health™ is a great baseline fitness app, recording steps, activity and sleep time, exporting that data to both Apple Health and Google Fit. With the TYLT VÜ Pulse, we integrate with the Pebble Health API to bring additional Heart Rate data from your wrist to the Pebble Health database.

Simply press the middle button to start tracking your steps taken, calories burned, and heart rate throughout your workout, and begin an interval timer that you have set.

When you complete your workout, the companion app will present you with an overview of your workout, and sync the data with Apple Health or Google Fit. 

Throughout the workout, when maximum heart rate is reached, the Pebble Time™ will vibrate, allowing you to seamlessly initiate the cool-down phase of your workout, ensuring that your workout is as efficient as possible.

With the TYLT VÜ Pulse, forget the hassle of having to plug in your watch to charge it. Instead, make your life easier with Qi Wireless Charging. With the TYLT VÜ Pulse, simply place your watch on any Qi compatible wireless charger to recharge your watch without any tangles or clutter of cables. 


At TYLT, we are proud to be leaders in wireless charging - having released several award winning VÜ products over the last 4 years. We see wearables and wireless charging as perfectly complementing each other, making proprietary cables a thing of the past. 

However, the Pebble™ team added a forward thinking and unique accessory port feature, enabling “smart straps” to add additional functionality to the Pebble™ products. That enabled the development of the TYLT VÜ Pulse , and we’ve partnered with leaders in Heart Rate technology in addition to our expertise in wireless charging.
story_txt:
Meet the TYLT VÜ  Pulse, and welcome true heart rate monitoring to your Pebble Time™ and Pebble Time Steel™. Here at TYLT, we are excited to expand the capabilities of Pebble Health™ to help you reach your fitness goals. In addition to heart rate monitoring, we are bringing along a custom-made companion app as well as the ease of Qi Wireless Charging to your Pebble™, so that you can forget about the hassle of plugging in your watch when the battery runs low. 
































The TYLT VÜ  Pulse brings true fitness tracking to your Pebble Time™ Smartwatch. Using the principles of Photoplethysmography - the same green light sensing technology found in top fitness bands - we are able to bring accurate heart rate measurements in real time. And through filtering the data with our algorithm, extraneous data, as well as "noise" are blocked out to bring results comparable with top selling fitness bands on the market.






The TYLT VÜ  Pulse will track your heart rate over a designated period. When in passive mode, your heart rate will be measured every 30 minutes in order to provide you with baseline measurements throughout the day and conserving battery life. When it is time to begin a workout, enter active mode and you will receive readings every 10 seconds to give you a true measurement of your workout activity. 
 
Pebble Health™ is a great baseline fitness app, recording steps, activity and sleep time, exporting that data to both Apple Health and Google Fit. With the TYLT VÜ  Pulse, we integrate with the Pebble Health API to bring additional Heart Rate data from your wrist to the Pebble Health database.
Simply press the middle button to start tracking your steps taken, calories burned, and heart rate throughout your workout, and begin an interval timer that you have set.





When you complete your workout, the companion app will present you with an overview of your workout, and sync the data with Apple Health or Google Fit. 





Throughout the workout, when maximum heart rate is reached, the Pebble Time™ will vibrate, allowing you to seamlessly initiate the cool-down phase of your workout, ensuring that your workout is as efficient as possible.















With the TYLT VÜ  Pulse, forget the hassle of having to plug in your watch to charge it. Instead, make your life easier with Qi Wireless Charging. With the TYLT VÜ  Pulse, simply place your watch on any Qi compatible wireless charger to recharge your watch without any tangles or clutter of cables. 











At TYLT, we are proud to be leaders in wireless charging - having released several award winning VÜ  products over the last 4 years. We see wearables and wireless charging as perfectly complementing each other, making proprietary cables a thing of the past. 





However, the Pebble™ team added a forward thinking and unique accessory port feature, enabling “smart straps” to add additional functionality to the Pebble™ products. That enabled the development of the TYLT VÜ Pulse , and we’ve partnered with leaders in Heart Rate technology in addition to our expertise in wireless charging. 




























What versions of Pebble does this support?
Since the VU Pulse uses a co-molded body, it universally supports both the Pebble Time and Pebble Time Steel



What are the dimensions of the VU Pulse?
The VU Pulse adds approximately 4.4mm to the thickness of the Pebble Time / Time Steel, and 3mm to the width / height.



Will this sync with my Phone?
The VU Pulse supports viewing your heart rate on the Pebble watch, and can sync the data back to your Apple Health and Google Fit app for iPhone and Android device respectively..



How does the VU Pulse interact with Pebble Health?
We are working with Pebble to get HR native to Pebble Health. The communication for 3rd party Apps will need to come thru Pebble Health's Protocols, that is still in development. In the end it's up the Fitness Apps like Strava to put HR functionality into their Pebble App, using the data from the VU Pulse.



How will the VU Pulse impact my battery life?
Putting the VU Pulse in active mode one hour per day (it is collecting HR readings every few seconds in active mode, while passive model collects only several readings per hour) - estimated battery life of the Pebble is only reduced by 8%.



Can I still use my charging cable with the VU Pulse?
With the VU Pulse on your Pebble, you can charge on any Qi Wireless Charger, but will need to remove the VU Pulse to use Pebble’s standard charging cable.

What watch bands will this work with?Our VU Pulse will work with any standard 22mm watch band - whether it is the original watch band, our TYLT watch band, or any other band. However, watch bands that cover up the bottom of the Pebble, such as the NATO band, will cover up the HR sensor and not allow it to work properly.

Will the VU Pulse be waterproof?We are evaluating several ways to see what method produces the best water resistance performance. Here are some of the top options under evaluation: - Using Sonic Welding to bond the outer and inner Polycarbonate, and using conformal coating on the electronics which keeps the PCBA isolated against water. Challenge here will be to have the tolerances optimized so that the welded enclosure itself does not permit water through the seams. - using the same process as the above, but inserting epoxy or rubber compound into the cavity. Since the cavity would be filled, it inherently prevents water from coming through, but it may be hard to control the flow of the epoxy/rubber material to prevent it from getting onto our HR LED and lens. - using a potting technique to seal the electronics to the bottom cover. Like the above option, it may be hard to control the flow and avoid interfering with HR LED and lens.As Chinese New Year has now wrapped up and several of our factory partners have come back to work, we are working with them to optimize the design to make it manufacturable while being as water resistant as possible. We do not have exact results yet for the Vu Pulse waterproof rating, but the product will indeed be water resistant. We will keep you informed regarding the design and share the water resistance results as they become available. Our Goal is to provide a water proof product, but that may not be possible, it may only be possible to provide water resistance that for example would allow you to shower and wash your hands, but not go swimming in a pool.

story:
Short Summary, become an angel and donate something today

What is it?

The latest, simplest, most hygienic way to get your back & body healthy, wealthy, and clean.

Neglecting Your Back and the Hidden Dangers

Most people tend to have a little trouble reaching their back when the time comes to take a shower, so we end up skipping over, giving our backs the thorough scrubbing they deserve. After all, our backs don't tend to get as filthy on an average day as many other parts of our bodies do. So what's the harm?

Well, here's a dirty little secret about showers. The running water actually doesn't do much to clean our bodies. In fact, more often, all a shower really does is move the germs around. That's why scrubbing is so important. It's the scrubbing that gets rid of all those disease causing germs. That's right you read that correctly, disease causing. Over time, neglecting your back can result in bumps appearing. Without proper back hygiene, these bumps can potentially turn into disease.

"So hold on, how can scrubbing my back stay healthy?"

Scrubbing Your Back and the Hidden Benefits

Besides getting rid of all the grime, giving your back and body a regular scrub will actually improve your immune system. How? The friction caused by the brushes scrubbing against your back & body, helps give your lymphatic system the vital circulation it needs to function properly. The hand held brush vibrates, and does not pull hair as rotating brushes do for face, neck and any fragile areas.

Lymphatic System? 

In a nutshell, your lymphatic system makes up, not 25%, not 50%, but 78% of your entire immune system. With my new invention, not only will scrubbing your back become the easiest and most relaxing part of your shower, it'll also be one of the healthiest things you do all day.

My Work

Hello, my name is David Tippie. I am a Nature-O-Path and Aging Younger Clinic owner, as well as a lifelong problem solver. Raised from Childhood to adult by engineers, ingrained in my brain are the words: There is only one reason that a problem can exist, and that is, because the correct solution has not been applied. I have truly accomplished my past learning with the Lymphatic & Full Body Cleansing Device.

How You Can Help

Any and all denotations you can make will be appreciated beyond words.  I'm not a wealthy man. I'm just a lover of science with a big idea, so believe me when I say that I know how much trust it takes to donate your hard earned money to a cause and I'm grateful for every dollar you send my way.

Also know that, even if you like my product, not everyone can afford to donate. All I ask is, if you like my invention and want to see it succeed then maybe spread the word a little. Tell a friend or a co-worker. The more people who learn about my invention, the better chance it'll end up in a shower near you someday soon.

My Lymphatic & Full Body Cleansing Device is just one giant step toward a brighter and healthier world. Let's take that step together.

Find Out More

To find out more about the Lymphatic & Full Body Cleansing Device, please feel free to visit my website: AgingYounger.net

OR email me at: davidtippie@agingyounger.net

Check out our video on YouTube: https://youtu.be/Zrt0Qz6Qf34

Thanks for reading!

David Tippie

story:
UPDATE: We're having a boy!!!!! Little Jude Thomas Williams is perfectly healthy at 22 weeks, and the doctor guesses he will be as tall as his daddy. We did have a little scare during the first ultrasound; the technicians thought they were seeing signs of a placental abruption (the placenta detaching). So we immediately got a higher-resolution ultrasound that, thankfully, let us know that there was nothing to worry about. Better tech meant bigger bucks, though--around $720 cash for this first one and then again at about 32 weeks. So we are more grateful than ever for everyone's help, love, and support. Happy 2012!

Our Story

We're Nick and Delondra, and we're having our first baby! After almost eight years of marriage and ten years of being in love, we are so excited for the newest member of our little family to arrive on May 13, 2012. But we need help. Although we both work a lot--Delondra as a writer and LAUSD teacher, and Nick as an actor--we do not have health insurance. The insurance we had through the school was cancelled due to budget cuts. We don't qualify for assistance from the state of California, because we make too much money. But we don't make enough money to pay both the monthly rates and deductibles on the individual insurance plans we do qualify for. So, we're paying for prenatal care and the birth itself on our own. 


The Impact

The entire package through our birthing center will cost $7,000. And that's if everything goes according to plan. It includes some in-center tests, birthing classes, prenatal check-ups, and the birth itself at the center. However, that doesn't include prenatal vitamins, additional OB tests, maternity clothing, or the emergency health insurance we will have to pay for in the next few months in case Delondra has to go to the hospital during the birth. The entire $7,000 has to be paid by the due date, or else...we can't give birth there.


When we first heard all the various fees and saw how limited our options were, Delondra cried. We weren't sure how to afford what we believe to be the best care for our child--with the midwives at the birthing center. And every time they tell us about a new test that wasn't on the original budget, we worry that we'll have to skip doing something important, like testing for Down Syndrome (just one of the three tests costs $500), because we just don't have the money.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $4,000 to help with the cost of the baby.

Currently, we're paying $350 to the birthing center itself every month. In March, we will put the remainder of the total bill on a healthcare credit card that has zero interest for the first six months. We don't have any current debt, so we're not afraid to take on a little for the baby. He or she is obviously worth it! But we could use some help.

Although we'd be ecstatic to reach $4,000 through your generosity, we'd be grateful for any little bit below that. It all goes directly to the baby. We already have ourselves and the initial birthing center payments budgeted out and under control. We are all about finding cheap, creative ways to make our family healthy and happy. We've been doing it for years! But even $150 more would buy Delondra a bottle of the vitamins our midwife wants us to use that, right now, we just can't afford.

Here are some examples of where your donations will go:

Prenatal visits.............$175 each (12 total)
Postpartum visits.......$175 each (3 total)
Birth kit......................$125
Labor/Delivery...........$2,950
In-labor monitoring....$380
Classes.....................$350
OB visit.....................$150
Lab-work...................$300 - $600
Sonograms...............$500
Down Testing...........$550
Vitamins....................$400

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that times are tough for everyone. We're all tightening our belts and worrying about how we're going to make it month-by-month. But any little donation would really help. And, if you can't donate, please spread the word and/or pass along gently-used baby supplies and maternity clothing! Thank you for reading! We appreciate any help that may come our way.

story:
This campaign has been extended by request!  Please continue to follow and support Scott here:  

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/scott-sharp-recovery--2/x/11204451#/story

Scott Sharp is well known to many as one of our Patient Support employees who continuously went above and beyond to make sure patients were well looked after as well as maintaining a high level of safety for other staff.


Due to a tragic accident that took place in the ER early this year, Scott was injured by a patient leaving him with a serious back injury. He has required back surgery and has been in extensive therapy for the last 5 months. Scott has made some improvements but his journey is far from over. Unable to walk and confined to a wheelchair, Scott is now facing another back surgery in the near future. He is a not only a fantastic co-worker but he is a husband and a father to 4 wonderful children. He continues to have a positive outlook and is very optimistic, however no one can prepare themselves for the financial burden an injury like this can cause.

story:
The intent of The Healing House is to help others reconnect with their authentic self.   When we love ourselves, we realize that nothing external brings us happiness.  

The Healing House provides multiple ways to help one look within and nurture their own inner garden.

We are a donation based yoga and meditation studio, and community healing center.   

As you enter The Healing House, you will feel a sense of comfort and home, a place where everyone is welcome.   It radiates love, peace, and kindness for all.   

In addition to offering a variety of yoga and meditation classes, The Healing House will hosts retreats, workshops, special events, our mission will include providing the best in local holistic practitioner services, and cutting edge wellness workshops, and more, on a donation basis.

We believe in accessibility to support others in their healing journey which is why we offer all of our classes and services at donation basis.

This is a trust and faith based business model that will be supplemented with annual fundraisers to ensure that our donations prices can be maintained year round.

Let Us Bring Yoga and Meditation to You!   Our facilitator will come to you home, school, or business.   

At Your Workplace: Yoga and meditation benefits everyone.  The Healing House’s facilitators are happy to come and bring meditation and/or yoga to your workplace.

Yoga for Any Sport: Whatever sport you play, yoga can help you flexibility, mind, and strengthen your inner self. The Healing House will create a Yoga Sequence to meet your needs based on the sport and targeted ages. 

Meditation for Veterans with PTSD: Regular mindfulness practice can lead to a greater acceptance of potentially distressing cognitive and emotional states as well as trauma-related internal and external triggers.  Support from The Healing House will host meditation sessions with veterans.

Ayurveda Cooking Classes:   Ayurveda, the ancient healing art of India, teaches that food plays an essential part in one's health and sense of well-being.  The Healing House will work with you to identify your dosha and plan out healthy recipes based on the results to help facilitate your healing.

Restorative Yoga:  Restorative postures, which are often supported by blocks, blankets, bolsters, and other props, are designed to maximize comfort and allow practitioners to fully let go.

Creative Art Therapy: Art, music, dance, drama, and poetry therapies are referred to as “creative arts therapies” because of their roots in the arts and theories of creativity. Whether at The Healing House or your home or business, a facilitator is available to assist you in conducting therapy through expressing yourself through art to help brighten the light the within.

Holistic and Spiritual Health Counseling: Holistic and Spiritual Counseling is a gentle process of deepening self-awareness, healing emotional wounds, and uncovering greater self-acceptance and love.  An Advocate for Healing will be available to support you and/or your family. 

Goal:  Currently based in Port St. Lucie, the goal of The Healing House fundraising campaign is to create a centrally located permanent location to serve the St Lucie/Martin county area as a donation based non-profit healing center.

We estimate a need of $10,000.00 in initial startup costs, with donation based services and events, supplemented by annual retreats and fundraisers to maintain the Healing House.

thehealinghousecandiyoga.weebly.com

How can you help?

Please visit our Indiegogo page and see the great perks available for your generous support in providing healing to our community.   Any contribution is appreciated and will benefit the community we all call home.

            indiegogo.com/projects/the-healing-house-yoga-meditation

            *The Healing House is a 501c3 non-profit charity organization.

Join us at our first weekend retreat in April 2017 at beautiful Kashi Ashram in Sebastian, Florida.

            Reserve your spot soon, space is limited!

            lifeissweetretreatcandimccoy.weebly.com

Personal Testimonials:

Yoga:

"Candi's yoga has been a great addition to the programming here at the Martin Girls Academy. The girls apply the yoga in their daily life  to cope with stress and other mental diagnosis. The girls love Ms Candice and are also asking for her to come back."

Glenis Thompson, Recreation Therapist (G4 Martin County Girls Academy)

"Candi's yoga has helped my body become stronger in mind, body and soul. Its very refreshing to have such a relaxing session after a long week. Not only do I enjoy being on the beach but she's a wonderful instructor."
-Brittany Weatherly


"Yoga with Candi is something special. Candi has a fun, energetic & warm personality She shares practical life lessons with her practitioners. Her classes are invigorating and challenging in a good way, helping you find your breath and inner-self. I feel renewed when I leave her classes and I highly recommend you treat yourself to the experience."

-Dale Armor


Adult and Family Meditation:

"Candi's meditation has given my children new ways to face challenges in their day to day life. We are practicing lion's breath and a "peace begins with me mantra." My husband says it's helpful to have the whole family doing something consistent and our children will benefit!"
-Amanda Jones
Kids ages 5 & 6

Kids' Meditation:

"Thank you Candi McCoy for all you have done for me and my son! I started earlier this year with yoga and meditation and I surely can say it changed my life!  My son was struggling in school and home , he had really hard time to focus and concentrate, after few times of medication he started being calmer and focused in school , his grades positively changed in the last few weeks through the mediation and he seems to be happier than he was before. I'm very happy that we have the opportunity to learn that kind of lifestyle ❤️."
Lenka Lenicka and Sam -Age 10
story_txt: The intent of The Healing House is to help others reconnect with their authentic self.   When we love ourselves, we realize that nothing external brings us happiness.  The Healing House provides multiple ways to help one look within and nurture their own inner garden.We are a donation based yoga and meditation studio, and community healing center.   As you enter The Healing House, you will feel a sense of comfort and home, a place where everyone is welcome.   It radiates love, peace, and kindness for all.   In addition to offering a variety of yoga and meditation classes, The Healing House will hosts retreats, workshops, special events, our mission will include providing the best in local holistic practitioner services, and cutting edge wellness workshops, and more, on a donation basis.We believe in accessibility to support others in their healing journey which is why we offer all of our classes and services at donation basis.This is a trust and faith based business model that will be supplemented with annual fundraisers to ensure that our donations prices can be maintained year round.Let Us Bring Yoga and Meditation to You!   Our facilitator will come to you home, school, or business.   At Your Workplace: Yoga and meditation benefits everyone.  The Healing House’s facilitators are happy to come and bring meditation and/or yoga to your workplace.Yoga for Any Sport: Whatever sport you play, yoga can help you flexibility, mind, and strengthen your inner self. Whether at The Healing House or your home or business, a facilitator is available to assist you in conducting therapy through expressing yourself through art to help brighten the light the within.Holistic and Spiritual Health Counseling: Holistic and Spiritual Counseling is a gentle process of deepening self-awareness, healing emotional wounds, and uncovering greater self-acceptance and love.  An Advocate for Healing will be available to support you and/or your family. Goal:  Currently based in Port St. Lucie, the goal of The Healing House fundraising campaign is to create a centrally located permanent location to serve the St Lucie/Martin county area as a donation based non-profit healing center.We estimate a need of $10,000.00 in initial startup costs, with donation based services and events, supplemented by annual retreats and fundraisers to maintain the Healing House.thehealinghousecandiyoga.weebly.comHow can you help?Please visit our Indiegogo page and see the great perks available for your generous support in providing healing to our community.   Any contribution is appreciated and will benefit the community we all call home.            indiegogo.com/projects/the-healing-house-yoga-meditation            *The Healing House is a 501c3 non-profit charity organization.Join us at our first weekend retreat in April 2017 at beautiful Kashi Ashram in Sebastian, Florida.            Reserve your spot soon, space is limited!            lifeissweetretreatcandimccoy.weebly.comPersonal Testimonials:Yoga:"Candi's yoga has been a great addition to the programming here at the Martin Girls Academy. The girls apply the yoga in their daily life  to cope with stress and other mental diagnosis. The girls love Ms Candice and are also asking for her to come back."Glenis Thompson, Recreation Therapist (G4 Martin County Girls Academy)"Candi's yoga has helped my body become stronger in mind, body and soul. Its very refreshing to have such a relaxing session after a long week. Not only do I enjoy being on the beach but she's a wonderful instructor."-Brittany Weatherly"Yoga with Candi is something special. Candi has a fun, energetic & warm personality She shares practical life lessons with her practitioners. Her classes are invigorating and challenging in a good way, helping you find your breath and inner-self. I feel renewed when I leave her classes and I highly recommend you treat yourself to the experience."-Dale ArmorAdult and Family Meditation:"Candi's meditation has given my children new ways to face challenges in their day to day life. We are practicing lion's breath and a "peace begins with me mantra." My husband says it's helpful to have the whole family doing something consistent and our children will benefit!"-Amanda JonesKids ages 5 & 6Kids' Meditation:"Thank you Candi McCoy for all you have done for me and my son! I started earlier this year with yoga and meditation and I surely can say it changed my life!  My son was struggling in school and home , he had really hard time to focus and concentrate, after few times of medication he started being calmer and focused in school , his grades positively changed in the last few weeks through the mediation and he seems to be happier than he was before. I'm very happy that we have the opportunity to learn that kind of lifestyle ❤️."Lenka Lenicka and Sam -Age 10

story:
My name is John Symons. I’ve done many things in my life - I have been a middle school art teacher, managed several restaurants, and I ran my own produce company. But now I want to do something more important: save lives.

Around 20 years ago, I first learned about phage therapy. I saw a BBC program that explained how phage therapy could cure bacterial diseases without antibiotics. They stated that this safe and effective cure would never come to the United States because drug companies could not  make money on it, since it could not be patented.

Yet, antibiotic-resistant bacteria are now an imminent threat. Scientists expect the first completely drug-resistant strain to occur within the next few years. Without a way to combat these threats, we will return to the pre-antibiotic era, with thousands and even millions dying due to common infections. What can we do?

First, my goal is to start a non-profit corporation to finance drug trials of different phage therapy cures. Though much research exists and phage therapy is even in use in three countries, studies must be done to gain U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approval before phage therapy could be implemented in the United States.

Second, the non-profit would encourage our government to spend money on phage therapy. The United Kingdom has already had phase I and phase II  trials on one phage therapy cure. The U.S. is falling behind.

Third, we would start an educational program to prevent people from getting bacterial diseases in the first places. Many simple measures could make a big difference, such as educating doctors to disinfect their stethoscopes between patients, educating hospital staff to wash their privacy curtains between patients, and educating children on the proper way to wash their hands. (In a recent study, a whopping 68% of Americans did not wash their hands properly.)

Now that my children are grown and I am retired, I have the time to devote to this project. I have been studying phage therapy, bacterial diseases, and fund-raising for the last year, and I’m ready to bring experts on board once the non-profit is funded and formed. My goal is for the non-profit to be raising at least 5 million dollars a year within 5 years.

Raising 5 million dollars a year is not easy, but I have family that works in the non-profit field, so I have knowledge about what is involved in fundraising and resources to turn to for advice and support. I have a friend who is experienced in writing grants and has volunteered to help. I have been networking, and getting ideas by watching a person who raises money for schools in Africa, and another person who is raising 6.6 million a year getting people to grow mustaches. I feel I am a very creative individual and can reach this goal.

Through this crowdsourcing effort, I am hoping to raise $20,000.00 dollars. Expenses include approximately $7,000.00 on legal advice and the necessary forms and fees to be incorporated as a non-profit. And additional $3000.00 would be used to set up a small office with phone, internet, and equipment. Approximately, $600.00 would be used to set up a simple website to provide information and accept donations. The remainder of the funds will be used to set up a fundraising department. Whenever I can, I will use volunteers to make your money go further. If I don’t reach my goal, I will scale back and focus on finding volunteers to help get things done.

The perks are recognition. Whether it is a thank you letter or your name and picture on our website, you can be proud that you will be helping save lives.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please spread the word to your friends, or you can use the Indiegogo share tools. The more people who know about this campaign, the more successful we will be!

story:
A young father, A husband and a good artist, And a optimistic guy need funds in next couple of weeks for his bone marrow transplant.

There are great times in life, then there are sad ones too. At times, you look at someone and wonder, ’God, that could have been me!’ Not because you feel jealous about someone else’s success or wonder where you fell short. You are, sometimes, in a strange situation when someone you know is going through pain & challenges that he does not deserve. Such are the ways of the world. You can only wish that the pain goes away soon. Or maybe do something more…Such is the situation that we face with our friend Vinit paul( vinni )

Friends and family members started this fundraising campaign to raise funds which will help  Abhishek Jain in his fight against cancer.

About him:

Vinni could be described as the 32 yr old ideal young man. Good looking, smart, intelligent, driven, humorous, full of life and charming. But it is not just his qualities that make him ideal, his responsibilities make him even better. He is both an amazing husband & father.

Growing up in a small town like Udaipur, Vinnihad his eyes firmly set on something bigger. That is when his love affair with animation and the journey to establish himself begun. After spending 2 years in Mumbai, Vinni took off to Hyderabad to try his luck in the big bad world of animation.

                              

It is no mean feat that in a few years, he went on to become a team & technical lead at one of the finest animation studios in the country. It meant many years of working long hours, giving projects better than his best, and all of this with his trademark smile. He also proved to be a great family man to his beautiful wife and an even prettier angel. Things were only looking up for Vinni, the best of all gamers on the amateur circuit.

                    

Worked for many international clients including Disney, Nickelodeon, Method studios, Alpha anim and many more..and given his services for many popular projects including The PRODIGIES(Feature Film),Motion capture movie ,Onyx Films
Medal of Honor Airborne (Game cinematic) -EA Games 
GODFATHER 2 (Game Cinematic,In game animations)- EA Games 
Les Gnoufs – Method Films 
Ironman
Skyland –Method Films 
Jurassic Park,(Ingame Animations), Telltale Games
NBA Live 10
TAK and the power of JUJU 52*11min, Nickelodeon 
PINKY AND PERKY 52*11 min, Method Films
Little nick,Method Films

                      

Until one day, he fell sick and everything was never the same again. Even in his wildest of dreams or shall I say nightmare, did he not expect that he would be diagnosed with blood cancer or leukemia.  he moved to Mumbai, India and admitted in TATA MEMORIAL HOSPITAL on 30th April 2014. He was getting his treatment there from last 3 months.

A few months down the line, Vinni is still fighting for his future. And that’s where we come in.

Since then he and his family members are struggling to gather funds for his treatment and were deeply depressed. we really don't want to waste our time so we started raising donations.


You can know more about him at below link

  • whatever money collected till now by his family, friends and relatives was spent on basic treatment and chemo itself. His family was trying to gather more funds in whichever way possible.
  • Now he has to go for BONE MARROW TRANSPLANTATION

Even a successful professional like Vinni cannot afford the steep expenses for the bone marrow transplant, which will go up to 7,00,000 - 9,00,000 INR ( 12k - 15k USD ). this could have happened to any one of us reading this.

    Your generous contribution help him to walk into his new life.

                               What We Need

As blood sample tests and few other tests are going on, we are yet to receive results and are expected around 1st September 2014,

We are hoping that his blood matches with his brother's and also we could collect as much donations as possible by the day of operation.

As we mentioned above we are hopeful and optimistic about the blood test results, so we are targeting for 15,000 USD

                            What you get

As this is health based fund raising, We really don't know how we can repay you but we will try to thank each and every one in whichever way possible.

-> we will be giving regular updates on his health, activities, payments, treatment and his progress.

-> Vinni himself will reply to you whenever possible and you wont believe how optimistic, energetic,hopeful he is.

->  we will upload video logs by AJ time by time

-> Last but not least we will try to arrange a skype call for few generous donors.

We know its not a small amount what we have targeted, but we were left with no option other than seeking your generous donations.

If we are not able to reach goal by time, the amount raised till campaign end will be handed over to his family for his medical expenses.

Every penny counts.. Every wish Counts...Every prayer counts

                            The Impact

Vinni did not bring this upon himself. It just happened. And he could have done nothing about it. I have decided that rather than sharing a hollow feeling, I could make a contribution. To get him operated. And in some ways, help him get back on the path to a beautiful future. For himself. For his wife. And more importantly his daughter. I will try to ensure that all the adjectives associated with

                           

The difference you can make in Vinni's life and his family is incredible, we hardly know where to begin describing the impact it would make.

  • Your contribution helps Vinni to start a new life
  • Helps his parents, wife and future of his 5 year old daughter
  • can make a difference in his life and shows still humanity exists
  • You can, not only save him and his family but also his dreams and goals as he is a very good artist and mobile game designer.
  • The list goes on...

                               Risks & Challenges

We really don't know how much we can raise by the time of operation, 

also how much tax and other deductions can occur and how much time it will really take funds to reach us. 

We really hope that funds reach us in time.

If we get negative results ( Blood doesn't match), still whatever you have donated will really make a huge difference for further treatment.

If we can raise more than what we need, we will utilize those extra funds for another needy patient who's struggling for funds. we will be updating all the funders regarding the same with all the detailed information of the patient.

                        Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

We understand that some of you cant donate due to some reasons, still we really appreciate for taking your time to read this 

there's always something you can do...

  • PLEASE get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. We would love it if you would share this with everyone you know... and maybe some people you don't know, but want to share it with them anyways!
  • Indiegogo has sharing tools - share on Facebook, through email, Twitter, in conversation, in your school, church, community!
  • Keep updated also can Contact Vinni (he will reply whenever possible ) and send your wishes, prayers, suggestions through our Facebook profile
                           https://www.facebook.com/vinniethepaul
  • if you wish to have a word with him directly u can call or mail him at below no's
Vinit Paul                   :  +91-971385828393

Email                                  : braveabhi088@gmail.com

Dhruv Paul (Brother)      :  +91-966548156702

                   

Vinit don’t remain a thing of the past. I will ‘Walk With Vinit’. Will you too?

story:
Hello! 

We are Oakmeadians Ladies, a bunch of crazy, fun Ladies whom joined together to play the wonderful sport that is rugby!

In Jan 2015 in our local rugby community a Dorset and Wilts rugby union referee suffered a heart attack whilst refereeing a game of rugby. If it were not for the brave acts of the players AND the defibrillator that they had to hand he may have lost his life.

As such Oaks Ladies strongly believe that all rugby clubs should be equipped with a defibrillator, in such cases as above.

We are a very passionate team...particularly around the game we love so much. Our season ended.....with victory I may add!!! Earlier than normal, as a result we have decided to commit ourselves to another great cause.

We intend to spend our time raising money for a defibrillator for our club, Oakmeadians RFC. Oaks isn't just about a game, it's about friendship, family and loyalty. It's a place where we go not only to make some smashing tackles (like Lawes vs France) but where we go to have fun, cheer on our sides from touch, to minis, to men's......you name it we do it. Our club and our members are important and that is why we want to get the funds to keep them safe in times of crisis with a defibrillator.

HOWEVER ...... Why stop there??? Rugby is about community and we want to raise enough money to get our club and two more clubs in the local area defibrillators. The ideal plan would for all Dorset and Wilts rugby clubs in the area to have one....so any extra money we make we will be extending this to more and more clubs.

So on 18th April 2015 Oaks Ladies, at their beloved club Oakmeadians RFC, will be raising their heart beats by continually riding two static bikes for twelve hours.

Please donate what you can......every penny counts. This is not just for our club but for our rugby community.

THANK YOU

story:
This Star Won’t Go Out and the online community have come together in order to raise money for families who have a child sick with cancer during this holiday season.

TSWGO has set a goal of $5,000, which will be enough to help at least 5 families in need of our support. If we go beyond raising our goal this November, any extra funds raised in this campaign will go directly to additional families in need.

The holiday season is meant to be a happy time for everyone, where families can come together in love and support, regardless of circumstance-- something that is especially important during such a dark time as having a sick child. This causes families to be stressed with hospital bills, mortgage payments, and anything else life throws their way.

We are here to help for just such a cause.

TSWGO was established in memory of 16-year old Esther Earl, an avid Nerdfighter and passionate Harry Potter fan. Through these communities that she was a part of, people have donated some great perks for this campaign!

Perks
story_txt:
This
Star Won’t Go Out and the online community have come together in order to raise
money for families who have a child sick with cancer during this holiday season.
TSWGO
has set a goal of $5,000, which will be enough to help at least 5 families in
need of our support. If we go beyond raising our goal this November, any extra
funds raised in this campaign will go directly to additional families in need.
The
holiday season is meant to be a happy time for everyone, where families can
come together in love and support, regardless of circumstance-- something that
is especially important during such a dark time as having a sick child. This causes
families to be stressed with hospital bills, mortgage payments, and anything
else life throws their way. 
We
are here to help for just such a cause.
TSWGO
was established in memory of 16-year old Esther Earl, an avid Nerdfighter and
passionate Harry Potter fan. Through these communities that she was a part of,
people have donated some great perks for
this campaign!Perks

story:
Leading the Fight

The 2014 Philly Charity Showdown kicks off the biggest lacrosse weekend of the year in style by hosting a celebration of Philadelphia-area lacrosse at Citizens Bank Park, the lavish home of the Philadelphia Phillies and the most unique lacrosse venue in the world. NXT is incredibly excited to work with the Thomas Jefferson University Hospital as all net proceeds from the evening benefit TJUH's Comprehensive Concussion Center.
