NXT is incredibly excited to work with the Thomas Jefferson University Hospital as all net proceeds from the evening benefit TJUH's Comprehensive Concussion Center.

story:
Short Summary

I am creating The Body Exchange Home Fitness Collection because fitness should be accessible, safe and fun for every, single, body - period.  Everyone has the right to endorphins but this is the reality:

In general, the plus size community is marginalized as consumers and grossly overlooked in health and fitness programs that fit their needs. Yet, society screams at us to get moving and live up to a certain look and health ideal without optimal programs available.  It's lose/lose and we aren't getting anywhere with this model.  The plus size community deserves empowerment, cutting edge fitness programs, inclusion and the right to draw their own conclusion on what health means to them.
I'd like to introduce a new paradigm for fitness for the plus size community and I'd like to invite you to join our our "movement" of fearless fitness, at any size. 

ABOUT ME
My name is Louise Green and in 2008 I Founded my business Body Exchange; fearless fitness dedicated to the plus size demographic.  I was tired of seeing the plus size community underserved and struggling to keep up in mainstream fitness programs that were uninviting.  Since opening my business we have trained and interacted with thousands of plus size women.  My drive to pioneer this concept came from my personal experiences navigating the fitness industry as a Personal Trainer and participant, plus size.  Through thousands of hours I have mastered what works and what doesn't work with this group both physically and mentally and I've brought that expertise to a home fitness video, accessible to every "body".  I am certified in Group Fitness, Weight Training and Personal Training and I can confidently say:  I am unequivocally a fitness expert to the plus size community.  I know that consistency in exercise lies within feeling successful, included and represented. These key ingredients are the foundation to my new fitness video: The Body Exchange Home Fitness Collection.

WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT?
There are 220 million overweight North Americans and there is no shortage of prominent, negative, headlines calling this a "crisis".  However, it's my strong belief that the crisis doesn't lie in the weight of North Americans but rather, in the way we respond to this demographics need's.  Often people don't exercise because they don't know where to start or they have limitations that discount them from mainstream fitness programs or their barriers of fear and intimidation are just too much.  This home fitness video addresses all of these issues head on.  This fitness video works for every "body" even if you are starting in a chair.  
Please, help us help more people!

WHY AM I HEADING THIS PROJECT?
I decided to produce The Body Exchange Home Fitness Collection because I've consistently heard from people, from all over the world, say that they would like a Body Exchange program in their community.  At speaking events, I often hear frustration (and tears) from audience members saying that they feel judged or intimidated when approaching the gym setting.  Their voices echo what I already know.  For many people fitness is simply unapproachable, unattainable and uninviting and it prevents them from experiencing the endless benefits that exercise can bring.  
At Body Exchange and through this DVD we approach health and fitness from a body positive position and encourage sweating for the love of moving our bodies and living a healthy lifestyle, period.  There is no hidden agenda to "Get Flat Abs in 21 Days" or to "Eliminate that Muffin Top" as seen on every news stand, these slogans move against our Body Exchange culture.  I understand that we all have our own journey with our bodies and that movement, at any size, has endless benefits to your health.
Through this medium we also add to the fitness landscape a visual representation of the plus size women working out which we seldom see in any videos, advertising, or television.  With The Body Exchange Home Fitness Collection you will see yourself and that is powerful!

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL IMPACT THE WORLD!
By contributing to this fitness video you will be helping us change the paradigm of fitness for North Americans and in the big picture, that is a big, huge, deal.  In many circumstances our Western Culture puts pressure on the plus size demographic to move their bodies and lose weight without many options that support a long term lifestyle plan.  Diets don't work and while the diet industry continues to make billions of dollars while failing millions of people, we believe that moving your body and celebrating who you are opens the door to endless possibility.  This video will get people started and empower them; and just like our proven Body Exchange programs, it will change people's lives.  The Body Exchange's mission has been a clear path since 2008 to change perceptions, attitudes and lives through fearless fitness, at any size.  By backing our cause you will be helping us drive that message and change the world.  
We are on a mission to raise $4800.00 to produce this revolutionary fitness video. The funds will go to:  
Studio rentals,  Lighting, filming, editing, makeup, uniforms, graphic design, insurance, web development, a small compensation to our crew and DVD production.  If we don't raise the full amount through this campaign we plan to put the funds towards production and will continue to try to raise funds through other avenues to cover the rest of our expenses.   I was raised "old school" and I am not someone who is accustomed to asking for money so I've the added perks that are valuable and worthy of your hard earned money.  We have some amazing perks that support fearless fitness at any size, check them out!
Risks & Challenges

Although my professional history has a great track record this is the first time I've produced a fitness DVD.  We have the filming under our belt but the risks and challenges I foresee is that our team is having to work out the kinks as we go. We've very successful to this point and I know we can overcome these challenges because of the amazing team I work with.  

Another challenge is: often the media doesn't understand "fearless fitness at any size".  This can make marketing and publicity opportunities more challenging.  Throughout my career I've found creative ways to reach my audience and will continue leverage as much exposure as possible in the right places.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Help us spread the word!  If we can get every person who reads this to at least share this information.  Truly,  you will have a hand in changing perceptions, lives and attitudes in our Western Culture and shifting the health and fitness paradigm for the plus size community.

Another challenge is: often the media doesn't understand "fearless fitness at any size".  This can make marketing and publicity opportunities more challenging.  Throughout my career I've found creative ways to reach my audience and will continue leverage as much exposure as possible in the right places.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

Located in the beautiful Pojoaque Valley north of Santa Fe, New Mexico, Equest Counseling Center was founded and established in 2003 from the hopes and dreams of Dr. Katrina Lujan, Ph.D. to create a progressive culturally sensitive and aware counseling center providing mental health services to the culturally varied and richly diverse communities of Northern New Mexico.

" There is something about the outside of a horse that is good for the inside of a man"  --Winston Churchill

I was out on my own at 16 years old and I had my children at a very young age and devoted my early adulthood to raising my children. I somehow endured many years of very challenging experiences but instead of feeling sorry for myself I felt as if I could use all of the challenging experiences of my life and help others. As I knew that I wanted to give back I first returned to school I had to begin with procuring my GED as I never had finished high school. Then I proceeded to complete my BA, MA and was able to obtain my Ph.D. over a 22 year span. Wow, as I look back at how I was able to take good care of my children, build several successful small businesses and stay focused on school I was so excited to finally complete my educational pursuits. I do feel very blessed that I was fortunate enough to know that seeking an education could change my whole life as I set out to help others to help them to re-build their lives.

It was back when I had just received my first degree, my BA in Psychology that I was given a job called Family Preservation. This entailed me going out into the communities of Northern New Mexico and going into people’s homes. When you go directly into your client’s homes…it is an eye opening experience. There’s not much they can hide from you so I was able to fully see the desperation of the living situations, the effects of extreme poverty, the reality of the epidemic drug use in Northern New Mexico.

It was during this introductory job in the field of mental health when I came to realize that there just weren’t any great counseling centers available to people who truly needed to seek out services for mental health issues…then I envisioned building the most beautiful and inviting center that I could imagine.

It was this job that had a lot to do with my choice, my decision and my goal of building a unique, peaceful place of refuge that could provide creative counseling services to all ages. I actually had a vision of exactly how I wanted the ranch to look like…so I began to draw out the layout of the actual ranch where the horses could run, where every view is absolutely stunning, where I wanted the actual counseling center to face the beautiful Sangre De Cristo Mountains creating the comfort and feel of a serene and calming ranch house to make it more inviting to those who come to us for healing.


Through the use of creative approaches to facilitate growth and healing in children, youth, adults, individuals, families, groups, and corporate teams. We focus on assisting our clients with healing in mind, body, and spirit, to further assist them in living as responsible and productive members of society with vision and hope. The center itself is in a peaceful rural setting providing a place of refuge for our clients.



In the clinical arena of counseling, humans are seen as natural storytellers and our clients come to us with tales of their life challenges, defeats, heartbreaks, disappointments, obstacles, and challenges with communication, parenting, alcohol and substance abuse issues, domestic violence, goal setting, emotional and developmental challenges.  The complexity of contemporary society brings our clients to counseling and therapy seeking guidance, support, direction and answers to a wide array of challenges.



We believe that being creative in our approaches to counseling is very important; accordingly we offer a wide array of different creative therapeutic techniques and experiential in counseling, working with horses doing Equine Assisted Psychotherapy, we have recovery  and substance abuse groups, mediation groups, play therapy, sand play, art therapy and we are doing motivation and awareness groups.  Equest is focused on serving primarily members from the local rural community and Native American pueblos.


Under the continued leadership as an uncompensated Executive Director and through the continual personal sacrifice and personal investments totaling ~$1.5 Million made by Dr. Lujan and her husband, as a team they have been able to keep Equest Counseling Center up and running for over eleven years. In the desire to better serve the mental health needs of the local rural community they have added a 1,200 sq.ft. group counseling and administration facility to the existing 1,500 sq. ft. center. 

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP!

We are asking for your help to raise $333,000.00.

  • Approximately $211,000 will pay for  12 months of operation expenses.

  • Approximately $122,000 will pay for facility repairs and recovery of the deferred maintenance.

Your donation to Equest Counseling Center will help us immediately to carry on our support and servicing of the mental health needs of the local Northern New Mexico rural community.


The Impact

As we have been fortunate enough to sustain Equest Counseling Center for the last decade it has grown more and more apparent that in order for us to carry on our mental health services we must have outside help. As we are situated in a rural area we serve three different counties and people are very grateful that we are centrally located in the center of the three counties, easily accessible for them. 

As we started in January with the new Federal Transitions put into place I personally witnessed at least six different mental health centers close their doors due to the overwhelming expectations put on providers. I am referring to having to purchase Electronic Health Records and many other unexpected expenditures.

If the kind people reading our campaign could understand that if we were to close down due to not being able to get on top of the debt and be able to operate monthly without any outside assistance, the people that would be hurt are the clients who come here on a weekly basis. Our clients are the poorest of the poor in our nation. They range in ages from 3 to 85 and in a common month it is possible for us to treat up to 400 people.

If we are not successful in obtaining this short term financial assistance which may drive us to shutting down; the impact to the community would be devastating. As Northern New Mexico ranks #1 in drug and alcohol related deaths, #1 in DUI’s, #1 in DUI related car accident fatalities. Also an important statistic is the amount of babies born with serious addiction to Opiates and other drugs. The younger children and the teens are all greatly impacted by this problem so they would be without the care they depend on from us.


In our work with the little children they come to us with no voice, no ability to communicate and leave here using their voice, communicating their need and with increased self-esteem. Your support would stabilize and assure that people in need will not be left without these critical services towards healing in many areas of their lives. We do make a difference in teaching and guiding them that it is possible to re-invent your life! Our past success has been proven by audits that all big insurance companies make you go through on an annual basis. We have always received excellent scores on our audits. The last one put us at a level to be a certified CARF facility which is a difficult certification to obtain.

We respectfully request your support to help us to continue our goal to empower our clients to know that they can be whole again and to be productive members of our communities.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help us to help others by sharing this campaign with family and friends and asking them to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

  • Your help is greatly appreciated.

story:
Introducing Clip Eye Cam

We believe, taking the right picture at the right moment is our fundamental needs. People take only 1% of special events at travel, in a restaurant, at sight seeing on a special day. You are missing the rest, 99%. Even those are precious moments.

Clip Eye Cam never lets them go

Think of the time when you spend with your adorable daughter, think of the time at dinner table with your family and friends, think of the beautiful scenery in front of the amazing spirit of the planet, you will never want to let them go. Clip Eye Cam takes every moment that maters to you.

A tiny square clip cam, One simple action

Clip Eye Cam is a tiny square camera box you can clip at glasses. Can be attached on any type of glasses. A glance of a wink and clip the real moment, the real world, right at the moment.

Any situations, anywhere you go

Bring it with you to vacation in summer, to the city, to the nature, to the fes, to the beach
When driving a motorbike or going out for jogging, you don’t hare to use hands,
If you are working for a company, you want to create a manual, describing processes.

Take, save, upload and share the real moment

This tiny cam allows you to take, save and upload to our web whatever you take at the moment and share with who want to share with. Be noticed, you can restrict people you don’t want to share with.

Who we are

We are the team from Tokyo. We met in the Startup Weekend IoT event.
-Shota : MBA holding director, strong Startup Weekend Facilitator. He is also good at web design, system architecture and management/strategy.
-Yukari : Web Designer, Developer. She is a gorgeous and brilliant mode maker.
-Haruyuki : HW/SW Developer. He is an intelligent core engineer.
-Makoto : Product Developer. He is an raw material master.
-Some others
 Product designer, Financial advisor, Maketing advisor, Sales professional

Where and who we need help

We have just started. In order to make our completed β product an bring it to you, we need fund.
We will carefully control our budget until deliberately bringing it to you.
-Develop prototype : Current product is still too big to use with glasses. make it smaller and stable.
-Design product : Our product should be simple and beautiful enough, because you go out with it.
-Develop Web service : After taking photo, you want to upload and share with anybody you like. Also your audience wants to view your photos through Web browser (or iPhone app).
-Supply Chain : Develop supply chain, buying materials, packaging and delivering to you.
-Marketing : Promote product via SNS, startup events or other types of media.

Our challenges

-Team resources
We have skills and knowledge to complete the product in team and with help from outside of the team. However we don’t have full time workers now. After raising funds, we will be able to have materials and stuff to make the product. Then we will start developing full product.
-Technical challenges
The most important thing in developing is make it small. This affects all processes of development, building processor, sensor and battery. We are sure this challenge can be overcome by OEM with outside vendor.
-Initial development *IMPORTANT*
The fund $15,000 from this campaign Indiegogo is to be used for manufacturing product. We need other fund to develop back  ground, web, server and mobile app. In order to acquire this fund, we are seeking the chance of investment. If we fail this, we promise to return all the money we receive by the end day of the project.

Our Vision

Imagine, you are exploring the real world on the web.  You see what is happening in a small bar in NYC, you see how shining Tarj Mahal is in New Delih, you see how people are reacting to a pop star in a big concert hall in Shanghai, you see a beautiful mountains from the Alpine view in Switzerland. No pretenders there, no imitations there, only real world you can explore on the web.
With Clip Eye Cam, many people will have the tool easy-to-take and easy-to-upload with a sentence or a tweet. Clip Eye Cam will never let the moment go and gather.

We need your attentions on this project and investment to make this come true.
story_txt: Introducing Clip Eye CamWe believe, taking the right picture at the right moment is our fundamental needs. People take only 1% of special events at travel, in a restaurant, at sight seeing on a special day. You are missing the rest, 99%. Even those are precious moments.Clip Eye Cam never lets them goThink of the time when you spend with your adorable daughter, think of the time at dinner table with your family and friends, think of the beautiful scenery in front of the amazing spirit of the planet, you will never want to let them go. Clip Eye Cam takes every moment that maters to you.A tiny square clip cam, One simple actionClip Eye Cam is a tiny square camera box you can clip at glasses. Can be attached on any type of glasses. A glance of a wink and clip the real moment, the real world, right at the moment.Any situations, anywhere you goBring it with you to vacation in summer, to the city, to the nature, to the fes, to the beachWhen driving a motorbike or going out for jogging, you don’t hare to use hands,If you are working for a company, you want to create a manual, describing processes.Take, save, upload and share the real momentThis tiny cam allows you to take, save and upload to our web whatever you take at the moment and share with who want to share with. Be noticed, you can restrict people you don’t want to share with.Who we areWe are the team from Tokyo. We met in the Startup Weekend IoT event.-Shota : MBA holding director, strong Startup Weekend Facilitator. He is also good at web design, system architecture and management/strategy.-Yukari : Web Designer, Developer. She is a gorgeous and brilliant mode maker.-Haruyuki : HW/SW Developer. He is an intelligent core engineer.-Makoto : Product Developer. He is an raw material master.-Some others Product designer, Financial advisor, Maketing advisor, Sales professionalWhere and who we need helpWe have just started. In order to make our completed β product an bring it to you, we need fund.We will carefully control our budget until deliberately bringing it to you.-Develop prototype : Current product is still too big to use with glasses. make it smaller and stable.-Design product : Our product should be simple and beautiful enough, because you go out with it.-Develop Web service : After taking photo, you want to upload and share with anybody you like. Also your audience wants to view your photos through Web browser (or iPhone app).-Supply Chain : Develop supply chain, buying materials, packaging and delivering to you.-Marketing : Promote product via SNS, startup events or other types of media.Our challenges-Team resourcesWe have skills and knowledge to complete the product in team and with help from outside of the team. However we don’t have full time workers now. After raising funds, we will be able to have materials and stuff to make the product. Then we will start developing full product.-Technical challengesThe most important thing in developing is make it small. This affects all processes of development, building processor, sensor and battery. We are sure this challenge can be overcome by OEM with outside vendor.-Initial development *IMPORTANT*The fund $15,000 from this campaign Indiegogo is to be used for manufacturing product. We need other fund to develop back  ground, web, server and mobile app. In order to acquire this fund, we are seeking the chance of investment. If we fail this, we promise to return all the money we receive by the end day of the project.Our VisionImagine, you are exploring the real world on the web.  You see what is happening in a small bar in NYC, you see how shining Tarj Mahal is in New Delih, you see how people are reacting to a pop star in a big concert hall in Shanghai, you see a beautiful mountains from the Alpine view in Switzerland. No pretenders there, no imitations there, only real world you can explore on the web.With Clip Eye Cam, many people will have the tool easy-to-take and easy-to-upload with a sentence or a tweet. Clip Eye Cam will never let the moment go and gather.We need your attentions on this project and investment to make this come true.

story:
What is Acumo used for?

Relieving muscle pain, improving flexibility and mobility, aiding athletic performance, improving tissue healing and vitality, relaxing your body and mind, and fostering deep sleep.

 Is it easy to use Acumo?

Simply click the heat and/or vibration function of Acumo.  You can put Acumo to the tight muscle, lie or lean into your Acumo.  The Acumo patented design applies acupressure and heat to painful and congested areas of your body.  Acumo gives an effortless and comfortable massage.

What is the battery capacity after a single charge?

Acumo has a non-removable Li-Po 4000 mAh battery pack.  iPhone 6 Plus has a non-removable Li-Po 2915 mAh battery, and iPhone 6 a non-removable Li-Po 1810 mAh. One full charged Acumo can charge an iPhone 6 twice! For heating, Acumo can generate a constant 113ºF for about 2 hours. 

Is Acumo waterproof?

AcuMo is 100% waterproof and sweat-proof. 

Why would I switch to Acumo from a heating pad? 

Heating pads do not have any penetration function.  Acumo offers pressure point and heat functions, which pin-point the trigger points, just like acupressure.   Acumo relieves the soreness and pain far more effectively than any heating pads.

Can I bring Acumo on an Airplane?

Absolutely! Acumo complies with all TSA regulations and other international entities.  We design the Acumo to massage you no matter you are in the air or on the ground.  Acumo boosts energy to you and your mobile devices.

Is it safe to use Acumo?

Safety is our highest priority.  Acumo complies with FCC and CE regulations.

Is there any warranty for the product?

We offer a one year warranty.

Is international shipping available? if so, what is the cost?

Yes. There will be shipping charges for USA (~$10) and International shipping cost(~$18).

When can I get my Acumo?

After 8 prototype and performed all the necessary testing, we are 100% confident in bring Acumo into mass production in November .  We want our backers to have Acumo in time for Christmas to enjoy a warm and comfortable massage in the cold winter time.

What is in the box (packaging)?  

For Acumo, the package is one Acumo ball (Orange and Neon Blue) and one charging cable.

For Acumo roller, the package contains two Acumo balls in your chosen color, one carry bag, and two charge cable.

We do not include power adapter for both packages.  Acumo can be charged by a standard USB power adapter or USB port.  To save the environment, we encourage our customers to use the power adapter you already have.

DISCLAIMER

All the information, content, and material presented is for informational purposes only, it should not replace any medical analysis, diagnosis or treatment of a qualified physician. Always consult with your primary care physician or health provider.

story:
Train smarter, not harder. 

Introducing Velo by Autonomous, the most affordable stationary bike that makes it easier, and more fun to get fit. Velo comes to life with an app that enables you to race against anyone, anywhere in the world. Use friendly competition to own that finish line. 

 

Track performance, improve the speed with audio coaching, join worldwide racing competitions, be part of the #trainsmart community of like-minded people around the world. Velo gives you everything you need to smash your goals and sustain a fitness regime that continually keeps you engaged, and encourages you to better your best.

 

Why VELO?

In the fitness industry, the majority of equipment focuses on tracking performance, which is important, but not enough. Other products offer personalized training but come with a hefty price tag.

At Autonomous, we always want to strive for something better, something which motivates us to get up and move but remains accessible and affordable to the everyday competitor. Velo cuts your gym commute down to zero, connects you with like-minded people from all over the world, and helps you create and keep a fitness regime that doesn't ever feel like hard work. 

     

    We have a good track record of making products people love.

    We can't wait for you to experience Velo.

     

    Own your racetrack

    Create any race and invite friends to turn up the heat. Challenge anyone worldwide to make things a little more interesting, and push yourself further. Beat the competition or simply smash your own records. Better your best, every single day.

     

    Simple and smart Velo app.

    Join any race you want. Or, set your own racing room, invite friends, live-call while competing. Training has never been that fun and easy.

     

    Climb to the top of the leaderboard.

     

    Get expert advice from audio coach, every step of the way

    Instead of paying for pricey gym passes, Velo gives you access to unlimited, personalized exercises and audio training - 24/7, all year round. No more getting bored halfway through, no more underused equipment gathering dust.

     

    Track your progress, achieve your fitness goals.

    With Velo, you’re in the know: how fast you’re pedaling, how many calories you're burning, how many miles you’ve covered. All important exercise stats are available on-demand to make sure you can keep track of your progress. Smash your personal bests.

     

    Train your way with Velo bike.

    Every resultful workout starts by getting the right postures. Whatever it is a race or self-practice, make it correctly with us.

     

     

    Meet and feel a streamlined, robust bike

    The same engineering expertise that goes into the bestselling SmartDesk and ErgoChair has brought Velo to life. Velo guarantees you quality and durability, and something we're particularly proud of - a strong, weighted flywheel designed to deliver a realistic road feel and natural biking experience.

     

    Thoughtfully engineered.

    Taking ergonomics to a new level.

    Our ergonomically positioned handlebars, seat, and pedals are optimized for even pressure distribution, which relieves pain and cuts down fatigue, allowing you to train harder, for longer.

     

    Place Velo wherever you want. Effortlessly

     

    With its sleek 4.1’ x 1.7’ frame, Velo isn’t greedy with floor space. Train and race in the comfort of your home, whether you live in a studio or a sprawling penthouse.

    Velo comes in 2 dynamic colors.

    *Note: We will send out a survey to ask for your color choice when the campaign ends.

     

    Customize your Velo experience

    One size does not fit all. Choose between 3 options and make Velo yours:

     

    If you love healthy competition and leveraging a dynamic community as motivation, the Competitor and the Champion are made for you. Both come with the Velo app which you can download from Google Play or App Store. Monthly subscription fee is just $9.

    Indiegogo special: You get the first 3 months free! 

    If you just want to use the Velo stationary bike for casual cycling, you're good to go with the Novice version. You can upgrade at any time.

     

    Timeline

     

    Our story

    From a small apartment in NYC to 6 locations around the world.

    The Autonomous story began in September 2015 in New York City, when we shipped the first SmartDesk to our first Indiegogo customer. Since then, we have been dedicated to helping people work smarter. The SmartDesk now helps over 300,000 customers across the globe to be healthier, happier and more productive at work. We’ve received incredible enthusiasm and support from the entrepreneurs, innovators, and visionaries that make up the Autonomous community.

     

    Now we’ve decided to conquer the fitness industry. Why? While we work long hours in a fast-paced start-up environment, the extra commute to and from the gym can cause our workout to fall by the wayside. This doesn’t sit well with us - especially when we spend our days researching the importance of staying active. If you want to boost your brain function, energy, and mood, frequent exercise is a must. We understand that stimulating connections between different areas of the brain and getting oxygen pumping through exercise, is something that lasts long after you’ve finished your workout. We want all our customers to experience next level energy, productivity, and happiness.

    From component sourcing to quality control, we’ve brought the experts behind the SmartDesk and ErgoChair on board - so we can better help people to train smarter and move faster.

     

    Help us spread the word

    The bigger the Velo community, the richer your Velo experience. Share this campaign with your family and friends and get them racing against you!

     

    Risks and challenges

    This is our sixth time launching a crowdfunding campaign - including the original SmartDesk and ErgoChair.  Our track record shows we have the expertise and experience in place to deliver things on time.

    Our years of experience in manufacturing, product sourcing, logistics, and quality control mean we have the know how to minimize the risks associated with launching new products.

    1. Inventory: We’ve already produced 100 Titan Black units. Throughout our Indiegogo campaign, we’ll closely monitor the number of orders and adjust our production accordingly.
    2. Supply chain: From years of working with different factories and manufacturers, we only partner with the most reliable ones. Unexpected shortages and delays can occur, in which case we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work quickly to remedy the problem.

     

    Questions & Answers

    1. How much weight can Velo support?

    Velo comfortably supports up to 260 lbs.

    2. What are the product dimensions?

    L 46.5" x W 18.5 " x H 42.9". Weight: 80lbs

    3. How much space does Velo take up? I live in a really small apartment so don’t know if I have enough room.

    Coming in at a compact 4.1’x 1.7’, Velo easily fits into almost any room. For home use, we recommend placing a sports mat underneath. This will help protect your floor and reduce the chance of any noise reaching your neighbors.

    4. How many people does it take to assemble Velo? Which tools do I need?

    We include all the assembly tools you’ll need with every package. You can easily finish setting up your new bike by yourself in under half an hour.

    5. How adjustable is the bike?

    Velo is designed to adapt to different body types. The handlebars, seat, and resistance are all easily adjustable for a ride that’s perfect for you.

    6. What is the range of the seat and handlebars?

    Seat vertical range: 31" to 40.5"
    Seat horizontal range: 2”
    Handlebars vertical range: 36.5" to 40.5"

    7. Can I change the resistance of the bike?

    Of course! Use the knob to adjust the resistance of the bike. This also allows you to lock the bike for safety.

    8. How many colors does Velo come in?

    Velo comes in two dynamic colors: Titan Black and Lightning Yellow.

    9. Where do we ship from?

    Every Velo stationary bike will be shipped from our warehouses in Yonkers (NY) and Mentone (CA). They’re the pros who ship thousands of SmartDesks and ErgoChairs every day.

story:
Kurzbeschreibung (scroll down for english version) 

Für meinen Bachelor-Abschluss in Fotografie habe ich in den beiden Städten London und Frankfurt fotografiert. Die daraus entstandene Arbeit ist eine Zeitung mit 40 Seiten und 27 Abbildungen. In der Arbeit geht es mir um das Spannungsverhältnis zwischen diesen fest definierten Orten als Zentren des Handelns und der Ortlosigkeit des Handels. Die Stadt hat sich von ihrem räumlichen Ursprung zu lösen begonnen und um Dimensionen der Virtualität erweitert. 

Wenn du noch Fragen zur Arbeit hast schick mir einen Kommentar und ich beantworte sie so schnell wie möglich.

Was du gibst & was du bekommst

Um eine erste Auflage der Arbeit mit 50 Exemplaren zu produzieren benötige ich deine Hilfe. Das erreichte Ziel würde mir erlauben die Zeitung in einer kleinen Auflage zu produzieren und sie in meiner Abschlussausstellung im Oktober zu zeigen. Die Arbeit ist dann nicht nur während der Ausstellung zu sehen. Die Zeitung kann mitgenommen werden und überdauert somit die Dauer der Ausstellung.

Auf der rechten Seite kannst du sehen wie du mir helfen kannst. Deine Unterstützung wird natürlich auch nicht umsonst sein.

Dabei geht es bereits ab 5€ los. Für 18€ bekommst du dann die Zeitung. Echte Prints auf Fotopapier gibt es in verschiedenen Größen und Auflagen ab 50€. 

Sollten wir das Ziel nicht erreichen, so kann ich das Geld trotzdem für eine kleinere Auflage benutzen. Die fehlenden Exemplare drucke ich dann nach, sobald ich kann.

    Die Folgen

    Mit deiner Spende unterstützt du natürlich nicht nur die Produktion der Zeitung. Du ermöglichst mir darüber hinaus einige Exemplare zu drucken, welche ich dann an verschiedene Plattformen verschicke, um mein Projekt noch bekannter zu machen. 

    Darüber hinaus unterstützt du junge Fotografie in Deutschland und zeigst, dass es eine Plattform dafür gibt. 

    Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

    Wenn du nichts spenden kannst..macht nichts! Vielleicht kannst du ja helfen meine Idee etwas bekannter zu machen. Damit trägst du zu seiner Verbreitung bei und findest vielleicht dadurch jemanden der spenden kann. Du darfst das Projekt dann auch gerne im digitalen auf Facebook teilen und in der echten Welt darüber reden.

      Das war es auch schon. Ich freue mich auf deine Unterstützung und hoffe wir können das Ziel erreichen!


      English Version


      Short description

      For my bachelor degree in photography I had been taking pictures in London and Frankfurt. The finished work is a newsprint with 40 pages and 27 images. The work deals with the relationship between such fixed places and their development into placeless spaces. The city has dissolved from its physical space and expanded into virtuality.

      What you give and what you get

      To produce a first edition of 50 I am going to need your help. The achieved sum gives me the possibility to produce the newsprint in a small edition and to present it at my thesis exhibition in october. This way the work will outlast the exhibition and therefore be available to more people. 
      Of course there are some perks for you. Starting with 5€ you will get a postcard. For 18€ you will get the newsprint and if you prefer a real photographic print you can get prints in various sizes starting with 50€. These prints are limited.

      In case that we should not achieve the final sum I am going to invest into a smaller edition. Missing copies will then be reprinted.

      Other ways to help out

      If you aren't able to help me out with money..don´t worry. You can still help me by sharing the link to my project via social media and by talking about it in real - life! 

      That´s it! I am looking forward to your help!

      If you got any questions open don´t hesitate to contact me and I will be glad to answer them as soon as possible.

 Wenn du nichts spenden kannst..macht nichts! Vielleicht kannst du ja helfen meine Idee etwas bekannter zu machen. Damit trägst du zu seiner Verbreitung bei und findest vielleicht dadurch jemanden der spenden kann. Du darfst das Projekt dann auch gerne im digitalen auf Facebook teilen und in der echten Welt darüber reden.

 Das war es auch schon. Ich freue mich auf deine Unterstützung und hoffe wir können das Ziel erreichen!English VersionShort descriptionFor my bachelor degree in photography I had been taking pictures in London and Frankfurt. The finished work is a newsprint with 40 pages and 27 images. The work deals with the relationship between such fixed places and their development into placeless spaces. The city has dissolved from its physical space and expanded into virtuality.
What you give and what you get
To produce a first edition of 50 I am going to need your help. The achieved sum gives me the possibility to produce the newsprint in a small edition and to present it at my thesis exhibition in october. This way the work will outlast the exhibition and therefore be available to more people. 
Of course there are some perks for you. Starting with 5€ you will get a postcard. For 18€ you will get the newsprint and if you prefer a real photographic print you can get prints in various sizes starting with 50€. These prints are limited.

In case that we should not achieve the final sum I am going to invest into a smaller edition. Missing copies will then be reprinted.
Other ways to help out
If you aren't able to help me out with money..don´t worry. You can still help me by sharing the link to my project via social media and by talking about it in real - life! 
That´s it! I am looking forward to your help!
If you got any questions open don´t hesitate to contact me and I will be glad to answer them as soon as possible.

story:
Why to track protein?

Excessive protein intake leads to up to 3 times fold increased risk of dying of cancer.

17 scientist had done research. The study included 6,381 adults ages 50 and over. During 18 years around 630 people had died of cancer. They were divided to three groups:

  1. Low protein intake
  2. Moderate protein intake
  3. High protein intake

Please take a look at death rate difference between those groups:

Why excessive protein intake so dangerous?

 

High Protein intake promotes high secretion of growth hormone ICG-1, this hormone not only promotes your cells to grow but also it promotes higher growth of cancerogenic cells.

Please take a look at cancer progression in Mice:

How our Protein Tracker will help you?

Calculate your recommended daily protein intake

 

Track your actual daily protein intake

330.000 recipe data base and almost 80.000 products nutrition value information will help you plan your protein intake.

 

Track your family members' protein intake.

 

Please take a look at Forbes opinion about this study

 

We Need Your Help

Development of application like that isn’t easy.  We have some development costs to invest before we could lower price of our app.

Here’s the list of our development costs:

  • Prototyping and User Interface development
  • Design
  • Server side development
  • Product and recipes recognition API integration
  • Application development

And also We are looking for further investigation of protein intake on our life expectancy.

story:
Our Story

On Feb 16, 2012, our friends were the victims of senseless violence. A man entered their home, shot those inside and set their home on fire. Laurel Choy, whose home it was, was the first shot. Her husband was fortunately not at home.  They are looking at mounting medical bills, grief and untold loss. Will you please help?                                                                                                                                                                                


The Impact

Laurel, Dan and their roommates have lost everything. Specifically, this site is set up to help defray the additional medical expenses and other needs that Laurel is accumulating.


What We Need & What You Get

We have nothing to give for your donation but our gratitude and love. All donations will go to the Choys (Dan and Laurel). Paypal donations will be immediately available but all other donations are held by Indiegogo until the campaign ends. Please give via paypal if you can.

story:
"2 forgotten miners" or "2 miners in our hearts"?

 Turkish text below! (Türkçe metin aşağıda)

What happened?

It all started when we first saw the heart-breaking photo of Ali at Radikal newspaper. He was staring us with one eye closed. The other one was obviously prosthesis. Eyes are the window to the soul. Those eyes were unforgettable from the moment we saw them. (http://www.radikal.com.tr/turkiye/somada_unutul...)


In 2007 there was a mine accident caused by a dynamite explosion in Soma, Turkey. 5  miners were injured, 2 of them seriously; Ali Kandemir lost his eyes and Idris Sarıkaya  seriously injured both legs.

Since the mining company stopped paying their salaries during their 16 month recovery they both opened a court case against the Company. Idris won his case but was unable to get the compensation owed to him because the mining company — financially liquid and sound — changed corporate status five times during this period. Ali's case has continued for 6 long years, even though the company has been found 100% responsible.

Both men are the sole breadwinners in their families. As they haven't had any income between the accident and their retirement, they've had to get bank loans which they haven’t yet been able to repay.

On top of all this, Ali needs special eye prosthesis which have to be replaced every five years. Although they don’t bring back his lost sight, without them his daughter cannot look at her father's face. "This is killing me" Ali says.

What is their current financial status?


From the accident date — July 31st 2007 — until his retirement, Ali had no income for 16 months. During this time his father, who was the only person with an income in his family, passed away so he had to get a bank loan of TL20,000 (£5,710 / $9,500 / €7,000). Ali now has a net income of TL500  (£142 / $238 / €175) after paying for the rent and the loan.

Idris' total bank loan is TL30,000 and his monthly net income is TL290 (£82 / $138 / €101)  after fixed expenses.

Our Goal

When we raise the money, we'll distribute the amount equally to the two miners. Whatever we collect will be deposited to the bank as an early termination of their loans.

Will they be "2 forgotten miners" or "2 miners in our hearts"?

We would like to spread the word to as many people as possible to show the two miners that they are not  forgotten. 

Our only dream is to put a big smile on their faces. 

And we can do that together...

We also send our condolences to the families of miners who lost their lives in the Soma mining disaster on May 13th...

_______________________________________________________________________
TURKCE

Soma'da 7 yıldır unutulmuş 2 madenci


Nasıl Başladı?

Herşey Radikal gazetesinde bir sabah gördüğümüz haberle başladı: Ali'nin fotoğrafını gördük. Biri tamamen kapalı, biri protez olan iki gözle bize bakıyordu. Gözler kalbin aynasıymış gerçekten. O gözler bizim  ta içimize işledi ve  Ali ile Idris'in hikayesini bu şekilde öğrendik... (http://www.radikal.com.tr/turkiye/somada_unutul...)

2007 yılında Soma'daki bir madende dinamit patlaması sonucunda 7 işçi yaralandı, bunların ikisi ağır: Ali Kandemir iki gözünü  kaybetti, İdris Sarıkaya ise bir daha çalışmasına olanak vermeyecek şekilde iki bacağından ağır şekilde yaralandı. 

Her ikisi de dava açtı, İdris'in davası sonuçlandı ancak şirket süreçte 5 kez adını değiştirdiği için sonuçlanan davada kazandığı tazminatını İdris bir türlü alamıyor. Ali'nin davası ise, şirket suçlu bulunmasına rağmen altı yıldır devam ediyor.

Her ikisinin de bakmakla yükümlü oldukları aileleri ve bu süreçte kullandıkları banka kredi borçları var. 

Ayrıca Ali'nin gözlerinde özel protez var ve bu protezin de 5 sene aralıklarla değişmesi gerekiyor. Eğer değişmezse, gözün içine tamir edilemeyecek zararlar veriyor. Protezi takmadığında ise kızı yüzüne bakamıyor ve Ali "Bunu duymak beni kahrediyor" diyor.

Şu andaki maddi durumları nasıl? 

Ali kredi kullanmış çünkü 31 Temmuz 2007'de geçirdiği kazadan sonra 3 Ağustos 2008'de emekli olmuş ve bu arada geçen 16.5 aylık dönemde maden şirketinden hiç bir ödeme almamış. O arada evde diğer çalışan olan babası da vefat edince, mecbur kalmış ve 20.000 TL kredi çekmiş.

Ali 1.250 TL emekli maaşı alıyor. Bunun 400 TL'sini kredi borcuna, 350 TL'sini de kiraya veriyor. Kendisi, eşi, annesi, kız kardeşi ve 11 yaşındaki kızından oluşan aileyle geçinmek için bütün ay boyunca 500 TL kalıyor.

İdris ise 800 TL maaş alıyor, sürekli ilaç masrafları var ve ay başında net kazancı 290TL, lisede okuyan 2 çocuğuna ve eşine bakıyor.

Neyi amaçlıyoruz? 

Hedeflediğimiz parayı topladığımızda, yarı yarıya iki madenzedeye paylaştıracağız. Tümünü toplayamasak da, ne toplasak kar olacak ve o kadarlık kredilerini kapatacağız. 

Katkınızın etkisi ne olacak?

Çok... En önemlisi, Ali ve Idris'e dünya üzerinde unutulmadıklarını göstereceğiz. Yüzlerinde kocaman gülümseme ve umut göreceğiz. Ali'nin gözlerinin içi gülecek, İdris bastonuyla yürürken acı çekmeyecek.

Hep birlikte...

Bu vesileyle Soma'daki 13 Mayıs'taki elim kazada hayatınızı kaybetmiş madencilere de rahmet ve ailelerine başsağlığı diliyoruz.

story:
Hello, I'm Donald Hackett, and I'm asking for your financial support to enable RxWiki to change the  medication publishing industry. Crowd-funding is new to me, but I believe RxWiki's mission is synergistic with this community's goals.

RxWiki's mission is to create and share the world’s medication knowledge in an understandable language for patients and consumers alike.

RxWiki's goal is to connect people with information solutions that enhance health literacy, increase medication adherence, and empower healthier lives.

Why is this important?  

Because most people (90%) do not understand their doctor's instructions.  Nor do patients understand the information found on most prescription bottles. And when patients don't follow their medication therapy, healthcare costs increase ($290b) and thousands of people die each year.

We have already launched the RxWiki.com website with the medication encyclopedia.  We believe this is a great -- free -- resource for patients to access.  This information is written at the 8th grade reading level, only pharmacist can edit the content, and most encyclopedia pages have integrated an engaging video for those who can't read.

Now we need your financial support to expand the number of digital encyclopedias within RxWiki's Life Sciences library to cover all of the subjects people are searching for when online.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who just can’t contribute, you can support RxWiki by do the following:

  • Make your voice heard and tell your friends and family about the RxWiki campaign. Facebook and Twitter are great communication channels to recruit supporters.
  • Visit the RxWiki.com website - its free and will make a difference in your search for world-class medication information.  And in your life!

story:
Note: The campaign has ended but the cards are available for purchase through thegamecrafter.com. See the link below:

https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/eft-divination-kit

You can try the cards for free through the website below:

https://empoweryourhealerwithin.com

 

Short Summary

This is the second edition of an EFT card deck with chakra features that has almost sold out on amazon. The original version is pretty small and a lot more simple. See the image to the right. The manual of definitions was unedited and provided as a download only. So, this time around I would like to be able to afford to create a more polished product.

The deck is currently used by EFT novices and practitioners ("EFT" is a form of alternative healing and is short for "Emotional Freedom Technique). 
 

A Little Background Information

The deck came about due to some of my clients becoming interested in learning muscle testing (a form of divination using the body that is used by many EFT practitioners). In EFT practice, muscle testing is generally used in order to detect what are termed "Psychological Reversals" or blocks to progress.  Muscle testing is not the easiest process for most people; which, after hearing more than a few complaints, I started thinking toward providing an alternative: hand-made oracle cards created from perforated business card paper (see the article here>>).

More than a few Individuals approached me asking if I would make the deck for them if they paid me, So, I started printing out the decks on my home printer and mailing them out. This was both hard on my printer and costly with ink cartridges, so I printed 250 copies through a local printer. Since that time, people from other countries have asked me if I could print the deck to sell it in their country and I had to decline, due to lack of funds.

The deck includes the basic EFT blocks (beliefs that it is not possible to heal, safe, safe for others, healing won't be permanent) as well as other blocks such as dehydration, nutritional issues, energy toxins, forgiveness, and more. I've even included some blocks that are common to theta healing or energy work. Because I often combined energy work with EFT and clients wanted to be able to do the same, this is how the chakra feature came about. See samples in the gallery.

 

How to Use the Cards

The cards are pretty basic. Figure out the issue you want to tap through using EFT and then draw a card for what block to tap through. Ignore the chakra features unless you are specifically asking what chakra to work with. See the testimonial below for how an EFT practitioner used the first edition of the deck (the original deck was smaller and more simple, without rounded edges).

story:
Hello people!

My name is Eli. I'm a 24 year old transboi currently living in St. Louis, MO.

I have been on T since January. In order for me to live a happy life, I have also decided that I need to get top surgery. 

By the end of the year I hope to have top surgery. I am still looking into several surgeons, but what I do know is that surgery is going to be quite expensive...

Surgery is going to cost me at least $7,000. While I do work, I am going to need a little bit of help. I plan on saving at least half and fundraising the rest through here, a benefit show or two, and sexual favors. Totally kidding about the last one!

If you can give anything...literally ANYTHING, that would be amazing.

I plan on giving away things depending on how much you donate, so stay tuned!

Thanks,

Eli

story:
Debora's Story

For those unfamiliar with Multiple Sclerosis, it is a debilitating neurological condition inwhich affects the ability of nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord to communicate with each other effectively. Nerve cells communicate by sending electrical signals called action potentials down long fibers called axons, which are contained within an insulating substance called myelin. In MS, the body's own immune system attacks and damages the myelin. There is currently no cure. I have already lost complete funtionality of my right arm and both legs. The condition is progressing to my left arm and I currently only have limited use of three of my fingers, which allows me to use my electric wheelchair for mobility, limited access of my computer. I require help by my Caregiver for the usual everyday routine, such as bathing, getting dressed, and eating, etc.


There are studies underway to prove that narrowing of the arteries, or CCSVI, is a factor that contributes to Multiple Sclerosis symptoms. Until the studies have been completed and FDA approved, surgeries that remove these blockages, also known as the Liberation Treatment, are not covered under standard insurance.


To read more about the procedure that could change my life:

http://www.ctv.ca/CTVNews/WFive/20091120/W5_liberation_091121/

 

The Cause

The Liberation Treatment is not a cure, but there are case studies that have shown patients to regain some mobility and even reduce or eliminate the frequency and severity of MS attacks. My hope is that this procedure will allow me to regain my independence.

 

How You Can Help

Because the link between CCSVI and MS has not been widely accepted, there is a limited availability of doctors who provide this surgery and all require that the patient cover the complete cost of the surgery. There is an office in Southern California that performs this procedure: http://www.synergyhealthconcepts.com/


I am trying to raise $15,000 which will cover the cost of the surgery ($11,000+), as well as travel costs for me and my Caregiver to get down to Long Beach from my current home in Vacaville, CA.

 

I am reaching out to my friends and the public to ask for assistance in raising money to help pay for the CCSVI procedure.
story_txt:
Debora's Story
For those unfamiliar with Multiple
Sclerosis, it is a debilitating neurological condition inwhich affects the ability of nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord to communicate with each other effectively. Nerve cells communicate by sending electrical signals called action potentials down long fibers called axons, which are contained within an insulating substance called myelin. In MS, the body's own immune system attacks and damages the myelin.  There is currently no cure. I have already lost complete funtionality of my right arm and both legs. The condition is progressing to my left arm and I currently only have limited use of three of my  fingers, which allows me to use my electric wheelchair for mobility, limited access of my computer.  I require help by my Caregiver for the usual everyday routine, such as bathing, getting dressed, and eating, etc. 


There are studies underway to prove that narrowing of the arteries, or CCSVI, is a factor that contributes to Multiple Sclerosis symptoms. Until the studies have been completed and FDA approved, surgeries that remove these blockages, also known as the Liberation Treatment, are not covered under standard insurance.


To read more about the procedure that could change my life:

http://www.ctv.ca/CTVNews/WFive/20091120/W5_liberation_091121/



 
The Cause

The Liberation Treatment is not a cure, but there are case studies that have shown patients to regain some mobility and even reduce or eliminate the frequency and severity of MS attacks. My hope is that this procedure will allow me to  regain my independence. 

 
How You Can Help
Because the link between CCSVI and MS has not been widely accepted, there is a limited availability of doctors who provide this surgery and all require that the patient
cover the complete cost of the surgery. There is an office in Southern California that performs this  procedure:
http://www.synergyhealthconcepts.com/



I am trying to raise $15,000 which will cover the cost of the surgery ($11,000+), as well as travel costs
for me and my Caregiver to get down to Long Beach from my current home in Vacaville, CA.

 
I am reaching out to my friends and the public to ask for assistance in raising money to help pay for the CCSVI procedure.

story:
Short Summary

Everything smells delicious! There are no harmful ingredients- just things you could eat.  I care about your health, and I care about the well being of Mother Earth. This campaign is about bringing these highest quality natural products to more people, keeping people healthy, and setting an example of alternative to plastic
packaging (!)

I love being able to offer these hand crafted herbal personal care products that I make. Everything is natural, full of organic ingredients, prepared fresh in small quantities. You can see there is no plastic used in the containers.

It is incredibly heartwarming to hear the stories from people: how someone with cancer used the salve for dry lips, how someone is applying it where they had surgery, how the soap healed someone's ingrown hair, how someone had a beautiful dream with the dream pillows, how the deodorant (which has no aluminum which is linked to Alzheimer's disease) truly works for people who have been skeptical about natural deodorants. I am especially proud of the deodorant. It truly works. And as you can see, the packaging is a paper tube. This is something different!

The products are getting consistent praise from loyal customers. I worked hard to get everything just so, the recipes and formulas, the labels, the scents...  It is a beautiful process. Natural products mirror the natural beauty of the earth in us.

No pink ribbon here, yet you see there are things in some products that add more contaminants to our environment- where cancer begins -  from toxins that we have in our environment from things we use.

An improvement is here! With your help, we can bring a new style of doing things to the marketplace as a leader. 

The rest of the items I produce are a calendula healing salve, dream pillows, and soap,

Several stores across Los Angeles are awaiting the products. In Studio City, Downtown, and other places - which would give many people access to these great quality items, and give wonderful exposure to the products and all that they stand for as an example of sustainability.

This is our handmade display- it is made of recycled wood from pallets, and stained with all natural milk paint. The tags are from used grocery paper bags. And the sachets are made with organic cotton.


I learned about herbal foods and medicines from diverse teachers, and when I lived in nature, harvesting wild plants for food and medicine, and sharing that with many friends, teaching people which plants to eat and make medicine with and how to do so, making wild foods meals, making medicinal teas when people were sick. I am very interested in our relationship with the rest of nature.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is to purchase insurance in order to sell at shops, to purchase larger quantities of ingredients so as to have more inventory on hand, and for the indiegogo campaign fees and rewards. With a small start such as this, we can grow from there.

In return, and with much thankfulness, you receive my products. You also will have helped a small business with good purpose to flourish.

Thank you !!!

If the campaign goal is not reached I will use the funding raised in order to continue growing until the goals are met.

The Impact

Islands of plastic emerge from the bottom of the Pacific Ocean,  higher incidences of ADD, Autism and cancer have been partly attributed to more chemicals in our environments, global warming... I believe strongly in doing all we can, now, to make choices about which products we use, and how they are made, in order to lessen harmful effects on our health and earth.

From Los Angeles ideas reach out far and wide- this is a great place to keep emphasis on environmental choices in our consumption.

I am full of creative energy, and love sharing and exchanging ideas, enthusiasm, and being an example.

I also have a long history of speaking with the public and press, on a range of topics from alternative fuel to women's rights, and now find that my natural products business directly engages me with people all the time, sharing passion about sustainability.

Other Ways You Can Help

By telling people about the campaign! Please pass the word!! The best way things get done - by word of mouth, and personal passion.

You can order online! The items make great gifts too.

story:
Jude is a 21 month old toddler with hemophilia.  He was 1st admitted for routine surgery July 18,  released evening of July 19, and readmitted July 22. He has since had 2 additional surgeries. He developed antibiotic resistant MRSA infection and required a PICC line. He has needed blood factor to keep him from continuously bleeding. He has a long road to recovery ahead.

At this moment funds are needed to provide meals and childcare to the family while Mom is at the hospital with Jude. Dad is working in the family owned small business. If he doesn't go to work, there is no pay. No pay means they can't pay medical expenses. The medical bills are quickly piling up. This was unexpected and devastating. Please give any small amount and help this family through this trying time.

story:
Today, 5,596,000 Americans are living with paralysis; that's nearly 1 in 50 people.  Almost 1.3 million of those are spinal cord injured and there are 12,000 new cases every year.

Being paralyzed wreaks havoc on a person's life.  Imagine one day you're living your life on your terms and the next day you can't move, can't feel your legs, maybe you can't breathe on your own.  Think of all the things that must run through this person's mind: "I'll never chase my kids around the yard again," "I'll never take that trip I always dreamed of," "I'll be alone the rest of my life, no one will ever want me."

It is time for all of us to realize that this does not have to be true.  As the Christopher & Dana Reeve Foundation tell us: "Scientists and researchers know this isn't true."

Having believed and known for many years that the body can regenerate after injury and trauma, including spinal cord injury, this project takes Dr. Peter Lathrop's years of experience acting on that knowing forward. Dr. Lathrop has been successfully treating people with paralysis for nearly 20 years.  His treatment system is demonstrating breakthrough results for the people he serves.  Until now, we have only been able to treat one or two people at a time - it is time to harness this knowledge and expand it to a larger population. You can help!

Yes, we want you to help us with two clear paths.  It is SIMPLE really and takes into account the desires of most who hear about our work.  

1.  Study the process, examine the data, determine if it tells a compelling story.

2.  Offer the treatment now to those who don't want to wait.  It is available.  

1. Clinical Study Execution

Our work, until now, has been to develop best practices for employing this treatment protocol. We feel that now is the time to broaden our research, formally document our results and engage the larger medical community.

The system Dr. Lathrop has developed is compromised of treatment with state of the art, FDA cleared electromedicine devices in combination with neuro-psychology therapies, neuromuscular rehabilitation,  including neural - patterning, as well as cleansing/alkalizing the body.  It is a whole person approach.  The system is based on a deep understanding of neurophysiology, neuro-psychology and the mind-body connection.

Until now, we have gathered only qualitative research, like Keith's story. A formalized clinical study will provide the quantitative data necessary to expand the treatment protocol to other practitioners and restore mobility to many, many more people.

2. Treating People Now

Due to the nature of their injuries, many people suffering from paralysis and nerve damage are tapped out financially. Your support will help us create a fund to provide supplemental financial assistance for the treatment to those that qualify.

As we treat people now we are also developing the curriculum to teach delivery of the treatment system to others. It is important to "duplicate" Dr. Lathrop's efforts, in order to give more people access.  We have our first practitioner in training already.  If you know of health care practitioners who would be interested and qualified share this project with them.  

Won't you join us?  Here are some ways to get involved:

  1. Add your voice and spread the word.  Yes, you can make a difference.  Share this campaign.  Join our Ambassadors Group to receive updates you can post and tweet about.
  2. Donate.  Your contribution will fund breakthrough research in the area of spinal cord injury and potentially help someone living with paralysis "take the journey back" to able and agile.
  3. Support someone in your network or community by pledging specifically for them. Tell us who they are with your pledge.


Even More Details If You Want Them!


According to the Christopher & Dana Reeve Foundation nearly 1 in 50 people live with paralysis.  This is equivalent to the combined populations of Los Angeles, Philadelphia and Washington DC.  It means that we are all one degree of separation from someone who suffers from paralysis and can't live life on their own terms.   Please help us help them now.

"Hi, my name is Dr. Peter Lathrop and I am a neuroscientist, biomedical engineer, inventor and Clinical Neurophysiologist in day to day practice helping to repair injuries to muscles, ligaments, tendons and nerves and to stop the pain those injuries cause.  I use FDA cleared medical technology and specific treatment protocols.  My day to day work takes place in a clinic in San Diego, CA.  Our clinic website is www.sandiegopaintreatment.com.

"Over the past 25 years I have also been fortunate to work with a number of people who have suffered from more significant nerve damage - hemiplegics, paraplegics and quadriplegics.  

"Each has made significant improvements in their physical function as a result of our work together and the program I developed.  This great improvement in function has always come after they have already had considerable typical rehabilitation.  You saw two such stories in the video.  The referenced quadriplegic client had been regularly working at a known spinal cord injury rehabilitation center for about two years.

"The spinal cord injury regeneration treatment system I have developed, which I teach to clients and their caregivers, is intensive and multifaceted.  It goes on for 12-18 months as the recovery of the body is a slow, steady process.  I use my experience as a psychotherapist (Master's Degree in Psychology) and neurophysiologist (Ph.D in Neurophysiology) as well as my deep knowledge of regenerative electromedicine to develop and refine the program.  

"The treatment system is compromised of:

  1. Regenerative Electromedicine.  Two different types of electrical stimulation devices are used over the course of treatment, one a low voltage milli-amperage current electrical stimulation device, and the other a low voltage microcurrent electrical stimulation device.  Both devices are FDA cleared and are commercially available.  In the video you see the SCENAR from RITM OKB.  This is the primary device I currently use.
  2. Neuro-psychology techniques which include hypnosis, neuro-linguistic programming and regenerative visualization exercises.
  3. Neuromuscular Rehabilitation which includes neural-patterning to facilitate recovery of muscle mass and muscle control lost during the period of paralysis.
  4. Health and well-being coaching which includes but is not limited to creating the “inner terrain” in the body conducive to healing (cleansed, more alkaline and well-hydrated).

The treatment system is based on a deep understanding of neurophysiology, neuro-psychology, the mind-body connection and the field of regenerative electromedicine."

Why Now?

"Two clients I have helped in the past year, along with a growing team around me, are fueling the desire to bring the work I do out into the word for further study and to make it accessible to others - practitioners, caregivers, and those paralyzed themselves.  I thank you all:  Keith Cammell (the young man you see in the video), Elizabeth Blower, my wife Kay Lathrop, Donald Tucker, Richard and Sally Crawford, and Barbara Scott.  I also thank my colleagues in our clinic for their support - Barbara Miller, Dr. Harry Heeder, and Dr. Anna Phillips.

"I know this campaign will likely put a spotlight on us.  There will be skeptics and naysayers.  And there will be those filled with hope who believe a different future is possible, like we do.

"There are many spinal cord injury research foundations out there.  They are doing very important work.  Progress is being made.  And, I have learned and known for years (as a neuroscientist and electrical engineer) that the body can regenerate, that nerves can regenerate and ways in which to help them.  This information has been available for a long time.  Robert O Becker, M.D. actually first published The Body Electric in 1985.  (He was one of my professors).  It is time for me to exercise my voice and take a stand to help make progress happen.

"I have had people say 'if you can do this why aren't you promoting it?  Why don't more people know about it?  Why aren't they beating down your door to get the treatment?'

"All I can say is I have just done this work quietly.  It has been one of many things I have done clinically.  People find me.  I help them.  We move on.  I am a neuroscientist and a clinician.  Ask my wife - I am not a marketer or promoter.  Lately though something has been happening.  I guess it is the internet.  It is video.  It is the people around me who are witnessing the work and the outcomes.  I have an amazing team.   It is people who are just not accepting the prognosis 'you will never walk again.'  It is people wanting to believe and wanting to make a difference.

"It seems it is time to come out and ask for help, your help if you are reading this, to get get this treatment system out to others more broadly.  To teach other people what I do.  To study the processes and perhaps perfect them.  To make a difference."

This campaign is to generate the interest we need to really make a difference.  

Our overall aim is to be a game changer in spinal cord injury rehabilitation and recovery. We believe we have a breakthrough that should be further studied.  

To achieve our goals we begin from here with the following approach:

  1. Design and develop a robust clinical study to document the results of 10+ people fully participating in the treatment system.  We will ultimately be identifying candidates who are within two years of their initial spinal cord injury to participate in the study.  The final number and the specific qualifications will be determined by the research team.  In the world of health care, data is important.  Published outcomes begin to create change.  I told my team we wouldn't take this "out there" in a bigger way unless we conducted a study as part of the process.  I am a scientist after all.  The results of the first study participants will then fuel future study - hopefully catching the eye of larger institutions involved in spinal cord injury research.  We believe we can be one of the "game changers" in the field of spinal cord injury rehabilitation and recovery.
  2. Offer the regeneration-increase function treatment system people right now who believe they will one day be able to live life more independently and, yes, walk again.
  3. To create a video documentary about the therapeutic treatment system, the training of the caregivers who will administer part of the treatment system, and the responses of those enrolled in the study.  The video documentary process will be shepherded by our team member Richard Crawford, an award winning video producer and film maker.  This goal will be pursued as part of Phase 2 and/or our stretch goals in this campaign.
What We Need & What You Get

Clinical Study Design and Development

In order to conduct the full clinical study we need to properly lay the groundwork We have engaged George Poole, an experienced Clinical Study Manager to guide the process.  George is a medical scientist with years of experience in the medical field of study.

Our first financial goal of $250K allows us to design and develop a study aimed at quantify the results. We will align with a healthcare institution and other medical professionals to conduct the study.  We will purchase the medical technology for those involved in the study design so they become familiar with it.  We will need to obtain IRB approvals.  Along the way we will need regulatory, biostats and legal (contract) assistance.  This phase will will take us to enrollment of the first candidate.

We are also researching grants and will apply for those that are appropriate.

Treating People Now
As we prepare for the clinical study we will continue to offer the treatment system.  Many people just want to get back to their lives.  When you contribute at the $500 level or more you can designate that up to 50% of your donation can go to a "fund" set aside to help provide treatment to qualified candidates who have financial challenges.

A common question is, "What is the cost of treatment?"  There isn't a short answer. Cost depends on the client's underlying condition (type and extent of paralysis) as well as geographic location (are we traveling to them or them to us?). Some costs are fixed and some, like travel and accommodations,  are not.  

Each client makes an investment in purchasing the FDA cleared medical technology they need. The client and their caregivers are trained in the daily use of the device(s).  If you designate part of your dollars to an assistance fund, that money could buy someone a $1000 microcurrent therapy device or a $4500 SCENAR.

Perks & Rewards
We have created several levels of giving with different rewards. Of course, the biggest reward is knowing that you are helping people begin their journey back to mobility.

The Impact
Imagine being robbed of the ability to live life on your own terms, to lose all independence and be dependent on others.  Imagine the life of the family.  EVERYONE'S life changes. 

We hope to transform people's lives back to independence so they can do what they are here to do. You can be a part of this transformation and witness the process by joining our team.

Other Ways You Can Help
In any way you can help please do.  Get the word out.  Share the link to this video and campaign.  Make some noise about it.  Use the Indiegogo share tools here on the site.  They are designed to help you share.

Perhaps you know bloggers who would write about our story.  Share with them.  I think the name of the game is SHARE early and often.  In the world today there is so much "noise" right?  Emails, texts, social media, news, advertising etc.  It takes being persistent and multiple shares with PASSION to get through to people. 

Perhaps in your life there are specific people you know you need to CALL.  Online sharing isn't enough.  Please do pick up the phone and call.

Whatever you THINK of to do - do it!  Thank you.  With much appreciation.

The treatment system is based on a deep understanding of neurophysiology, neuro-psychology, the mind-body connection and the field of regenerative electromedicine."Why Now?"Two clients I have helped in the past year, along with a growing team around me, are fueling the desire to bring the work I do out into the word for further study and to make it accessible to others -
