Barbara Miller, Dr. Harry Heeder, and Dr. Anna Phillips."I know this campaign will likely put a spotlight on us.  There will be skeptics and naysayers.  And there will be those filled with hope who believe a different future is possible, like we do."There are many spinal cord injury research foundations out there.  They are doing very important work.  Progress is being made.  And, I have learned and known for years (as a neuroscientist and electrical engineer) that the body can regenerate, that nerves can regenerate and ways in which to help them.  This information has been available for a long time.  Robert O Becker, M.D. actually first published The Body Electric in 1985.  (He was one of my professors).  It is time for me to exercise my voice and take a stand to help make progress happen."I have had people say 'if you can do this why aren't you promoting it?  Why don't more people know about it?  Why aren't they beating down your door to get the treatment?'"All I can say is I have just done this work quietly.  It has been one of many things I have done clinically.  People find me.  I help them.  We move on.  I am a neuroscientist and a clinician.  Ask my wife - I am not a marketer or promoter.  Lately though something has been happening.  I guess it is the internet.  It is video.  It is the people around me who are witnessing the work and the outcomes.  I have an amazing team.   It is people who are just not accepting the prognosis 'you will never walk again.'  It is people wanting to believe and wanting to make a difference."It seems it is time to come out and ask for help, your help if you are reading this, to get get this treatment system out to others more broadly.  To teach other people what I do.  To study the processes and perhaps perfect them.  To make a difference."This campaign is to generate the interest we need to really make a difference.  Our overall aim is to be a game changer in spinal cord injury rehabilitation and recovery. We believe we have a breakthrough that should be further studied.  To achieve our goals we begin from here with the following approach:

Design and develop a robust clinical study to document the results of 10+ people fully participating in the treatment system.  We will ultimately be identifying candidates who are within two years of their initial spinal cord injury to participate in the study.  The final number and the specific qualifications will be determined by the research team.  In the world of health care, data is important.  Published outcomes begin to create change.  I told my team we wouldn't take this "out there" in a bigger way unless we conducted a study as part of the process.  I am a scientist after all.  The results of the first study participants will then fuel future study - hopefully catching the eye of larger institutions involved in spinal cord injury research.  We believe we can be one of the "game changers" in the field of spinal cord injury rehabilitation and recovery.

Offer the regeneration-increase function treatment system people right now who believe they will one day be able to live life more independently and, yes, walk again.
To create a video documentary about the therapeutic treatment system, the training of the caregivers who will administer part of the treatment system, and the responses of those enrolled in the study.  The video documentary process will be shepherded by our team member Richard Crawford, an award winning video producer and film maker.  This goal will be pursued as part of Phase 2 and/or our stretch goals in this campaign.
What We Need & What You GetClinical Study Design and DevelopmentIn order to conduct the full clinical study we need to properly lay the groundwork We have engaged George Poole, an experienced Clinical Study Manager to guide the process.  George is a medical scientist with years of experience in the medical field of study.Our first financial goal of $250K allows us to design and develop a study aimed at quantify the results. We will align with a healthcare institution and other medical professionals to conduct the study.  We will purchase the medical technology for those involved in the study design so they become familiar with it.  We will need to obtain IRB approvals.  Along the way we will need regulatory, biostats and legal (contract) assistance.  This phase will will take us to enrollment of the first candidate.We are also researching grants and will apply for those that are appropriate.Treating People NowAs we prepare for the clinical study we will continue to offer the treatment system.  Many people just want to get back to their lives.  When you contribute at the $500 level or more you can designate that up to 50% of your donation can go to a "fund" set aside to help provide treatment to qualified candidates who have financial challenges.A common question is, "What is the cost of treatment?"  There isn't a short answer. Cost depends on the client's underlying condition (type and extent of paralysis) as well as geographic location (are we traveling to them or them to us?). Some costs are fixed and some, like travel and accommodations,  are not.  Each client makes an investment in purchasing the FDA cleared medical technology they need. The client and their caregivers are trained in the daily use of the device(s).  If you designate part of your dollars to an assistance fund, that money could buy someone a $1000 microcurrent therapy device or a $4500 SCENAR.Perks & RewardsWe have created several levels of giving with different rewards. Of course, the biggest reward is knowing that you are helping people begin their journey back to mobility. The ImpactImagine being robbed of the ability to live life on your own terms, to lose all independence and be dependent on others.  Imagine the life of the family.  EVERYONE'S life changes.  We hope to transform people's lives back to independence so they can do what they are here to do. You can be a part of this transformation and witness the process by joining our team.Other Ways You Can HelpIn any way you can help please do.  Get the word out.  Share the link to this video and campaign.  Make some noise about it.  Use the Indiegogo share tools here on the site.  They are designed to help you share.Perhaps you know bloggers who would write about our story.  Share with them.  I think the name of the game is SHARE early and often.  In the world today there is so much "noise" right?  Emails, texts, social media, news, advertising etc.  It takes being persistent and multiple shares with PASSION to get through to people.  Perhaps in your life there are specific people you know you need to CALL.  Online sharing isn't enough.  Please do pick up the phone and call.Whatever you THINK of to do - do it!  Thank you.  With much appreciation.

story:
We're getting married!

It's so crazy to think that the big event is almost here.  We'll be getting married on December 6 and then honeymooning in Paris and Amsterdam for a week.  As an alternative gift option you can help us out with a night at our hotel, a nice dinner, etc.

story:
Who is Destiny Nickelsen?

Destiny Nickelsen is a cosplayer.

She is a beautiful young girl with a passion for creativitity, using costume creation and modeling as her outlet. Her family has a history of cancer.

 

This past week, Destiny learned that she has cancer in a mole on her back. Melanoma, the most dangerous form of skin cancer. According to the World Health Organization, melanoma causes approximately 48,000 deaths worldwide per year. We don't want to add to that statistic.

 

Melanoma is the most serious type of skin cancer due to its tendency to spread (or metastasize) to lymph nodes and other areas of the body, as compared to the other types of skin cancer.

 

Destiny Needs Help.

Destiny is not covered by health insurance. This situation compromises her future in a big way. To treat melanoma, she will need to undergo surgery and radiation treatment, and possibily chemotherapy.

 

Destiny's cancer may already be in the stage II phase. She will soon undergo a biopsy to check depth, and we'll hope for the best. This page will be updated continually, you will know as soon as we know.

 

This girl works hard. Destiny's income is supplemented by selling cosplay prints in her online store. But without insurance, medical bills are astronomical. Her current estimated treatment costs are $5,000, but they may end up higher. All funds donated to the campaign will go directly to Destiny's bank account.

 

What You Get:


We're going to bet that you know someone who has been affected by cancer. Maybe it's you. Maybe it's your family. If you know Destiny, it's her.

 

If you're a fellow "geek" or cosplayer and found yourself in her situation, you would probably welcome a group of supporters willing to help fund your treatment. Positivity and laughter affect the healing process in a big, big way.

 

Since this is a financial crisis, Destiny doesn't have much to give - tangibly, anyway. She has prints from her cosplay store and can post YouTube videos expressing her personal thanks for your donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you cannot contribute financially, sharing this page through your social media channels can help more than you know. Use hashtag #DesvsCancer and link to this campaign to help spread the word.

 

If you'd rather, you can buy directly from Destiny's online store. All funds directly benefit her. Alternatively, you could donate to the Melanoma Fund of New England.

 

Connect with Destiny:


Facebook

Twitter

YouTube

 

 

Updates:

Campaign banner graphic by Brad Pilcher. Thanks Brad!

7/23: Huge thanks to all who have donated and shared the page! I have passed all of your private comments on to Destiny and she couldn't be more grateful.

7/23: Destiny has a doctor's appointment (including a full screening to check for other spots) on Monday. I'll update this page afterwards. :) I'm amazed at how quickly this has grown! Thank you.

7/24: Woke up this morning to see that we beat the goal! I am astounded by how quickly people came together for this. Thank you SO much! Here's a post from Destiny regarding upcoming conventions and leftover funds. I'll continue to update this page as we hear more. Not sure what the final bills will be, and we have our fingers crossed for Monday's appointment. Hopefully the moles can be easily removed.


7/29: Destiny went to the doctor today. She will have the full body scan results later this week, but the mole removal will happen next week! :)

9/17: Longtime no update! Sorry about that, guys. I'm still floored that we hit the goal so quickly and people have continued to donate extra. Thank you so much!

Destiny's postponed treatment until after the funds are distributed, due to issues within the family, hence the lack of updates. In a complete coincidence, the funds will hit her account on her birthday tomorrow - a nice surprise, once I realized! I'll continue to update here once there's news. Thank you again for your kindness!

story:
Our Story-

My name is Lauren and I run a small start up company called CLEAN BODIES© that does everything from delivering FRESH RAW ORGANIC Juices and Sprouted Almond Smoothies, to intense Nutritional Therapy.
My mother, whose multiple sclerosis has progressed, came to visit for 14 days in order for me to heal and help her as much as possible. She arrived to me broken, dehydrated and malnourished. After 14 days of our Nutritional Therapy, she gained 4 lbs of needed good fat, was hydrated on a cellular level and felt better than ever. The cleanse we did worked miracles and she was sent home with a Guide and tools to continue her healing, but this time on her own.
She is just one of many women and men who throughout the past 2 years Clean Bodies© has assisted in healing and educating on the importance of RAW LIVING Foods and Juicing, and whose lives have been changed forever!
 
 
 
What We Need & What You Get

First of all, this site takes about $500 from whatever we make so I had to raise our goal to accomadate that :( ====> :)

We need money to move into a bigger space with a commercial kitchen and new equipment. Along with the ability to help those living on very tight budgets benefit from what Clean Bodies© has to offer.  We do a lot of pro bono work at this time and want Clean Bodies© to be a household name!!  All we do is share and care information that saves lives and change the way people view "getting healthy".

With your help, anyone anywhere can change their diet and with that their LIFE!!

For contributing at least $30, you will receive a FREE Clean Bodies© Practical Guide to How to Attain a Lean & Clean Body. You will learn all there is to know about nutritional therapy and how to eat RAW and make yummy juices!

The Impact

If we successful reach our goal it then becomes more possible for anyone anywhere heal THEMSELVES, via this page. And the nutritional therapy needs to be shared to all that are willing to listen!  The proof is in the pudding and the 2 weeks mom just spent with me have proven EVERYTHING WE ARE DOING IS WORKING. It saddened me to see her go so soon because there is still so much work to be done!

With your help, Nutritional Therapy through RAW LIVING FOODS & Juicing could quite possibly become more accepted and allow for other people like myself, to pop up and heal their own friends and families, without thousands of dollars of medical bills!

Other Ways You Can Help

But hey, if you do not have the funds to help, it means enough that you have even taken the time to read this proposal. Maybe you can share this on your social media pages? Either way, I am grateful!

story:
Renée's Next Adventure

Renée is retiring from the federal government and embarking upon an new chapter. While much is still unwritten (as are the best adventures) she's sure to be filling her days with travel, yoga, kayaking, friends and family.

We invite those inclined to join us in a group gift to purchase a kayak for Renée. Let's be honest, plaques and memorabilia just aren't her style. 

Those that donate will be included in a group card that is gifted with the kayak. Now let's make plans to join her on the water!

We invite those inclined to join us in a group gift to purchase a kayak for Renée. Let's be honest, plaques and memorabilia just aren't her style. 
Those that donate will be included in a group card that is gifted with the kayak. Now let's make plans to join her on the water!

story:
Hello,


My name is Manuela, I am 45 years old, widowed for almost 3 years and thus single mom of two children aged 20 and 5 years.

After the sudden death of my husband I fell into a deep hole and I now want to get back on my own feet by helping other people.

A wonderful and gentle kind of helping can be through hypnosis, which I do very well.

In order to keep my children and me living a good life, I would like to start my own business and need financial help for it. With the money I would have to create a website, buy missing "tools" and promotional material.

The word CARDO comes from the Latin, meaning turning or turning point. I want my hypnosis to be the turning point in their lives, when they leave my office.

Should I reach more than the financial goal, I will send the money to the hospice in Flensburg, because we had a wonderful support in our grief.

Through my own destiny, I know how important it is to get help and would now very much like to give my help to needy people  after we have received so much help.

Of course there will be people who can not help me financially, but I would be grateful for any experience which goes towards independence in the health sector.

I would be really glad if you would support me and spread this campaign, whether by link or dissemination via Facebook or via e-mail or or or

 

Hallo,


mein Name ist Manuela, ich bin 45 Jahre alt, seit knapp 3 Jahren verwitwet und dadurch allein erziehende Mama von zwei Kindern im Alter von 20 und 5 Jahren.

Nach dem plötzlichen Tod meines Mannes fiel ich in ein tiefes Loch und ich möchte nun eigenständig wieder auf die Beine kommen, indem ich anderen Menschen helfe.

Eine wundervolle und sanfte Art der Hilfe kann man durch Hypnose erfahren, welche ich sehr gut beherrsche.

Um meine Kinder und mich damit über Wasser zu halten, möchte ich mich selbstständig machen und benötige dafür nun finanzielle Hilfe. Mit dem Geld möchte ich eine Homepage erstellen lassen, noch fehlende "Arbeitsgeräte" und Werbematerial kaufen.

Das Wort Cardo stammt aus dem lateinischen und bedeutet Wende oder Wendepunkt. Ich möchte mit meiner Hypnose dazu beitragen, dass es für andere Menschen der Wendepunkt in ihrem Leben wird, wenn sie meine Praxis verlassen.

Sollte ich das finanzielle Ziel mehr als erreichen, so werde ich das Geld dem Hospiz in Flensburg zukommen lassen, da wir dort eine wundervolle Unterstützung bei unserer Trauerarbeit erfahren haben.

Durch mein eigenes Schicksal weiß ich, wie wichtig es ist Hilfe zu bekommen und möchte nun sehr gerne Geben, nachdem wir so viel Hilfe bekommen haben.


Natürlich wird es Menschen geben, die mir nicht finanziell helfen können, aber ich wäre auch für jeglichen Erfahrungsaustausch dankbar, der in Richtung Selbstständigkeit im Gesundheitssektor geht.

Ich wäre wirklich froh, wenn Sie/du/ihr diese Kampagne unterstützen und verbreiten würden, sei es per Linkverbreitung oder über Facebook oder per E-Mail oder oder oder

 

DANKE AN MEINE BISHERINGEN UNTERSTÜTZER!!! ICH KONNTE NUN WERBE- UND ARBEITSMATERIAL KAUFEN, NUN FEHLEN NOCH WEBSEITE UND BÜROBEDARF.

story:
Short Summary

We are the most successful European, university based sport club.

  • We have both 1-1 male and female premiership team and 1 male championship team. We have 4 underaged teams, the talents of the future. We have the youngest average age of the premiership!
  • The winner of the Hungarian Premiership can play for the Champions League. We are confident, that with an international coach and hard work, our talented team can be the first university based team in the world to reach the UEFA Champions League.

We need to pay the salary and living of such a professional coach.

We do not ask just simply for support. We ask you to invest in our future and to once visit Hungary, our beautyful country and cheer at our game, where you will feel you contributed to our success! You will not be forgotten!

What We Need & What You Get

We need extra financial means to cover the extra costs.

  • $USD 60 000 would cover the salary of the coach and the extra rental costs of the training pitch. The coach lowered his salary, as he loves the sport as much as we do.
  • Are you PRO enough? Be a Premiership player, be a PRO Perk! You will be signed by the team and you would play in the Hungarian Premiership, appear on TV and be celebrated in the MEDIA. 

If we don't reach the entire goal - which can't happen, because we accept only success - then we will use the extra funds to go to international tournaments such as the University World Championship. We can learn a lot there, too.

The Impact

The future belongs to those who believe in their dreams. Our dream is to be the first ever university sport team to enter the UEFA Champions League. As US President Wilson said: "We grow great by dreams. All big men are dreamers." We are!
 
  • We were visited by Champions League winner coach, Henk ten Cate, who won Gold with Barcelona and Silver with Chelsea. See photo on www.bmefutsal.hu
  • Remember James Bond: Casino Royale? Celebrated world famous actor, Mads Mikkelsen supports us, too: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q3hjfBukJrk Check his IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0586568/
Be the change you want to see in the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

We are university students so we understand, sometimes even few $ means a lot. However, one click and one share takes a minuite and is definitely FREE:

  • Sharing is caring!
  • We are honoured if you even take your time to share our dream.

As Muhammad Ali said: "Champions aren't made in the gyms. Champions are made from something they have deep inside them—a desire, a dream, a vision." Share our dream, invest in our future!

The Impact
The future belongs to those who believe in their dreams. Our dream is to be the first ever university sport team to enter the UEFA Champions League. As US President Wilson said: "We grow great by dreams. All big men are dreamers." We are!
 


We were visited by Champions League winner coach, Henk ten Cate, who won Gold with Barcelona and Silver with Chelsea. See photo on www.bmefutsal.hu

Remember James Bond: Casino Royale? Celebrated world famous actor, Mads Mikkelsen supports us, too: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q3hjfBukJrk Check his IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0586568/


Be the change you want to see in the world!

Other Ways You Can Help
We are university students so we understand, sometimes even few $ means a lot. However, one click and one share takes a minuite and is definitely FREE:

Sharing is caring!
We are honoured if you even take your time to share our dream.


As Muhammad Ali said: "Champions aren't made in the gyms. Champions are made from something they have deep inside them—a desire, a dream, a vision." Share our dream, invest in our future!

story:
Check out our new campaign to launch a new Moringa Green Energy Shot and reforest Haiti at http://igg.me/at/moringa-energy-shots.

As seen in The SF Chronicle, Forbes and Triple Pundit 

Our World Needs Kuli Kuli

There are millions of health-conscious people looking for natural ways to nourish their busy lifestyles, just as there are a billion people seeking nourishment to survive. We’re connecting these two groups through moringa. Moringa is a powerful tool in the fight against malnutrition because it requires little water and flourishes in harsh climates. We’re working with women’s cooperatives in West Africa to grow more moringa for their communities and create economic opportunity. We’re bringing this West African grown moringa to the United States in the form of delicious, raw* and gluten-free Kuli Kuli Bars.

* Honey Almond and Black Cherry are completely raw. Dark Chocolate Cherry is 90% raw, since the chocolate chips have been cooked.

Filled with simple, nutritious ingredients and a uniquely refreshing moringa flavor, Kuli Kuli Bars contain just the right amounts of fiber, protein, iron, and vitamins to help you power through the day. If you’re tired of eating energy bars that are too sweet, too dry, and full of unpronounceable ingredients, help us do our first manufacturing run by backing our campaign today. 

What’s the Money For?

The good news is, we can do this pretty economically. But we need your support to make Kuli Kuli bars available to the world. Most importantly, we need to raise funds for our first production run. That means $32,300 to do our first manufacturing run, including ingredients, packaging and labels. In addition, we need at least $5,000 to cover grocery store fees and sampling costs; $3,500 in legal fees and insurance; $3,200 for distribution and storage; $1,000 to build our online marketplace; and $5,000 to further develop out our supply chain in West Africa. All together, that’s $50,000 which is why we need your help.

What's In Them?

Kuli Kuli contains just a few simple, all natural ingredients plus moringa to provide a powerful burst of nutrition and energy. High in fiber, protein, vitamins and antioxidants but low in calories, Kuli Kuli bars are perfect for breakfast or as a pre-workout snack.

The Kuli Kuli Story

After working with moringa in the Peace Corps to reduce malnutrition in Niger, our CEO Lisa wanted to continue to support women in West Africa to grow more moringa and utilize it to improve the health of their families and communities. Many of the women we work with are earning up to $300 per month -- that’s a lot of money in West Africa!

The idea sounded pretty intriguing to Valerie, Jordan, Anne, and Nadia. For the past two years we’ve been doing research -- both in the kitchen and in the field, trying to figure out a way to make an impact on global nutrition through moringa.

But the thing is, we can’t keep up with the demand. It takes three of us six hours to make 200 bars -- the same amount of bars that a factory could make in less than 2 minutes. So we need your help to produce our first manufacturing run of these bars and bring them to the world.  

Rewards 

Moringa seeds so that you too can seed the revolution (crazy bug not included)

Stylish Kuli Kuli aprons (Our only male is modeling it for you)

Moringa powder and recipe cards

A weekend of health and wellness at a Napa winery

The Next Steps

This Indiegogo project is only the beginning of what we intend to create: our goal is to build a series of moringa products and a network of moringa cooperatives improving nutrition in communities around the world. Help us get our first product off the ground and we will seed the movement to a healthier world.

story: hello my name is stephen norton im 28 years old i live in huntington beach ca with my wife tammy norton. 8 months ago my wife and i set out to have our 1st child and were successful immedietly witch was amazing and made us very happy. at about the 6 month mark somthing went very wrong. i woke up to my wife seizering on our bedroom floor. after rushing her to the hospital shes was listed as critical condition with preeclampsia . i was told they had to deliver my son right away or my wife and son wouldnt make it. my wife was in the icu for 5 days but thankfull made a full recovery and is doing great today. as for my son bodhi he was rushed to miller childrens hospital in long beach ca. we were told we were going to be on a emotional roller coaster for a while i could have never imagined it would be this hard. he had a rough start. his stomach was preforated and needed suregy he made it through like we knew he would cuz hes a tough lil fighter. he was given a clostomy bag that he still has today. shortly after that we were informed his ventrical was open and he needed heart surgary to corect the problem. again my boy powered though it. since then he has strugled with lung issues and infections he continues to fight thru  everthing that is thrown at him. today he is doing pretty well hes been stable and continus to do well he has good and bad days but the bad days are becoming less and less. the reason we set up the donation web site is we are swamped with bills and insurance cost . we have him on my wifes insurance now thank god but we racked up cost before that went thru and the insurance is only a shared cost we also drive everyday to go see him which is also adding up.any donated money will go to insurance cost, bills and gas to see our child.thank you so much for taking the time to read my story.

story:
THE MISSION AND WHY IT IS POSSIBLE.

We have all been told to brush, floss and see our dentist, BUT then why do 50% of us have gum disease?

Because, billions of bacteria living in the mouth produce disease-causing agents and regular brushing and flossing have only temporary effects (bacteria re-colonize the mouth within 2 minutes after brushing)!

Plaque Ops mint tablets promote oral health by defending against plaque and acid that bacteria make in your mouth every minute of the day.  We can fight for better oral health in millions, but we need your help to make this mission possible.


THE PROBLEM.

It is a big deal that adults and children increasingly have oral disease.  Why?  Your mouth is the gateway to your body’s health.  Poor oral health is associated with dementia, arthritis, heart disease, stroke, cancer and other diseases.  

Clinical studies also show that people who brush even twice a day do not live as long as those who brush more often.  Want proof?  Just ask your dentist or dental hygienist!


A breakthrough in oral health is needed...that is where Plaque Ops comes in. 


OUR SOLUTION.

You can tame the bacteria in your mouth, those little buggers that make acid and plaque and cause cavities, bad breath and gum disease, with a simple mint tablet called:


Your contribution to this campaign will help us manufacture Plaque Ops mint tablets and the pH test strips and enable final product and market testing.  The sooner we reach our goal, the sooner we can bring the product to you and your loved ones.


HOW IT WORKS.

Traditional oral care products use toxic chemicals to kill the bacteria in your mouth, which is why you have to spit them out!  Existing mints and gum only mask bad breath.

The natural ingredients in our mint tablets not only freshen your breath, but turn your oral bacteria away from making acid and plaque - the same acid and plaque that are involved in many chronic diseases. You can find some of our data presented in the Gallery section of this campaign.

We have also developed pH strips to test how our mints work for you.  In less than 1 minute, you will see effects on the acid level in your mouth.  How cool is that!?


WHO WE ARE.

The Company was founded in 2012 by Drs. Emily Stein, PhD and Bill Robinson, MD PhD.  Since then, a core team of motivated professionals have joined the ranks.  We truly believe in, and are excited by, the promise of our products in changing peoples' lives.  We have been working like crazy and are almost there!

A little bit about Emily:  Emily is a scientist with a desire to help improve the quality of life for her loved ones with disease.  She received her PhD in Microbiology at UC-Berkeley.  Her fellowship was at Stanford University in Immunology and Rheumatology.  Emily's current focus is to develop innovative products that solve problems in healthcare and chronic disease.  On the weekends, she can be found in her backyard with her 4-legged sidekicks.

A little bit about Bill:  Bill became a physician scientist because he wanted to make life better for people burdened by disease.  He holds a Medical Degree from Stanford University.  His fellowship training is in Rheumatology at UC-San Francisco.  Bill is currently an Associate Professor at Stanford University, where he pioneered advances in medical diagnostics and treatments for autoimmune disease.  On the weekends, you can find Bill on his bike hammering up the tallest hill around. 


OUR VISION.

Most healthcare products are built to treat disease instead of preventing it.  We believe in delivering scientifically-grounded, safe and effective products designed for promoting health.

Your contribution will not only help us bring Plaque Ops mint tablets to you, but our vision is to help those who either do not have the financial means to take care of their mouths, do not have access to oral care, or can no longer can do it for themselves (the elderly, the physically challenged, Alzheimer's patients and many others).


JOIN THE MISSION TO BRING ORAL HEALTH TO MILLIONS.

You have an opportunity to support something truly disruptive in oral care and help millions of people.  Please join our mission if you want to impact millions of people’s oral and overall health.


Imagine not having to pay hundreds or thousands of dollars every time you or a loved one go to the dentist.  Imagine a life with less cavities, root canals, or periodontal disease.  What about a life with a lower risk of heart attack, stroke, Alzheimer's disease or cancer? 



You hold the power to help turn these into reality.

Your support will enable us to provide you with a set of products that will help you personalize your lifestyle in a manner that promotes you and your loved one's health.

***We really care about you and your loved ones, that is why we founded the company and are launching Plaque Ops.  In the weeks to come, you will hear our stories describing why we joined the Plaque Ops Mission Possible.  It is not just our story that matters.  We want to hear your story -- why are you supporting this Mission?  If you are interested in sending us your story, which we hope you are, please go to:http://plaque-ops.com/share-your-story


EXACTLY HOW YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP COMPLETE OUR MISSION.

To date, Plaque Ops development has been funded by Emily, Bill, and Emily's awesome Uncle Robert.  With very lean financing, we have stretched each dollar and worked diligently for 3 years to complete the R&D, patent the unique formula, and finalize the product development.

We would love to have you along for this next phase!  Your support will enable us to manufacture our first 2,000 bottles of mints (1 bottle = a one-month supply), pH strips to measure mouth acid levels and final product testing.


Total budget*: $27,500

Bulk Ingredients, Manufacturing, Labeling and Packaging: $19,600

Shipping: $1,100

Product Testing: $3,500

Customer Feedback System: $1,300

Operations: $2,000

*We are extremely lean and have to pay for only a few consultants’ time (e.g., web designers, PR and legal), many of whom have significantly reduced their fees because they believe in Plaque Ops.  The core team is so dedicated that we are working gratis.  Therefore, almost every penny will go into making this revolutionary product.

In the event we do not raise all that we hope to, your contribution will be put towards the manufacture of Plaque Ops tablets.  The goal is to get product to those of us who need it most.  We have a great relationship with our U.S.-based licensed cGMP manufacturer who will let us scale back our order, if we need to.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 'MISSION POSSIBLE'.

If you are unable to contribute financially, no worries!  We are just as appreciative if you could help us spread the word.  Below are some tools that can help you get the word out about this great new product: “Join” and “Like” our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Plaque-Ops/370957203053238).

·  Connect with us on Pinterest (http://www.pinterest.com/PlaqueOps/)

·  Connect with us on Twitter (https://twitter.com/PlaqueOps)

·  Direct your friends and colleagues to our Indiegogo campaign by sharing tools.

·  Go to our website to learn more. (www.plaque-ops.com)

·  Email us to see how you can get involved! (info@plaque-ops.com)

·  Join our mailing list for future promotions and events. (sales@plaque-ops.com)

story:
Why be Jeremy's Angel 

The shirt says it all... He loves the Simpsons!!! :-)

 

Jeremy is one of the most thoughtful and caring men I know. His sense of humor and kindness is unmatched by anyone I have ever known. Unfortunately, he may never be the same after his brush with death following an explosion by a malfunctioning firework, and now he needs our help. 
 
My name is Justin Durham, and I was working with Jeremy the day he was injured. I have performed large firework shows in the past and I have never seen anything like what happened on the 4th of July 2013 in Kingman AZ. Directly after Jeremy was injured I rushed to is side and administered aid to him until rescue workers arrived. I stayed by Jeremy’s side until he was loaded into the ambulance and rushed to the hospital. The reason I want to raise money for Jeremy is because it is more than a miracle that he survived the explosion that has forever changed his life. Jeremy is still listed in critical condition and there are many questions still unanswered about the extent of Jeremy’s permanent injuries. What is known is that his life will never be the same. Because of this uncertainty it is unknown when or if Jeremy will ever be able to go to work again. Jeremy, like all of us, has bills to pay, and I want to take away the stress from him and his family of paying those bills so they can focus on recovery. If you help Jeremy you will be helping one of the greatest men I have ever met in my life. You will allow him to worry about nothing but recovering from his injuries and returning back to his life as fast as possible.

 

What We Need & What You Get 

While visiting Jeremy’s family in the hospital his mother expressed concerns of how his bills for regular debt will be paid. This concern is what I am trying to address with this campaign. In order to not make his family feel uncomfortable I did not ask what Jeremy’s specific amount of debt is so I am just guessing but I suspect we will need:

  • $5000 or more to cover his bills
  • All of this money will go straight to Jeremy and his family whether we reach our goal or not.(except fees from this site and any expenses spent raising donations i.e. printing, postage, events etc.)
  • Of course there are perks involved for your donations, I am not a wealthy man but I will give you personalized tokens of appreciation for your donations

The Impact

 Jeremy may not ever truly know how much people care for him and how much people have joined together to help him, but his family, you and I will know. You will relieve the pressure and burdens placed on Jeremy’s family to contact bill collectors and try to pay his debt. You will be an angel who helped his mother stay by his side during his recovery. You will be able to track his progress through video postings to my youtube channel where I will talk with family members and show all the help you gave to Jeremy and his family. 

Other Ways You Can Help

 Some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

  • You can ask your family and friends to get the word out and make some noise about Tthis campaign for Jeremy.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to assist you in sharing this story
  • Please check out Jeremy’s progress on youtube and give him encouragement in the comments and with video responses
  • Any progress Jeremy makes will be posted under my name cardelle68
  • Feel free to contact me about other ways you can help

Thank you!!!

 Jeremy may not ever truly know how much people care for him and how much people have joined together to help him, but his family, you and I will know. You will relieve the pressure and burdens placed on Jeremy’s family to contact bill collectors and try to pay his debt. You will be an angel who helped his mother stay by his side during his recovery. You will be able to track his progress through video postings to my youtube channel where I will talk with family members and show all the help you gave to Jeremy and his family. 
Other Ways You Can Help
 Some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

You can ask your family and friends to get the word out and make some noise about Tthis campaign for Jeremy.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to assist you in sharing this story
Please check out Jeremy’s progress on youtube and give him encouragement in the comments and with video responses
Any progress Jeremy makes will be posted under my name cardelle68
Feel free to contact me about other ways you can help

Thank you!!!

story:
Hell and Back- David Clark's Badwater Journey

The Badwater 135 is known as the toughest footrace on the planet. Thousands of the worlds greatest athletes apply every year for the chance to come test themselves in the extreme heat of Death Valley for this 135 mile run. The race starts at the Badwater Basin (283ft below sea level) and ends at The MT Whitney Portal at over 8,000ft. Only 35 "rookie runners" are invited each year, this year Badwater will feature a very unlikely athlete...

David Clark was once a man on the brink of death. He was 320lbs, alcoholic, abusing prescription pain killers, he had a heart condition, high blood pressure and two herniated discs unknown to him at the time. His daily routine consisted of vomiting blood, shaking, cold sweats, lying to all those around him and trying to figure out why his life was crumbling. Once on top of the world owning 13 retail stores by the time he was 29 he was now bankrupt clinically, emotionally and in every other sense of the word.

David picked himself up from the gutter and reinvented himself completely. Motivated by wanting to show his kids what a real comeback was, he decided to embrace sobriety and fitness. He has become a 160lbs accomplished endurance runner and coach finishing the Leadville 100 Mile Trail Run twice. Approaching 8 years of sobriety, David is not content to just run for glory, he has given back to the community around him. His group "The Hero Foundation" (formerly the Superman Project) works directly with people seeking a refuge from addiction and obesity by training them for endurance events. Members are not restricted to former addicts but also include people form all walks of life. Some who have been touched by addiction but also many who want to help prevent our youth from falling in this destructive pattern. These brave souls are marathoners and triathletes, mountain climbers and cyclists, walkers and 5k fun runners. The background of the members of the foundation are as diverse as the faces you will see at their group runs and adventures- this group calls themselves "The Asylum"

 

The cost of doing this race is considerable and we need your help to make it happen. We will be documenting this journey on film and David will be sharing his most personal thoughts as he prepares for and attempts this epic race. He will discuss his training, his mental state, his own recovery and why he is motivated to help others- nothing will be held back. It is our hope that this documentary will become a book and film that will fund The Hero Foundation in its efforts to help those struggling with their own demons. 

 

 

Why We Need Your Help:

 

This race is self supported, meaning the runner is completely dependent on his own crew to guide him and support him along the way. The logistics include multiple rental cars, hotel rooms for the crew along the route, air fare, food supplies and the $995 entry fee. 

 

The Impact:

 We feel we can help touch thousands of people who are in need of hope. David's story of redemption and transformation can inspire many people to take control of their own lives. Please help us to spread the encouraging vision of The Hero Foundation.
 
If you are unable to make a contribution please post a link to your Facebook page and help spread the word about this project.
 

Contributions:

Our levels of sponsorship will reflect our patriotism and love for the USA. The Badwater race typically features a mostly international field of athletes and foreign flags are always in abundance. We will be flying "Old Glory" along the course in style...

story:
The Coalition for Organ-Failure Solutions (COFS) is a non-profit health and human rights campaign created to combat human trafficking for organ removal (HTOR).  COFS works to identify and assist victims of HTOR.  We have launched this campaign as an urgent call for help as we now aim to assist Syrian refugee victims of HTOR in Lebanon in addition to newly identified victims we are committed to assist in Egypt, India and Nepal. 

A goal of 10,000USD would enable us to assist at least 150 victims with medical follow-up care, livelihood/ income generation opportunities, and towards avenues of justice and additional remedies.

Please join us in this effort to recognize the victims of this crime and their needs as a result of the commercial and illicit organ removal.   A donation and/or spreading the work will help us reach this goal and assist these otherwise abandoned victims.

story:
Making a Difference for Matt

Our Story:

The makers of this campaign represent the cast of the National Tour of Beauty and the Beast. On September 28th, 2012 a dear member of our cast, Matthew Farcher “Gaston”, was rushed to the hospital in Houston, TX. He had jaundice and was suffering from kidney failure. He was placed in the ICU while doctors administered a series of tests. Finally, Matt was diagnosed with atypical HUS (aHUS). AHUS is an ultra-rare, life-threatening, genetic blood disease that can progressively damage vital organs, leading to stroke, heart attack, kidney failure and death. Until a year ago, there was no treatment. Unable to eat, move, or even have enough energy to speak, Matt proceeded with dialysis treatments for his kidneys and was placed on a medication called Soliris. This drug was only released a year ago and is used as a therapy for this chronic disease. Because of its rarity, this drug costs $50,000/month and over $500,000/year. Matthew will have to be on this drug for the rest of his life to keep his disease at bay. Matthew is fighting for his life and it is our sincerest hope that you will donate and help us to fight with him. 

Throughout this entire ordeal, the cast of Beauty and the Beast has continued to fight along side him, trying to raise Matt’s spirits, encourage, and support him. As a way of doing our part, we have launched this website to try and raise money to go towards medical bills, drug bills, student loans, and the cost of living for his family, who have put their lives and careers on hold to be with him. 

 

How It Started:

When Matt was first diagnosed with aHUS, Matt's mother asked that the members of the cast start doing Random Acts of Kindness in Matt's name. We were inspired by her idea to spread love and positive energy to others, and we decided it was time to give back to her family. We are continuing our R.A.K. campaign and have created this website as a way for people to give back to Matt and his family! In Barbara’s words, “Let’s show God that with Matthew, so much good is happening!” This family is perserverant, positive, humble, giving, compassionate, altruistic, and ever deserving of any and all help.

 

What We Hope For:

We have several hopes in this campaign: 

  • We hope to raise $25,000 and MORE by February 14th to help Matt and his family in this time of great financial need. 
  • We hope to spread Matt's story to inspire hope, love, and spread positivty.
  • We hope that this campaign goes global. We want to reach out to theatre communities, families, friends, and supporters of Matt's cause around the globe.

PLEASE join us to spread the word about MAKING A DIFFERENCE FOR MATT!

story:
What is this for?

VIDA Volunteer is a charity registered in Minnesota that conducts mission trips to places like Honduras, Costa Rica, and Nicaragua to provide medical interventions to those in need, focusing specifically on veternarian care, dental care, and hospital care. The trips are composed of volunteers from around the country who are giving of their own time to travel to these places and provide care and aid to the people in need. With every trip that goes out from VIDA, the number of people they have helped continues to grow and grow, while their reach extends into other countries as well!

What We Need:

What would be absolutely amazing from everyone would be donations to help fund the trip as well as pay for medical supplies, airfare, travel, etc. We know that it is difficult to ask for money in today's economy, but any little bit would help! Any sort of donation to help alleviate the costs would be much appreciated.

The Importance:

With these trips, people and animals in developing countries can help gain a new insight to life and receive the care they deserve. With certified teams of doctors, dozens of volunteers, and willing partcipants, the people of these foreign countries can grow up and continue a healthy and happy life. Not only that, but they also teach the volunteers about their own cultures and way of living! It truly is a remarkable experience.

Want to find out more?

If you would like to find out more, please visit http://vidavolunteertravel.org/ and explore the trips, testimonies, and resources that are available through the charity. The more people who are aware of this, the greater the impact that we can have in society!

 

Thank you!

story:
Hi. My name is Damian, and I'm creating this campaign to ask for your support. In the video above, you can see footage of me experiencing involuntary muscular spasms. And if could hear the audio of the picture-in-picture, you could also hear involuntary vocalizations. These are manifestations of something known as kundalini syndrome. If you'd like to learn more about kundalini syndrome, you can read about it at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kundalini_syndrome.

It came about through my meditation practice, and overall, it's been an extremely positive influence in my life, helping me to grow and mature in ways that I didn't really imagine possible prior to that.

Unfortunately, it's also been very debilitating. The spasms have been so strong and draining in the last year, that I have been unable to work and bedridden, for the most part. I have been examined by a number of professionals, including an internist, a psychiatrist, a psychologist, a neuropsychologist, a bodyworker, a number of psychotherapists, and a number of spiritual teachers. They've all concluded that there's nothing wrong with me neurologically, physiologically, or psychologically, and really that I just need time to rest and let the syndrome take its course.

Fortunately, with time and with rest, it has been improving, and my expectation is that I will be able to work again in about a year. Unfortunately, I don't have any income right now. A year ago, I was working in a successful psychotherapy private practice, and once I'm able to work again, I hope to be able to counsel people once more.

Unfortunately, I'm not eligible for social security, disability, or unemployment, and my family is unable to help me, which is why I'm turning to people like you for support. If you'd like to make a donation, please click "contribute" on the right side of this page.  And whether or not you make a donation, I'd appreciate it if you'd consider sharing this campaign with others on Facebook, Twitter, etc, by posting a link or using IndieGoGo's sharing tools.

Thanks for reading, and thank you very much in advance for any support you might provide.

story:
Who Is She

Sheila is a thirty nine year old single mother . She has worked the last five years as a CNA at Parkbend nursing home, providing comfort and a smile to the residents. While pursuing her interest in dance, she was awarded a scholarship to study Flamenco dance in Spain. When she returned, she danced professionally and taught classes locally. Her daughter is an energetic copy of her that loves to sing and dance.

What Happened

Sheila was diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumor. The tumor is located in her cerebellum on the spinal column. She is unable to work due to its affects on her mobility, strength and speech.

Her health insurance; with its, $200 monthly premium, $1,500 yearly deductible and $50 copay every visit, will only pay $10,000 of the $100,000 for her radiation treatments. Is there really any doubt that this country needs heath care reform?

What She Needs

Our funding goal of $200,000 was set to help Sheila with radiation treatments, possible chemotherapy, doctor visits, her daughter will no doubt need school clothing and supplies, Her car is in need of repairs, about $250 to $400, rent, utilities,etc.

It is unknown if it is the full amount that she will need to get her life back on track. Sheila will be able to receive 93% of the funds raised (after Indiegogo's fees and the credit card processing fees are subtracted). If we are unable to reach our minimum goal, she will receive 88% of what is raised.

How You Can Help

To help Sheila with her overwhelming medical cost and bills, please click the big pink button at the top or bottom of this page that say "Contribute Now." When you do, you'll be able to enter the amount you'd like to contribute. You can donate with a credit card or PayPal. To see how close we are to meeting our goal of raising $200,000 look at the box at the top right of this page. Naturally, any amount you can contribute is a blessing, and all prayers make a difference.

Thank you in advance for supporting Sheila during this challenging time.

FYI: PayPal donations are available right away, but direct credit card transactions are not available until a week or two after the campaign ends. So, if at all possible, please make your donations through PayPal, so we can get these funds to Sheila sooner than later. You do not need a PayPal account to use PayPal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

• Pray for her.

• Please help us get the word out. Make some noise about her campaign, so  that as many people come across this donation page as possible.

  • “Like” AND share her Facebook link:

  •  http://www.facebook.com/SheilasRecovery

  • Go to the link above first then click like.

• Do this frequently. Facebook changed things, so only a fraction of your friends and family will actually see your posts at any given time. This means you have to post things several times, over several days or weeks, to increase the number of people who will see your support.

• Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! This will help increase her rankings on the Indiegogo site.

• If you are a business or professional, please consider donating money and perks to her campaign. The better perks we have, the more money we can raise to help Sheila.

• You may not feel like it's enough, but we appreciate every dollar. Trust us...they all add up. Your contribution will make a difference.

 

Thank you.

 

Peace to your house. And to all who live in it.

Your help is in the name of the Lord.

Who has made heaven and earth.

Lord hear our prayer. And let our cry reach up to You.

The Lord be with you. And with your spirit.

story:
About Doug

Our friend Doug is a beloved member of the thriving arts community in Kansas City, MO.  He continues to work and produce art even while undergoing chemo therapy to battle a recurrence of cancer.  The stress of mounting medical bills and the struggle to meet daily living expenses is taking its toll on him.


As a love rich but cash poor group of friends we are reaching out to the global community and asking those who are able to donate money to help keep Doug going during his treatment.  We’ve got the rest covered; rides to his appointments, company during chemotherapy, home- made casseroles and recreational outings to keep him smiling.

Friends of Doug have donated original pieces of art for each level of giving.  We do this with hope and gratitude for your spirit of generosity and acts of kindness.

Give Money, Get Art

Some very talented and generous Kansas City artists and collectors have donated pieces of art to give as rewards for donations.  When you donate money, you will receive a piece of art as a reward.

  • Each level of funding has specific pieces of art as rewards.  When you donate, you will receive a random piece of art from that tier of funding.  For example, when you donate $100 you will receive a piece of art from that $100 level.  
  • You can view the art and levels by clicking HERE.
  • All monies go to help with Doug's daily life and medical bills.

We Love Doug

As Doug undergoes chemo, we want to help him feel loved.  We'd like to ease his financial stress so he can focus on healing.  Let's spread the love.  We want to keep Doug around.  

Do It

So go ahead and make your donation now.   We've got some great art to give away.  Spread the word to your friends.  CLICK HERE to view the art and levels.  Thanks for donating!


Here's a quick preview of the art.  You can see a bigger, better view by clicking right HERE.

We Love DougAs Doug undergoes chemo, we want to help him feel loved.  We'd like to ease his financial stress so he can focus on healing.  Let's spread the love.  We want to keep Doug around.  Do ItSo go ahead and make your donation now.   We've got some great art to give away.  Spread the word to your friends.  CLICK HERE to view the art and levels.  Thanks for donating!Here's a quick preview of the art.  You can see a bigger, better view by clicking right HERE.

story:
Short Summary

I am an Uncle.  A rather normal, everyday Uncle.  At the end of one working day in December 2013 I took a phone call whilst on the train from the City to Kentish Town - it was on this phone call that I learned that my niece and God-daughter  Katie had woken up in the morning with a sudden onset of paralysis.  There was no clue as to the reason for this paralysis - futher down the line we have come to learn that it was caused by Neuromyelitis optica (NMO), also known as Devic's disease, is an uncommon neurological condition. A neurological condition is caused by disease or damage to the brain, spinal cord or nerves.

Katie was hospitalised for three months in the Salford Hospital, specifically Ward B3 and throughout that stay it was clear to see the devastating effects of NMO.  Ironically, Katie is one of the lucky 'victims' of this little known and almost completely misunderstood condition.  Katie has shown strength of character that would make anybody proud and she continues to make me proud now that she had dedicated herself to raising awareness and funds for the Ward in the hospital that specialises in the treatment and rehabilitation of NMO.

The impact of donations to Katie's cause will be far reaching, we all know the impact of budget cuts and this shows in wards such as this where sensory and rehabilitation equipment is in such high demand - a small donation could lead to stimulation of the mind of a patient, vastly improving the quality of life - NMO does not discriminate in any way - she was an typical 18 year old girl, studying Photography at A-Level and well on her way to commence her degree at London College of Fashion - all of this has now been delayed whilst Katie rehabilitates - for some patients, delaying is not an option.  Some NMO patients become a prisoner within their own body, unable to live a physical life.

Katie is raising money for the Ward B3 at Salford Hospital and all funds will go directly to the ward in order to facilitate acquisition of Sensory and Rehab Equipment.

The tiniest donation can ultimately lead to the most massive of benefits - improving the quality of a life - if you really cannot donate then please use the share tools to raise awareness of this campaign,

I am a normal, everyday Uncle and Katie was my normal, everyday Niece - this could be anyone - this could be you.  Please help to raise awareness of this campaign and donate if you can do so.

story:
The Problem

This year over 150,000 people will be diagnosed with a blood cancer, like leukemia and lymphoma. That’s just in the United States. After exhausting all options, including chemotherapy, radiation therapy and immunotherapy, a bone marrow transplant is typically the only remaining treatment option for blood cancer patients.  But a high failure rate and an acute shortage of donors make this treatment option a challenge. Complications arise due to the body’s rejection of the transplant and often the disease returns. Moreover, almost 65% of patients who require transplant from an unrelated donor are unable to find a match.

Our Story

After about four years of studying hematopoietic stem cells, in 2012 Dr. Vladislav Sandler postulated that cells similar to the progenitors that gave rise to blood stem cells during mammalian development exist in adults. The data supporting this hypothesis began to accumulate. Soon it became clear that this type of cell does indeed exist in adults. Dr. Sandler called these cells Adult Hemogenic Endothelium – AHE cells. It also became clear that AHE cells could be used for regeneration of the blood system. HemoGenyx was founded in 2013 in order to translate this discovery into clinical procedure.

The Method

AHE cells reside in tiny blood vessels – capillaries of several organs, such as the liver and umbilical cord. We can isolate these cells with either a small liver biopsy from the patient or from the blood vessels of an umbilical cord, activate the cells, and use them for transplantation. When AHE cells are transplanted, they start making new blood stem cells that regenerate the entire blood system of the recipient. What’s more, the isolated cells are not malignant because they never accumulated mutations or chromosomal rearrangements that often cause blood cancers to begin with and can make traditional bone marrow transplants fail.

Our approach has worked in numerous animal experiments. We were able to isolate AHE cells from the liver of a mouse and use them for transplantation. First, we destroyed blood stem cells of recipient mice using radiation. Then we transplanted AHE cells and observed the regeneration of the blood system. This procedure rescued recipients from sure death due to bone marrow failure caused by the radiation.

Recently, we demonstrated that human AHE cells isolated from human umbilical cords could be used for transplantation. When these cells are transplanted into immune-compromised mice with stem cells partially destroyed by chemotherapy, they regenerate the mouses’ blood systems, generating mice with a hybrid mouse-human blood system.

Third Party Validation

The technology being developed by HemoGenyx has been reviewed and enthusiastically received by an independent advisory committee comprised of recognized scientific and thought leaders drawn from the biopharmaceutical industry, the venture capital community and the Weill Cornell Medical College faculty.In 2014,Dr. Sandler received the Daedalus Award for Innovation, a grant awarded to him specifically to pursue the very AHE cell-related research and treatments that HemoGenyx is undertaking.

http://weill.cornell.edu/news/news/2014/10/daedalus-fund-selects-six-projects-for-funding-in-programs-first-round.html 

In addition, HemoGenyx was one of 11 winning finalists in the inaugural 43North business competition, the largest such competition in the world, which attracted almost 7,000 companies from 96 countries and all 50 states.  

http://www.43north.org/winners

HemoGenyx has an exclusive, worldwide, sub-licensable license to the inventions disclosed in the patent application, titled “Isolation of Post-natal Hemogenic Endothelium and Use Thereof,” made during the course of research at Cornell by Dr. Sandler. This patent covers the prospective isolation of Postnatal Hemogenic Endothelium (aka AHE cells) and methods for its use, including for hematopoietic transplantation.

http://google.com/patents/WO2015073680A1?cl=zh-CN

Dr. Sandler published numerous peer reviewed scientific papers.

https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=RLpF36EAAAAJ&view_op=list_works&sortby=pubdate

The Future

We are getting ready to apply our technology to patients in clinical trials. Recently the FDA granted us an Orphan Drug Designation for the use AHE cells in the treatment of Severe Aplastic Anemia (SAA), a disease that causes acute bone marrow failure. An Orphan Drug Designation means we can get through the regulatory process faster and bring our treatment to more patients sooner. We plan to treat people suffering from SAA who either do not have a good donor for transplantation or have already undergone a failed transplantation and have no options left for treatment. To satisfy FDA requirements and make sure that our approach will not harm patients, HemoGenyx will need to complete a number of pre-clinical studies and file an Investigational New Drug (IND) application. Then, in collaboration with physicians, we will recruit patients and perform transplantations to demonstrate that the procedure is safe and that transplanted AHE cells do regenerate the blood system in humans. Only then will HemoGenyx be able to use its technology widely to treat patients with SAA and, later, those who suffer from other blood diseases such as leukemia, lymphoma and multiple myeloma. These studies are costly. We ask for your help in covering the cost of the translating our AHE cell-based technology into clinical reality and saving patients’ lives.

How You Can Help

Please support the project. Even the smallest donation can save lives.
Share with your friends, family and colleagues, help us recruit more supporters. Fighting cancer is becoming a reality. We can save countless lives and change the future, together!

story:
Not long ago, I discovered yoga is a passion of mine. I spent time researching instructors and advanced yogis through the internet. I found a couple that blew me away and have been the source of most of my inspiration. Australia has been a dream of mine since I was a young child. Upon some research, I found that many of the yogis I love are based in Australia.

I am ready to deepen my practice and understanding of yoga. I am going to Australia to become certified by my dream instructors.

Upon completion, I will be able to inspire others and help them with their dreams and achievements as well.

I greatly appreciate all the past, present, and future help in pursuing my dreams.

Thank you!!!!! :)

Namaste

story:
We started our journey with hair care products, 4 years ago, in India.

We have successfully introduced Keratin products, followed by Sodium-Free shampoos & conditioners, and also a full line of Spa products. We now have distribution throughout India. 

We are looking forward to launch various hair care products right here in USA!  

We shall be bringing in many more quality products. Your support and feedback will be appreciated!  

Anything we can do to help ?
Please feel free to Contact Us.


Short Summary
  • We need to be funded as we have the demand for more products, and we have samples of what we are trying to produce quantities for, but the investment is as follows:
  • $40,000 - Developing, producing and packaging  4 more products 
  • $20,000 - Developing the distribution network
  • $40,000 - marketing, sales, and development for future products and expansion. 

    We need to get the truth and word out about using the Ying-Yang effect of moderation and the incorporation of balance in Hair, Skin and body.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • We offer our products to you in exchange for initial investment, anyone who becomes part of the initial investment, and likes the product has the opportunity to sell the products as we only want true believers of Sveda, actual users
  • If we don't reach our goal the funds will go to investing in more product in our current Organic Line.  

The Impact

  • The world is changing, who would ever think Mcdonalds & Coke would be down in sales?  I did, I knew people would eventually run out of energy and good fuel, products and suddenly want to change.  I want to be a part of the change, I believe in Sveda, American Science & Ayurveda, and most importantly the Ying -Yang effect of Moderation!  
  • I use Sveda, because I believe in it!  

Risks & Challenges

  • Because we currently sell majority of products in India, where we started this business, and because the products get stuck in customs, we are trying to sell in a big way here in USA, where it is made and packaged.  Marketing, and creating awareness is our current biggest challenge due to the fact we need to add staff, and only the owners are taking all of the risks and working on all aspects of the business.  
  • If we are funded, we will hire sales consultants, and procurement specialists to get ourselves running in the right direction!  

A few of our products.

ABOUT US:

  • NEIL DUMRA - OPERATIONS AND MARKETING

    I’m a firm believer in moderation, I am of course a student of life and believe that one never stops learning.  I have been introduced to the theory “you are what you eat, think and breathe” and truly believe in this natural path.  At Sveda, we are a family owned business; with beliefs to create, protect and sustain the future with products that are in tune with nature and our environment as well as provide options that are high performance products that you might not be able to reach with 100% organic.  As we move forward in reaching our mission, we will never stop listening to you as ultimately, everything we make and create will be for your benefit.  I have made significant growth in my personal life due to going in a very natural path and truly believes in Sveda!  The ying-yang effect of life, Moderation is the key and essence; cannot have good without a bit of bad.  I myself was unhealthy and losing my hair and I now have good hair & health; I am a product of change, and I would love the share with the world my knowledge and experiences!

  • EMILY ASPENSON - CHIEF PRODUCT DESIGNER

    I have always loved hair products and  In 2014 I came to the conclusion that both organic products and non-organic products are tools for two different looks.  As hard as I tried to reach a high-end professional look with only organic products it never lasted or had the same charisma and style that I was going for and on the flip side when I was using non-organic products on the regular; my hair became dry and dead looking.  I soon realized that moderation in ones life can bring health and happiness.  I am a supporter for both options and Sveda’s line is designed to bring you both.  I use Sveda’s HPL during the week and Sveda’s  OPL during the weekend to rejuvenate my hair.  Happy journey to whatever path you take.

             Other Ways You Can Help

Like Us Facebook,

Buy our product on Amazon, Etsy or directly from SvedaUSA.com  

After you try our product, Review it on Yelp, Facebook, or Google, And if you purchase from Amazon, review it their!  

We want our advertising to be as organic as our products!  Thank you for your time!

story:
Hello there. My name is Darla K. Skolnekovich. I would like to introduce you to my company, “SadieShelter HomeKits and Systems, Inc”. I created SadieShelter H&S, Inc, after returning to school to complete an engineering degree in 2010.

“The mission of SadieShelter HomeKits and Systems, Inc, is to provide superior sturdy temporary structures that will significantly improve conditions of security, shelter, sanitation and solace for victims of traumatic displacement, deployed soldiers and consumers.”

                             

Victims of traumatic displacement face treacherous dangers well beyond their initial catastrophic loss. The high occurrence of opportunistic, violent and often deadly assault against people who have been torn from their homes by a disaster, whether natural or decidedly unnatural, is disturbingly commonplace and perpetrated primarily against women and children. Victims of traumatic displacement have very little to no defense against the immediate menacing threats of assault, illness and even death due to exposure while housed in standard crisis tent shelters.
    

SadieShelter H&S, Inc, structures are harmless to the environment, extremely sturdy, water- and fireproof shelters with a double-wall and drop-in floor design and an effective reinforced locking door. The pouring of insulation material, such as sand, gravel, soil or even paper, into the double-wall design provides structural strength and the moderation of interior temperature while subjected to extreme outside conditions.

SadieShelter structures require no tools for assembly and can be disassembled and re-used as often as desired. SadieShelter standard HomeKit structures range in size from 4'-14' square and 10' to 12' tall. Our structures will comfortably accommodate 2-12 people and link together to create even larger internal living space.

SadieShelter H&S, Inc, also offers an optional drop-in wall “Ballistic Insert” that provides an additional 4” insulation space. As seen on our YouTube video: http://youtu.be/6t3kC9vPySA, and project description, the additional protection of this “Ballistic Insert”, prevents the permeation of small gun-propelled projectiles.

SadieShelter H&S, Inc, hopes to partner with large domestic and global aid agencies to replace treated canvas tent shelters currently distributed to victims of traumatic displacement. SadieShelter structures can be linked together to create a larger secure internal space and can be made permanent with the application of a stucco-like material.

The financial support acquired by this campaign will allow us to construct 180 full-size HomeKits (8 X 8 X 10) to be distributed to agents within the Red Cross and UNHCR. Our design is solid and ready for recipient scrutiny that will inform our evolution and expansion of design and scope. Our primary goal is to replace inferior chemically treated canvas and poly-composite tent shelters included in crisis survival distributions and packages.

Our structures will save lives. SadieShelter H&S, Inc, will save the vulnerable from rape and ruinous assault, as well as exposure and illness, so they might recover and regain possession of their potential. 

This issue is not a world away. According to the study by the Internal Displacement Monitoring Centre and the Norwegian Refugee Council, “Natural disasters forced 32.4 million people to flee last year (2013), with the overwhelming majority (98 percent) due to climate- and weather-related events. While most of the victims live in developing nations, 2012 also saw an increase in environmental refugees in wealthy countries, particularly in the United States. The U.S. experienced one of the worst instances of disaster-induced displacement in 2012 after Hurricane Sandy forced 776,000 people out of their homes.”

I named SadieShelter for my magnificent daughter, Sadie. I see her in the eyes of every victim left to endure the very real perils of traumatic displacement. We have a chance to help keep her safer if you help us get out there. Love Out. Love In.

PLEASE check out our article in the Colorado Springs Gazette, published on Saturday, the 29th of November. Link: http://gazette.com/colorado-springs-moms-invent...

I named SadieShelter for my magnificent daughter, Sadie. I see her in the eyes of every victim left to endure the very real perils of traumatic displacement. We have a chance to help keep her safer if you help us get out there. Love Out. Love In.
PLEASE check out our article in the Colorado Springs Gazette, published on Saturday, the 29th of November. Link: http://gazette.com/colorado-springs-moms-invent...

story:
Carissa's Story

On April 23, 2013 Carissa Tillman was diagnosed with Fibrolamellar Hepatocellular Carcinoma, or FHCC for short. After doing some research, we learned that FHCC is a rare liver cancer that was not even researched until the 1980's and was not named until 2010. There are only about 200 confirmed cases world wide, per year and the average age is 23 years old. As there is little research for this type of cancer, treatments are limited to clinical trials.

Other Ways You Can Help


We understand that not everyone can contribute, but you can still help! You can share this information, and Carissa's story in any way you know how! We only have 60 days to raise the money so get the word out! Thank you!
