story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Brian McGowan.  My wife, Deirdre, has been battling chronic illness for 28 years.  After trying every type of medicine, both traditional and alternative, and exhausting all of our financial resources, including all our savings and all our retirement funds, we are faced with one last chance to save Deirdre.  Deirdre needs a miracle and that is what we are asking for.

Deirdre is like the Boy-in-the-Bubble, where everyday toxins are potentially lethal to here. After trying every possible healing avenue we could find to get Deirdre well, we finally tried what people had told us for years was what we needed to do. Move to a remote island.

Unfortunately, Deirdre's health has continued to decline as a result of the toxins that exist even here.  Deirdre is now too sick to travel back to the mainland but continues to get only sicker here on the island. The only solution is to build her a "bubble", a small, safe (i.e., non-toxic) structure in which she can live, which we have begun.  It is her only chance for survival and it is the only thread of hope that keeps her from giving up after such a wearying fight to get well. But now, without your help, we are in jeopardy of losing it.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $11,111 because that amount will help us to stabilize Deirdre's condition and assess the best next steps to get her on the road to recovery. While our needs will exceed that amount, we felt the series of 'ones' represents a new start for Deirdre, which is what we are trying to achieve with this project.

28 years ago, Deirdre contracted Lyme disease. At the time not many knew much about it so it went undiagnosed and misdiagnosed for about 10 years.  By that time she was very sick and she was treated with massive doses of oral and intravenous antibiotics, which blew out her immune system as well as the good bacteria in her digestive system.  This was complicated by the fact that Deirdre has a very rare liver condition in which the two primary detoxification pathways and three of the five secondary pathways out of her liver don't work. So her body has an extremely limited capacity to eliminate toxins.

As a result, Deirdre needs to live as far away from other people as possible, which can be difficult to achieve on an island.  After a year of searching, we found a small house for rent on a piece of property that would potentially provide Deirdre some safety.  She could not tolerate living in this or any other house we have rented, however, so while we have a place to store our belongings and I can cook meals, Deirdre has had to live outside on a beach.  While this might sound like a romantic notion, this island, Kauai, can be known for rain, high winds, and cold temperatures at night, especially during the winter months.  It would be tough for a strong and well person to do for two years, but for a sick person it is unimaginable.

We have begun to build a "bubble" for Deirdre, which is to be composed of untreated lumber, glass, tile and a metal roof, which are the least reactive materials with which we can build.  When I lost my job, we ran out of money to continue building the "bubble" and got behind on the rent.  We are now at a place in which our landlord, who has been very patient and understanding, must now collect the three months of back rent (plus October's rent which is due very soon) or we must leave. In lieu of the unpaid rent, he will take the structure and any remaining building materials. 

This structure is my wife's and my only hope for her survival. We are asking for your contributions so that we can catch up on our back rent and remain on the premises, to purchase the materials and the labor to finish building the structure and move Deirdre indoors for the first time in two years, and to purchase equipment which will help to detox Deirdre's body, such as a FAR infrared sauna and a soaking tub, as well as a number of other things, and to ship a special magnet bed which is being stored for us back on the mainland.

 

WHAT WE CAN OFFER in appreciation of your contributions:

$ - Any amount: The chance to actually help save someone's life, someone who has fought unerringly for her own life for many, many years but now must rely on the help of others.  And, of course, our heartfelt and eternal gratitude.

$30 - A picture of Deirdre in our current situation to see how we manage to survive day by day.

$100 - A detailed written description of what it is like to live a day under our current circumstances, a situation we never could possibly have imagined.

$150 - A detailed written description of what it is like to live a day under our current circumstances, a situation we never could possibly have imagined, including my/our personal reflections and editorializing.

 

THE IMPACT

Multiple chemical sensitivity, of which Deirdre has an extreme case, is affecting more and more people as our environments become more toxic.  Nobody really notices if the result is seemingly only an ache or pain here and there, but it is important to bring awareness to the potential severity of impact on one's health before it is too late.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We will be incredibly grateful for any financial help we might receive, but we will also be incredibly grateful for your prayers for us, your good intentions for us in finding the help we need, any form of remote detoxification work (especially on Deirdre's liver and intestines) and any positive thoughts you might be able to hold for us, as there are times when it can be exceedingly difficult to hold them for ourselves.

story:
Podpořte naše freedivery na cestě za některým z cenných kovů na  mistrovství světa týmů “AIDA Team Freediving World Championship 2012“, které se koná ve Francii na Azurovém pobřeží v Nice od 8. do 15. září 2012.

Český freediving patří ke světové špičce, přesto se každoročně potýká s problémy financování tréninku a účasti reprezentace na Mistrovství světa. Všichni závodníci si hradí náklady spojené s reprezentací České republiky na domácích a zahraničních závodech v potápění na nádech většinou sami.

Na posledních dvou Mistrovství světa freedivingu v týmech, mužský tým získal stříbrnou medaili, ženy byly dvakrát na čtvrtém místě. Letos se muži určitě pokusí minimálně obhájit stříbrnou medaili a ženy budou také bojovat o medailové umístění.

AIDA Czech Republic byla založena v roce 2002. Ale již předtím se ve světě český freediving proslavil díky Martinu Štěpánkovi. Ten v roce 2001 vytvořil svůj první světový rekord v disciplíně statická apnoe. Jeho rekord měl hodnotu 8 minut a 6 sekund a dodnes je národním rekordem. Martin Štěpánek patří k novodobým legendám freedivingu a vytvořil několik světových rekordů a to ve všech hloubkových disciplínách.

Česká republika získala prozatím na mistrovství světa ať v soutěži jednotlivců, nebo týmu dohromady jedenáct medailí. Tři zlaté, sedm stříbrných, a jednu bronzovou medaili. Zlaté medaile vybojovali Jarmila Slovenčíková v disciplíně konstantní váha bez ploutví v roce 2007 a Alena Zabloudilová v té samé disciplíně v roce 2011. Dále je držitelkou zlaté medaile Barbora Ivanská v dynamické apnoi s ploutvemi z roku 2011.

Dvě stříbrné medaile získal mužský národní tým na mistrovství světa týmů v roce 2006 a 2008.  Další stříbro získala v disciplíně dynamická apnoe bez ploutví a free immersion Alena Zabloudilová v roce 2007 a 2011, také Martin Petrisko v dynamické apnoi bez ploutví v roce 2009. Další dvě stříbrné medaile z roku 2011 má Michal Rišian v konstantní váze bez ploutví a Jarmila Slovenčíková v konstantní váze s ploutvemi.

Držitelkou bronzové medaile je Jarmila Slovenčíková z roku 2009 za výkon v disciplíně konstantní váha s ploutvemi.

 

Týmy pro mistroství světa týmů 2012 tvoří:

Muži: Michal Rišian, Martin Valenta, Miroslav Ševčík a Pavel Soukup

Ženy: Alena Zabloudilová, Barbora Ivanská a Zdeňka Demlová

Navštivte také naše webové stránky.

Pokud nemáte platební kartu umožňujicí platbu po internetu můžete zasílat peněžité dary na účet AIDA Czech Republic o.s.
219156931 / 0300 
Jméno, příjmení a účel daru do poznámky.

Výtěžek sbírky půjde na proplacení nákladů spojených s účastí na MS 2012 všech závodníků a realizačního týmu.

story:
Kiera's Smile

Since we welcomed our daughter Kiera in 2010, the one thing she has always done is bring a smile to our faces, because of her smile, no matter the circumstances. She spent the first 3 months of life in hospital with seizures, and has since kept going in and out, so much so that the ambulance and Accident & Emergency staff at the local hospital know her on sight! Our visits there range from a few nights to a few months, and everything in between!

Kiera has had many life-threatening episodes, where she would turn blue and stiff, and not respond to emergency medications. She has had so many close shaves, and we were told by a doctor that we would be lucky if she made it to 5 years old.

Kiera has still not been diagnosed and this is the issue for all of us, as we do not know what her future holds; all her consultants can only guess what medication to give her and she has been on and off countless medications. Even with all the tests that have been done, there is no specific diagnosis. She has a range of symptoms such as epilepsy, apnoea, muscular denervation, dysphagia, severe reflux and digestive issues (she can only eat purees and thickened fluid) and hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy, which is basically oxygen deprivation leading to brain damage, as we understand. There is no specific disease or umbrella diagnosis, and therefore we have no prognosis.

Why we need your help

We think it is time to take Kiera to a specialist rehab centre to focus on her muscles and physio development as we have seen from the ABR results and have been told by the practitioners that once the biomechanical rehab starts having an impact,  children can even start walking, eating, holding themselves up and so forth.

Currently she can not walk, talk, sign, roll, crawl, use the potty, feed herself or anything else your average child of 4 can do, let alone one much younger.

We are currently on the waiting list for a gastrostomy, which is a hole into the stomach that she will be fed through. We are confident that this operation could be avoided or at least reversed if she gets the ABR, although ideally we do not want her to be operated on!

Additionally, if she could at least walk , talk or sign and control her limbs, she would be able to express herself and be more independent.

Anything to help her achieve a better quality of life and even a chance at more mobility would add such joy to her life, never mind ours! She loves watching dancing, being in swings, anything with movement- unfortunately she is just getting too big for us to do it ourselves.

The initial treatment cost is just under GBP 1500.

Travel costs to the  specialist centre in Belgium ( including hotel, fuel, subsistence) costs about GBP600.

The  total  of the trip therefore comes up to approx GBP2,100.

The trip has to be made 4times per year in the first year, bringing the total to approx GBP 8,400.  

The training is given at the centre but parents/carers will be the ones putting in the hours on the child, and we have been told a minimum 300 hours to start seeing real changes.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute financially, please share this page and let people know about this campaign to see Kiki Get Rehab!

Also please use  the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for reading!

story:
What the heck is c60?

C60 (the ‘buckminsterfullerene’) is an all carbon compound that, when taken together with olive oils, has been reported to greatly increase the lifespan of laboratory rats. Some people are already taking this compound (see the C60 health forum) because of its purported antioxidant properties, but its effects on cancer are largely unknown.

What effects will c60 have on cancer?

Human cancers and mouse cancers can behave differently, so there are many contradictions in the scientific literature that we need to sort out:

  • In previous studies experimental animals treated with c60 had no tumors at necropsy versus control animals that did.
But...
  • In human clinical trials, similar antioxidants have led to higher cancer incidence, rather than lower.
So...
  • We need to determine what effect c60 will have on human cancer using a xenograft model (immunocompromised mouse strain that is administered human cancer cells, and grows them).
  • Specifically, this campaign will support a study to look at the effects of c60 on proliferation of the human leukemia line KG1a.
  • If this campaign is over funded, this study will be expanded to examine the effects of c60 on metastasis and primary tumor growth in solid tumors.

We need to raise $18,500 to answer this question, and we are already 2/3 of the way there!!

Longecity.org and a private donor have teamed up to match every dollar donated in this campaign (up to $6,000) with $2. That means we only need to raise $6,500!!

  • 100% of donations are applied to direct research expenses,  up to $6,000
  • Every $1 donated is matched by $2, up to $6,000
  • Get great perks such as t-shirts, naming a mouse, or receiving a signed book
  • Your donation is tax-deductible

Who will do the research?

All research for this project will be conducted under the direction of Kelsey Moody, Mr. Moody is a biotechnology entrepreneur in Syracuse, NY. As a medical student at SUNY Upstate Medical University, he founded Ichor Therapeutics, where he currently serves as CEO. In 2014 he transferred to the University of Miami Miller School of Medicine to begin a Ph.D. in Industrial Biochemistry and Molecular Biology. Previously, Mr. Moody served as CTO at ImmunePath, a venture capitalist backed stem cell therapy company in Silicon Valley. Before ImmunePath, he founded the SENS Foundation Academic Initiative, a student development program. Mr. Moody received a BS from SUNY Plattsburgh and an MBA from Concordia University.

You can read more about his professional background here.

The company is fully equipped with quality scientific infrastructure, including:

  • Mammalian cell culture laboratory
  • Performance analytical machines (automated hematology analyzer, flow cytometer, and more!!)
  • SCID vivarium (a climate controlled clean room and "mouse house")
Click here to learn about the Ichor advisory team.


Other ways to help

While money helps, it isn't the only way to contribute:

  • Get the word out and share this campaign with your friends using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Want to do research? Apply now for an internship or volunteer experience at the company.

From the entire Ichor Team, thank you for your support!!


This project has received a 3-star rating from LongeCity.org, an international, not-for-profit, membership-based organization ("501-3-c status" in the United States) focusing on advocacy and research for unlimited lifespans.
A 3-star rating means the organization has arranged for peer-review of the project proposal and not only deemed it viable from a scientific, technical and managerial perspective, but of such potential importance to its mission that it has decided to match donations received. LongeCity will review periodic reports from the Ichor Team and in order to monitor the scientific integrity of the study and that funds are spend appropriately. LongeCity will also facilitate an on-going public conversation between the community and the researchers.  DETAILS HERE

In human clinical trials, similar antioxidants have led to higher cancer incidence, rather than lower.
So...

We need to determine what effect c60 will have on human cancer using a xenograft model (immunocompromised mouse strain that is administered human cancer cells, and grows them).
Specifically, this campaign will support a study to look at the effects of c60 on proliferation of the human leukemia line KG1a.
If this campaign is over funded, this study will be expanded to examine the effects of c60 on metastasis and primary tumor growth in solid tumors.




  We need to raise $18,500 to answer this question, and we are already 2/3 of the way there!! Longecity.org and a private donor have teamed up to match every dollar donated in this campaign (up to $6,000) with $2. That means we only need to raise $6,500!! 

100% of donations are applied to direct research expenses,  up to $6,000
Every $1 donated is matched by $2, up to $6,000 Get great perks such as t-shirts, naming a mouse, or receiving a signed book
Your donation is tax-deductible
 




Who will do the research?


All research for this project will be conducted under the direction of Kelsey Moody, Mr. Moody is a biotechnology entrepreneur in Syracuse, NY. As a medical student at SUNY Upstate Medical University, he founded Ichor Therapeutics, where he currently serves as CEO. In 2014 he transferred to the University of Miami Miller School of Medicine to begin a Ph.D. in Industrial Biochemistry and Molecular Biology. Previously, Mr. Moody served as CTO at ImmunePath, a venture capitalist backed stem cell therapy company in Silicon Valley. Before ImmunePath, he founded the SENS Foundation Academic Initiative, a student development program. Mr. Moody received a BS from SUNY Plattsburgh and an MBA from Concordia University.
You can read more about his professional background here.
The company is fully equipped with quality scientific infrastructure, including:


Mammalian cell culture laboratory
Performance analytical machines (automated hematology analyzer, flow cytometer, and more!!)
SCID vivarium (a climate controlled clean room and "mouse house")


Click here to learn about the Ichor advisory team.






Other ways to help While money helps, it isn't the only way to contribute: 
Get the word out and share this campaign with your friends using the Indiegogo share tools. Want to do research? Apply now for an internship or volunteer experience at the company. 

 From the entire Ichor Team, thank you for your support!!



This project has received a 3-star rating from LongeCity.org, an international, not-for-profit, membership-based organization ("501-3-c status" in the United States) focusing on advocacy and research for unlimited lifespans.



 A 3-star rating means the organization has arranged for peer-review of the project proposal and not only deemed it viable from a scientific, technical and managerial perspective, but of such potential importance to its mission that it has decided to match donations received. LongeCity will review periodic reports from the Ichor Team and in order to monitor the scientific integrity of the study and that funds are spend appropriately. LongeCity will also facilitate an on-going public conversation between the community and the researchers.  DETAILS HERE

story:
UPDATE!

A tremendous thank you to Jacuzzi Ontario for generously donating a hot tub to help Zoe with her therapy regime and pain relief!  www.jacuzziontario.com Local trades people and businesses have also joined in to help and the accessible bathroom renovation is underway!  As soon as I have the complete list I will post another update to say thank you to them as well.  The biggest obstacle now is the accessible van needed to safely transport Zoe to and from her numerous appointments each week.  Please consider donating to help out this lovely young girl increase her independence and safety.  Each time she has to be lifted in or out of the vehicle risks possible serious injury. Thank you to Zoe's school for holding a fundraiser to help out as well.  

ZOE AS AN EASTER SEALS AMBASSADOR FOR THE 2014 TELETHON

       


ACCESSIBLE VAN QUOTE



  

Hi there. I'm Shellie and I've set up this fundraiser to help out Zoe, an 11-year-old girl who suffers from both Ehlers Danlos Sundrome (EDS) and Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS), two rare and painful incurable disorders. EDS targets the connective tissues in the body, leading to issues such as joint dislocations, hypermobility, and chronic pain, while CRPS is a malfunction of the nervous system generally brought on by injury, minor or major, although it may have no precipitating event.

Since she was born, Zoe has suffered serious injury through such simple and normal activities as rolling over or crawling. While other children were running and playing, Zoe was stuck in the hospital because running broke her ankle or playing dislocated her shoulder. She had broken, sprained, or dislocated so many body parts that by the time she was nine, her family and doctors knew there was something seriously wrong, especially after her kidneys swelled up.  She was sent to a geneticist in Kingston, who finally discovered the genetic condition that was the underlying cause making her so susceptible to these injuries.  

 Despite the fact that she gets injured so easily, Zoe would still try to play soccer, dance, and do all the physical activities she loved, but now that she is confined to a wheelchair and unable to bend one leg, no matter how much she might love those physical activities, she is unable to do any of them. Just two weeks ago, she dislocated her shoulder and thumb when she was doing essentially nothing. 

Zoe's prognosis is not clear, since EDS can also affect her internal organs and nervous system. Reading about Zoe and her disorders in our local paper, my heart broke seeing all the things she needs to have a more accessible and independent life. She needs renovations to her family's bathroom so that she can fit in there with her wheelchair, in addition to a specialized stair lift since her leg does not bend. Her family also needs an accessible vehicle to take her to school and her many doctor's appointments as well as a special track system to get her in and out of the bathroom, up and down the stairs, and in and out of their van.  

Zoe also participates in regular physiotherapy  as well as hydro therapy and swim therapy, so we are trying to get Zoe a hot tub and a special type of lift that is required to get her safely in and out of the hot tub. Zoe really needs these interventions, but because her mother had to quit working in order to focus on Zoe and her many medical appointments, her family is just not in a position to provide them without help.  

I'd like to try and ease the financial burden on Zoe and her family by raising money to allow them to focus on Zoe's health and happiness, rather than the money they need for her treatments. I know that if Zoe was my child, I wouldn't be able to do get the necessary equipment without some outside help.   

I hope you'll donate to Zoe and spread the word so we can give her all the things she needs to be as mobile and independent as her condition will allow. We're from a small town in Eastern Ontario, so getting all the help Zoe needs closer to home is hard. Thanks so much for reading and sharing!

story:
Short Summary

I grew up in Dallas, Texas and at a young age suffered from rheumatoid arthritis, a heart attack and excessive weight gain. The physical challenges I faced as a child affected my mental and emotional health as a young adult. At the age of 19 I discovered Bikram Yoga and within a year my life was transformed on all levels. By practicing yoga daily, I achieved vibrant health shedding pounds and medication. I first competed in Texas in 2005 then after years of dedication won 1st place in the 2009 National Yoga Asana Championship and placed 2nd internationally. Three years later, in 2011, I won the championships and am now a International Yoga Asana Champion. This past year I've returned to the competition after a 3 year break from the 2011 championship and have ranked high enough to represent the USA & NYC at the 2014 International Yoga Sports Federation Championship (IYSF). 

Yoga has given me the gift of life. I currently teach & live yoga full time in NYC and am involved in many community projects such the Yoga Youth Movement, New York Yoga Sports Club, & the USA Yoga Federation.

Your contribution towards funding my trip to compete in 2014 IYSF World Championships of Yoga Sports, May 31- June 2, will aid me on my mission in life to share the gift of yoga and inspiring others to be the best they can be.

For information on the championship please visit:

International Yoga Sports Federation - Unity through Sport

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will aid me in funding my roundtrip flight to London, weekend accommodations, food & yoga!

         

PERKS

Contributions starting at $25 gives you "Yoga Love" 

  • A social media "shout out"
  • A personalized thank you video on social media

Contributions starting at $50 gives you "Yoga Lessons" 

  • 1 Week unlimited classes with me at Bikram Yoga Grand Central NYC
  • A social media "shout out"
  • A personalized thank you video on social media

Contributions starting at $75 gives you "Yoga Class" 

  • Hydro Flask Insulated Water Bottle - 21 oz

  • 1 Week unlimited classes with me at Bikram Yoga Grand Central NYC
  • A social media "shout out"
  • A personalized thank you video on social media

Contributions starting at $125 gives you "Yoga Inspiration" 

  • Autographed 'Progression of a Champion' poster
  • A social media "shout out"
  • A personalized thank you video on social media

Contributions starting at $350 gives you "Yoga Blessing" 

  • Autographed Posture poster
  • Autographed 'Progression of a Champion' poster
  • A social media "shout out"
  • A personalized thank you video on social media

Contributions starting at $500 gives you "Yoga Power " 

  • A 3 hr or (2)1.5 hr Bikram Beginning Yoga private instruction class. In this session we will discuss techniques, tips and questions for your practice. 
  • Autographed Posture poster
  • Autographed 'Progression of a Champion' poster
  • A social media "shout out"
  • A personalized thank you video on social media

The Impact

I hope for asana to become an Olympic sport! I believe it's the right time. I hope that when it does, people will see that such a movement is not to change the nature of asana as it is in the yoga discipline. It is to change the entire nature of sports. One day, kids will look up to yogis as their athletic role models! They will understand that the sport of asana is promoting health and wellbeing, and not violence and aggression. When this happens, I'll know that yoga has changed the world!

Competition drives us to be the best we can be, but to be a champion requires the submission to results and outcome.

Other Ways You Can Help

Go out and share the Love & Knowledge for yoga sport!

Please check out and visit the following non-profit organizations building the movement for yoga sport!

USA YOGA FEDERATION

International Yoga Sports Federation - Unity through Sport

story:
Rucking Los Angeles since 2001


The LA Rebellion Rugby Football Club is the only rugby team in Los Angeles actively recruiting players regardless of age, race, fitness level or sexual orientation. Like all people in the City of Angels, we come from many different walks of life. But there is one thing that brings us together... Our love for the game of rugby.


This year the LA Rebellion gets the opportunity to compete in one of the largest international nonprofessional rugby tournaments in the world, Bingham Cup. The Sydney Convicts are hosting over 30 IGRAB rugby teams, all looking to take home glory.  

Indiegogo Campaign

The LA Rebellion is a registered 501 (c)(3). Your donation maybe deductible, as allowed by current tax laws:

  • We are looking to raise at least $2500 to provide rooming for our team while in Sydney competing for the Bingham Cup
  • Our perks offer individual donations and a sponsorship opportunities for businesses.
  • Going above and beyond our goal of $2500, the funding will go to providing players travel assistance.

Going above and beyond our goal of $2500, the funding will go to providing players travel assistance.

story:
Short Summary

We are building an app to get help for people when they can’t get it themselves.  There are lots of apps that are “panic buttons” – press the button when you need help.  This doesn’t help if you can’t reach your phone or are incapacitated (accident, fallen and you can’t get up, seizures, kidnapped, being robbed or worse). 

One of our mothers fell in her house, smashed her nose and spent two hours in her own blood until her son fortuitously showed up.  She was wearing 2 panic buttons – never pressed.  This is the sort of thing we want to improve. 

And we decided we might as well be the people to do it. The app is great for women on their own, workers on their own, people who should ideally be checked on regularly, and the elderly.  It feels like every time we tell someone about the app, they tell us a story of when it would have been useful:

  • while driving by themselves and ending up in a car accident where they couldn’t get to the phone
  • suffering from an epileptic seizure when no one around was awake
  • walking late at night, in an unknown neighborhood
  • travelling

We have spent what feels like forever putting this together in our spare time, and reducing our work time to focus on this as much as we can.  We have the first versions done for Android and for Blackberry and have applied for the first patents.  iPhone is started but keeps getting interrupted. You can see our progress so far on the website.  www.MindrMobile.com.  Now we are facing the toughest job – getting the word out.  We have largely spent our resources, but need more for the hardest parts –finishing the last platforms and marketing.

We have great plans for making this product better, including putting together a monitoring centre, and having a server so if someone smashes your phone, the app can still call for help from the server.

We know too many stories of harm, and even more often, worry. Our efforts can reduce these. 

A Quick Demo


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don’t feel like putting money down, you could still help us.  Tell people you know who may benefit from our apps or may want to help.  Or just try the app and give us feedback.  Real users who give thoughtful feedback are gold too.  Search for Mindr Mobile on an app store or visit us as www.MindrMobile.com. 

You can even forward or share our videos

The Commercial Video

story:
Hello, 

My name is Georgia.  I have Marfan Syndrome which causes all kinds of problems with one's body, including the heart, and the aorta, which is the largest blood vessel in our bodies.  When something goes wrong with the aorta, it can kill you.  A little over 2 years ago, I had to have part of my aorta repaired.  Now it is time to have the rest of the aorta repaired.  The drs. at Stanford Hospital couldn't fix the problem  all at once.  It was too dangerous.  My sister was here for me during my last stay in the hospital.  I need to have her with me again this time.  She is my advocate and my moral support person.  I am on some high powered medications after the surgery, so I am out of it for awhile.  She takes care of everything for me while I mostly sleep for days.  Surgery on the aorta is very traumatic to one's body, so it requires a long stay in the hospital, and a long recovery time afterwards.  It is very scary, and no one should have to go through it alone.  Here is an informative link about Stanford and Marfan Syndrome.  http://stanfordhospital.org/clinicsmedServices/COE/heart/DiseasesConditions/marfan/?gclid=CIKI1p69wLUCFQhxQgodpC4AlQ

I need to raise the money my sister will need to stay close to me while she is in California.  There is a place for people who have family members in the hospital at Stanford to stay in.  It is only a couple of blocks away from the hospital, so my sister can walk there, or get a ride in the dark.  It will cost $175 for the deposit.  You can only stay there if your family member will be in the hospital for at least a week.  Then it costs $25 a day.  If you clean the room up properly before you check out, you get the deposit back at some point.  We will donate this to the social workers at Stanford who can help another family have a safe place to stay  If people can't afford to stay anywhere close to the hospital, they have to camp out in the hospital chairs at night.    My sister also needs money for food each day, and other incidentals that we don't often think of.

My sister's airplane fare has already been donated.  So far 6 people have donated, and I am sending the link to my campaign to everyone I can think of and telling them to keep the link going. My sister is a good person who will worry herself silly if she can't be with me, and I will be so lonely and scared without her by my side.  I have lost my mom, my dad, my husband, and another sister, so my one living sister,  has always been the one to take care of me.

Your contribution to my campaign will be helping one sister get another sister through a  most terrifying, and dangerous surgery.  You may have a relative of your own that you would do anything for.  Think of my sister as that relative, and help her come to Stanford.

After my operation, and I am on my road to recovery, and am able to think coherently, I plan to Pay It Forward, and make a donation to other causes, that, like me, just need a little help to make things work out.  I thank you for your contribution to my cause, "To Get Paula To Stanford".  

If you are not able to donate, please pray for me, my doctors, nurses, and all the staff who will be involved in my surgery. My surgery is in early March if the date doesn't get changed.  I need prayers and all the power of positive thinking to get me through this.  So pray, pray, and pray some more.  God Bless you all, Georgia

story:
Summary

Hello! We are Kansas Quidditch and at the Midwest Regionals, we qualified to move on to the next stage of competition, the World Cup! The World Cup is the premier tournament for quidditch and the end goal for all teams! Getting to that level however has been extremely taxing on our resources, we played in 5 tournaments around the Midwest and have the bruises and injuries to prove it, all the practice and preparation in tournaments leading up to our regionals placed a great deal of stress on our treasury. We have one final push to fundraise in getting to the World Cup VI and any help would be greatly appreciated! We hope to get to the World Cup and continue the winning tradition of Kansas and make an impact on the game of quidditch at a national level.

Goal

We set a goal of $2000 which would supplement the travel to and from Florida and would simplify all travel and monetary constraints of the club. Any remaining funds would be placed in our account with the University of Kansas and kept safe for future club needs in the following year.

The Impact

The impact of your donation would be enormous. Any donation is appreciated and will help the club tremendously. All donations can be guaranteed to go directly to the club and into our club's account at the bursar's office at KU.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this campaign with friends, family, or anyone helps greatly! Getting our campaign out there is the first step to helping us realize our goal!
story_txt:
Summary
Hello! We are Kansas Quidditch and at the Midwest Regionals, we qualified to move on to the next stage of competition, the World Cup! The World Cup is the premier tournament for quidditch and the end goal for all teams! Getting to that level however has been extremely taxing on our resources, we played in 5 tournaments around the Midwest and have the bruises and injuries to prove it, all the practice and preparation in tournaments leading up to our regionals placed a great deal of stress on our treasury. We have one final push to fundraise in getting to the World Cup VI and any help would be greatly appreciated! We hope to get to the World Cup and continue the winning tradition of Kansas and make an impact on the game of quidditch at a national level.


Goal
We set a goal of $2000 which would supplement the travel to and from Florida and would simplify all travel and monetary constraints of the club. Any remaining funds would be placed in our account with the University of Kansas and kept safe for future club needs in the following year.


The Impact
The impact of your donation would be enormous. Any donation is appreciated and will help the club tremendously. All donations can be guaranteed to go directly to the club and into our club's account at the bursar's office at KU.


Other Ways You Can Help
Sharing this campaign with friends, family, or anyone helps greatly! Getting our campaign out there is the first step to helping us realize our goal!

story:
Run2Day Ladies Damloop 2013

I am working on my PhD in the field of Neurodegeneration, especially Alzheimer's disease (AD). I am looking into new biomarkers to improve diagnosis of the disease and into molecular pathways. Please sponsor my run to support AD research.

If you know me even a little bit, you know that I am not very athletic. However, this is an important cause and I will participate in the Run2Day Ladies Damloop 2013 to show everyone that I am taking this very seriously. I will run 4 miles (6.4 km).

Alzheimer Nederland (http://www.alzheimer-nederland.nl/) is an organisation that funds research projects like my own. They also give away travel grants like the one I received last year for the AAIC conference in Vancouver. This is my way of "giving back".
Results yielding from that kind of research will not only benefit people in the Netherlands, but worldwide.

Please support my cause by donating whatever you can spare. Every Euro is appreciated.

With your donation you will also motivate me to complete the "From couch to 5k in 9 weeks" running programm. Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
Hi I'm Darryl, the creator of EVA.

I'm also an active duty US Navy Lieutenant with 15 years of service who, after a deployment to Baghdad, Iraq, decided to tackle the problem of suicide in the US Military. 

Knowing the culture of the military, I knew that technology could help solve this dreadful mental health problem.  After 18 months of research and development, we now have a working prototype of a mental healthcare Smartphone app called EVA. 

I've done and sacrificed a lot to get to this point, but with your help I know we can get this all-too-important tool out to our troops.  Please share this page with people you know to help spread the word about this important cause.

Thank you so much for your support.
- LT Darryl "D" Diptee

Email me at:
contact@DarrylDiptee.com


Recent FOX Business News Interview regarding EVA
Click Here to see video!


THE PROBLEM
In 2012, the U.S. military recorded its highest suicide rate on record. On average, one active duty military member committed suicide each day, and approximately every hour, a veteran took his or her life.

Though extremely important, traditional face-to-face psychological therapy falls short as it typically forces patients to recall days or weeks of undocumented, fragmented experiences in an hour or two for a counselor to analyze on the spot. Such expectations are unrealistic because important information is often forgotten by the patient and the counselor rarely has sufficient time to properly evaluate, query and advise on what’s being shared.

 

THE SOLUTION
The EVA Smartphone app solves this dilemma by providing a safe, confidential virtual space where patients can maintain a continued connection with their counselors in between face-to-face sessions. Patients share their thoughts, experiences and emotions via EVA as they occur in the form of text, picture, video, and audio journaling. 

Counselors can then use this information to gain a more comprehensive understanding of their patients. Subsequently, they are better prepared to ask questions, coordinate follow-up treatments and facilitate proper care-transition. 

EVA has two main functions: 
1) it supports mental health by promoting emotional expression in a safe, non-threatening environment. 
2) it provides continuity of care for those who are at risk for suicide. 

In addition to extending the therapy room to virtual space, other features of EVA include: 
• Safety planning for bouts of suicidal ideation 
• Live chatting with suicide prevention specialists 
• GPS locator for SAMHSA treatment facilities 
• Instant connectivity to the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline via 1-800-273-TALK (8255) 

EVA allows healthcare facilities and counselors to maintain connection with their mental health patients. The App also encourages the continual expression of feelings and emotions in a safe, non-threatening, and confidential environment which promotes personal well-being and mental health.

 

How will your money be used?
We've come a long way since the idea was first drawn out on a cafe napkin.  That being said, there remains much more to be done.  Your funding support will help us do the following to make EVA a reality:

  • Add an extra layer of encryption to the server to become complaint with HIPAA regulations and protocol.
  • Upgrade EVA's IT and network infrastructure.
  • Encrypt the network connection on Android and Apple platforms.
  • Perform cosmetic reconstruction of the application and website with professional art and design to increase the user experience.
  • Complete EVA's development with increased functionality to get it ready for use in the combat zone and deployed areas.
  • Design, build and perform a Randomized Control Trial of EVA for scientific validity.


 

Perks

($10) Your inspirational text message will be seen when users launch the EVA app! Also included will be your first name, city and state.

Your inspirational message will be included with the EVA code

($25) A picture of you holding an inspirational sign will be included in the EVA app! The picture will be seen by EVA users who press the "Code Red" button during dark moments of depression. Users will then be connected with the National Suicide Hotline.

Your inspirational picture message will be included as part of the EVA code

($75) Color poster print - Entitled "Youm Jadeed" (means "A New Day").  Photo was taken by LT Darryl Diptee in Baghdad, Iraq during a military deployment that inspired the EVA app. Saddam Hussein's Perfume Palace on Camp Slayer in the background.  

Poster print suitable for framing. Available in 11x14, 16x20 and 20x30 Printed on Fuji Crystal Archive professional-grade paper.  Resists wear and glare with a special matte finish.

 

Youm Jadeed Poster

($150) Signed photo journal - Created by LT Darryl Diptee during his tour of duty in Iraq, complete with journal entries of interaction with local Iraqis and notes to his daughter. Experiences gained during this deployment played a huge factor in military mental health research and EVA's design.

 

 Signed Photo Journal

 

Risks and Challenges
My development team is a highly talented and passionate group. We have dedicated hundreds of hours working on EVA's prototype and are certain of its success, but we still lack research validation. To overcome this problem we've aligned our team with PhDs and PhD students who are willing to perform mental health research using EVA as the primary tool.

HIPPA privacy concerns are always on the forefront of our minds, so we're sure to implement the latest encryption standards required by law to protect patient information.

Usability is also very important and even the best ideas can fail if they're poorly designed. To avoid potential pitfalls, we've also aligned our team with a university department versed in HCI (Human Computer Interaction).

story:
Our Story

This our fourth year of producing the Super Bowl Shuffle.  The idea was to create a fun, non-competitive get-together on Super Bowl Sunday.  The idea is a play on words: The Super Bowl Shuffle is the best football-based rap song ever.  (It is not a hard category to win).  Of course shuffle can mean to run slowly, and the final twist is the shuffling of cards.  You get a card every mile, and two more when you finish.  The best hand wins.

We've always done it for free, but ask for a suggested donation.  In the past we've sent shoes to Djibouti, and last year we gave money to Street Soccer USA.  This year, we are doing our first shuffle in San Francisco.

The Times and locations are as follows:
SF: Sports Basement Presidio, 610 Old Mason Streeet, SF, CA 94129---9AM
Menlo Park: Fleet Feet Sports, 859 Santa Cruz Ave, Menlo Park, CA 94025---10AM

Over the last few years, I've coached three seasons of half-marathon training for the Crohn's Colitis Foundation of America's Team Challenge (www.ccfa.org).  Our athletes run or walk a half-marathon to help find a cure for Chrohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.

This campaign is in recognition of all the fundraising my athletes have done over the years.  This is an event for the community.


The Impact:

For the full story, I'd recommend starting at www.ccfa.org.


Crohn's and ulcerative colitis affect over 1.4 million Americans and CCFA team challenge is the biggest catalyst for research funds for a cure.


What We Need & What You Get

Give what you are compelled to give.  That is all you should ever do.

I will say we have great perks, which are just slightly over market value.  
We have entries in Running of the Bulls.  Get Chased by an Olympic Runner.
WE have log books: So you can track your training.
We have a bottle of wine: So you can get drunk with a friend (or alone...which is sad)

If you were planning to run the race, or need a logbook or a drink...buy the perk and the money will go directly to CCFA.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't afford to give anything, never a worry.  I just want you come to one of the Shuffles and have a good time.

story:
Short Summary - #SavingRaven

Our friend, Danny Raven has always been one of the most positive and easy going people I know.  Growing up, no one had to worry about Danny.  We all knew that because he was smart, kind and hard-working that he would accomplish anything that he put his mind to.  After high school, life happened, as it tends to and we fell out of touch, but we'd run into each other from time-to-time, at the mall, at a friend's house, at a party.  We were always happy to see each other.

The last time I actually saw Danny, was at our friend Phillip's birthday party, where I first met his wife, Erika. It brought me joy to hear about the recent developments in Danny's life and his bright future in his career in the finance industry.  That was over 3 year ago.

So when I recently logged onto Facebook and saw that our mutual friend, Thomas, was throwing a garage sale to raise funds for Danny's cancer treatment, I was shocked and saddened to say the least.  It had seemed like only yesterday that Danny and I were talking and laughing 'til we cried at Phillip's house. 

I eventually got up the nerve to text Danny and ask him about it all.  He stressed to me that the last 9 months had been pretty overwhelming.  He was proud to report that Erika was at the top of her class in her neuroscience Ph.D program at Georgetown and was working hard to support him.  He said that he'd been back here in California recently to help with his recovery, but that it was difficult being away from her.  

Friends, family, neighbors and good samaritans, please help us put Danny and his family's minds at ease.  Danny's friends and family would love for him to be able to focus on his health 100% without having any financial clouds over his head.  If you know Danny, you know that he would never ask for this type of help, but you would also know that no one would appreciate your help more.  We are asking YOU, whoever you are out there, to find it in your hearth to make a donation, no matter how big or small.  And after you make YOUR donation, please forward this to 10 people in your network that you think could relate to Danny's situation.

People talk.  Word gets out.  Things add up.  

What We Need & What You Get

I honestly have no idea how expensive these sorts of operations and treatments cost, but I do know that $1000 is a start.  If we could raise that amount of money, it would at least be a good starting point to help a local family in need.  

We can't offer you any real perks aside from your knowing that you've done your good deed for the day and that that good deed has forever influenced the lives of a young, loving and hard-working family like the Ravens. 

Other Ways You Can Help - #SavingRaven

- Post this IndieGogo on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc! #SavingRaven -

Even if you can't make a monetary contribution, you can still help the effort by helping us share Danny's story with the world!  Take to social media and share this post using our hashtag: #savingraven  This will help us keep track of who is helping spread the word and seeing how far our message is traveling.  Not to mention it will help us reach more people and hopefully raise more money for the Raven family!

- Donate your used items to our Garage Sale - 

If you live in the Conejo Valley area, please donate your used items to our garage sale effort.  We will be having a garage sale the morning of Saturday, Feb. 1st with all proceeds going to Danny and his family to help pay down his medical bills. Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

Send a Facebook message to Thomas Martin:

https://www.facebook.com/thomas.martin

- Come to our Benefit Concert! - 

My band, Vinyl Party (vinylpartymusic.com) is throwing a benefit concert for Danny TONIGHT (Friday, Jan. 31st) at The Lab in Agoura Hills, CA.  If you are in the neighborhood, please come and show your support.  It's a FREE show, but we're asking that patrons pay a (suggested) $10 donation in Danny Raven's name.  Also, a percentage of all food and drink purchases as well as the band's cut of the door will be donated to the cause.

The Facebook Event Page is here:

https://www.facebook.com/events/633419750053695/

Please RSVP!

story:
Happy New Year to all of my Facebook friends and family.

My niece, Sheila, and her husband, Erik, have two children, Phoenix and Makenzie. Makenzie has a very expensive operation coming up, and I, Kevin Brown, am asking for your help. Makenzie's kidney has become enlarged, and it must be removed.

If you have a few dollars to spare to help this young family, we would all be forever grateful. Please donate today, and give this adorable little girl a wonderful New Year's gift.

Many thanks to all,
Kevin

Makenzie has a very expensive operation coming up, and I, Kevin Brown, am asking for your help. story:
Who are we?

I am Sadé Tolani, the founder of My Medical eCard, along with Mayowa Tola-Isaac, the face of My Medical eCard.

My background is medical, with further qualifications and experience in accountancy, information technology, health informatics, teaching and writing. I have used my skills and experience to create a simple tool that applies technology to personal well being, accountability and control.

Mayowa's background is in Sports & Entertainment Management. He brings My Medical eCard to life by demonstrating the benefits of carrying one in your wallet.


What is 'My Medical eCard?

My Medical eCard is a standalone, personalized, portable, electronic medical diary. It brings all your medical activities into one simple, easily accessible, portable device.

My Medical eCard is a credit card shaped USB device that sits nicely in your wallet, amongst your other cards. It goes everywhere with you.

It is made up of easy to fill medical forms that any lay person can complete.  You can attach other documents e.g. test results, doctors notes, dental reports, scans, x-rays, organ donor card, medico-legal, medical billing, medical insurance documents etc on to the Medical eCard.


Why create a product like this?

A lot of people want access to their medical records, but it is proving difficult for many people in different parts of the world.

Some organizations in some countries offer online access to some medical records, but not all, e.g., access to GP records, but not to dental or optical records. Hence, their medical records are incomplete at the point of access.

For others, the medical records are not in an orderly fashion for ease of reference by the user, such as test results mixed up with doctors' visits. They may not be legible and the User might not understand the medical terminologies that have been used.

Also, the medical records are not accessible in the event of an emergency, for instance, if the User is unconscious.

Most importantly, the User doesn't have adequate control over their medical records. In fact, many people are not aware of the fact that they are entitled to their medical records. All you need to do is ask your medical personnel.

My Medical eCard provides a simple solution to these issues, by providing a holistic approach to managing your medical records with this simple tool.


How does 'My Medical eCard resolve these issues?

My Medical eCard comprises of simple, easy to fill medical forms that any lay person can complete. The forms are laid out in an organized fashion in respective categories for easy reference e.g.

  • Personal Demographics (Blood Groups, Allergies, Pertinent Medical Information)
  • Medications
  • Medical History
  • Doctor's Visits
  • Hospitalizations
  • Dental Visits
  • Visits to Opticians
  • Tests & Results
  • Vaccinations & Immunizations
  • Medical Devices
  • Medical Billing
  • Medico-Legal Directives to name a few.


The User is in control of the contents of the Medical eCard. The User completes the forms to the best of their ability and in the language they understand (not medical jargon). The User enters only the medical information they choose to enter on to the forms.


All of the User's medical activities from medical to dental, therapies, allied health, homeopathy etc are collated and organized into one simple, easily, personally, accessible point.


In the event of an emergency, for instance, if the User is unconscious or unable to talk, the Medical eCard can be taken out of the User's wallet, identified to be the User, plugged into a computer and the pertinent medical information, as recorded by the User, can be viewed and acted upon accordingly e.g. diabetic, asthmatic, epileptic, allergies, on particular medications etc.

How do you use 'My Medical eCard?

My Medical eCard is very easy to use.

Just open the USB port on the eCard and insert it into the USB port of your computer or lap top.  Click on the device in the settings, 'MEDICAL' and it would display the medical forms.  Click to open and complete the medical forms. Save the forms accordingly.


What about privacy?

With respect to privacy, the information remains on the Medical eCard. It is not connected to the internet or stored on any server. The User can choose to save the information wherever they choose to e.g. on their home computer or in their personal cloud space, to which they have their personal log-ins.

There are two medical forms:

A basic form made up of basic medical information e.g. Personal demographics, blood group, allergies, pertinent medical conditions, In Case of Emergency contact details, Doctor's Details, Healthcare Providers and Health Insurance. This form does not have a password and the contents can be viewed, such as in the event of an emergency.

The second more comprehensive form requires a password for access and the forms cover majority of medical activities.

My Medical eCard is strictly personal, giving the User control and autonomy over the use and management of the information recorded in their Medical eCard.


When would 'My Medical eCard' be available?

My Medical eCard is currently available to order online on an individual retail basis.


Why should you back 'My Medical eCard'?


My Medical eCard is a new concept of having all your medical activities in an easily accessible, portable device. We want to increase awareness of this simple facility and tool for people who desperately want to be on top of their health and medical records.  People with long term ailments would like to maintain an organized chronology of their medical activities and to be able to update, maintain and monitor their progress.

We want to expand our capacity to cater for corporate orders for organizations that have a lot of Travelers, so that staff and business are on top of their obligatory  Travel Vaccinations and the organizations can feel at ease that their staff would be better catered for in the event of an emergency.

We want to compliment Insurance Companies in providing additional cover to their clients, by providing their clients with a means of monitoring their medical activities and ensuring that the information they have on them is accurate and cutting down on medical errors.

We want to play a part in decreasing Maternal & Child Mortality by encouraging and empowering Mothers to keep records of their medical activities and particularly their children's immunizations and vaccinations. If Mother's have such records that they are in control of, they are more likely to ensure that their children's immunizations are up to date. People that keep records are in a better position to assess their health status and take action, as needed, just like you would with your finances.

My Medical eCard would also like to compliment the Health Tourism trade by saving Health Tourists from carrying bulky medical documents, repeating their medical histories to new medical personnel, repeating tests, unnecessarily  and having a better organized set of medical information from their respective medical personnel.

My Medical eCard is currently in English. We want Medical eCard to be available in many more other languages and available to as many people as would benefit from it.


Where is 'My Medical eCard' based?

My Medical eCard is a privately registered enterprise in the United Kingdom, but trading world wide.


How can you obtain a 'My Medical eCard'?

Ordering a Medical eCard is very simple. All that is required are:

1. Your name, as you want it displayed on your Medical eCard

2. Your photo, if you wish to have one displayed on your Medical eCard or just a silhouette (male of female).

3. Any pertinent medical information you wish to have displayed on the front of the Medical eCard e.g. 'Diabetic', 'Asthmatic', 'Epileptic', 'Allergies' etc to a maximum of four lines and 18 characters per line.

4. A delivery address - Delivery is usually by regular mail (unless otherwise previously agreed) and this service may not be adequate in some countries. We cannot take responsibility for undelivered mail.

5. A functional email address and phone number, in the event that we need to contact you.



Requirement to use 'My Medical eCard'?

Medical eCard would work on any computer running Adobe 7.0 and above. 

'My Medical eCard' does not currently run on tablets.


How can you help us & what can we give you?

We want to help people take charge of their health and their medical records.  You can help us by obtaining and Medical eCard for yourself and spreading the word.

You can order for your family, friends, colleagues, staff members, patients and so on. 'My Medical eCard' make intelligent gifts.

Please back us and let's give 'Power To The Patients', as each one of us have been a patient of some sort at some point in our lives.

An empowered patient is a healthier patient. The more healthier people there are, the healthier nation and the healthier the world.


What do we need funds for?

We need funds for additional specialist printers to print individualized photos and names on the special USB eCards.

We need funds to expand to hire additional staff to meet orders, for translation services and to improve our software.

We would also like to provide an avenue to train helpers to assist people in completing their medical forms.

We want to develop a mobile app as a complimentary tool to a Medical eCard.

We want to increase awareness of the concept of a comprehensive electronic medical diary, by reaching out to more and more people.


Spread the word about 'My Medical eCard'

We are sure you know someone who would benefit from have a Medical eCard.

Please support our cause for empowering people with a health recording tool.


Thank you.


Sade Tolani & Mayowa Tola-Isaac
(Patent Pending)
story_txt:
Who are we?
I am Sadé Tolani, the founder of My Medical eCard, along with Mayowa
Tola-Isaac, the face of My Medical eCard.My background is medical, with further qualifications and experience
in accountancy, information technology, health informatics, teaching and
writing. I have used my skills and experience to create a simple tool that applies
technology to personal well being, accountability and control. 
Mayowa's background is in Sports & Entertainment Management. He
brings My Medical eCard to life by demonstrating the benefits of carrying one
in your wallet.
What is 'My Medical eCard?My Medical eCard is a standalone, personalized, portable, electronic
medical diary. It brings all your medical activities into one simple, easily accessible, portable
device.My Medical eCard is a credit card shaped USB device that sits nicely
in your wallet, amongst your other cards. It goes everywhere with you.It is made up of easy to fill medical forms that any lay person can
complete.  You can attach other documents
e.g. test results, doctors notes, dental reports, scans, x-rays, organ donor
card, medico-legal, medical billing, medical insurance documents etc on to the Medical eCard. Why create a product like this?A lot of people want access to their medical records, but it is
proving difficult for many people in different parts of the world. Some organizations in some countries offer online access to some
medical records, but not all, e.g., access to GP records, but not to dental or
optical records. Hence, their medical records are incomplete at the point of access. 
For others, the medical records are not in an orderly fashion for
ease of reference by the user, such as test results mixed up with doctors'
visits. They may not be legible and the User might not understand the medical
terminologies that have been used. 
Also, the medical records are not accessible in the event of an
emergency, for instance, if the User is unconscious. 
Most importantly, the User doesn't have adequate control over their
medical records. In fact, many people are not aware of the fact that they are entitled to
their medical records. All you need to do is ask your medical personnel. 
My Medical eCard provides a simple solution to these issues, by
providing a holistic approach to managing your medical records with this simple tool. 
How does 'My Medical eCard resolve these issues?My Medical eCard comprises of simple, easy to fill medical forms
that any lay person can complete. The forms are laid out in an organized
fashion in respective categories for easy reference e.g. 

Personal Demographics (Blood Groups, Allergies, Pertinent Medical Information)

Medications
Medical History
Doctor's Visits
Hospitalizations
Dental Visits
Visits to Opticians
Tests & Results
Vaccinations &
     Immunizations
Medical Devices
Medical Billing
Medico-Legal Directives to name a
     few. 
The User is in control of the contents of the Medical eCard. The
User completes the forms to the best of their ability and in the language they
understand (not medical jargon). The User enters only the medical information
they choose to enter on to the forms. 
All of the User's medical activities from medical to dental,
therapies, allied health, homeopathy etc are collated and organized into one
simple, easily, personally, accessible point. 
In the event of an emergency, for instance, if the User is
unconscious or unable to talk, the Medical eCard can be taken out of the User's
wallet, identified to be the User, plugged into a computer and the pertinent
medical information, as recorded by the User, can be viewed and acted upon

story:
Help a struggling mother get a ride to work.

  • Hi, my name is Richard Spivey and I am on a mission to help a friend who is a mother of 3 and struggling to get back on her feet after losing her job about a year ago.
  • My friend has been out of work for over a year. She is struggling to provide for her family which includes a child with a disability. I recently convinced her to explore job opportunities here in N.C. She did just that and got a job offer right away. She has orientation this week. My friend who I will call K (she doesn't know I'm doing this) lost her car after she couldn't afford to make needed repairs. She is literally moving here on a wing and a prayer. She will be staying with me for a couple of weeks until she can get a few checks coming in and will then send for her family. She is willing to take public transportation but I live outside of the limits and our schedules do not match up for me to take her everyday to work. I want to raise enough money to pay for her a rental car or an inexpensive used car if possible.
  • This is a brand new start for this struggling mother. She is moving on faith. She needs a fresh start and a little hope that things will turn around. I can only imagine what it would mean to her to have complete strangers give her a hand up.

This is not a hand out. K is working to better herself and make a new life for her family here in N.C. I'm just hoping that someone will pay it forward.

Here is what the money will go toward.

  • Any monies collected will go toward either helping to rent a car for a few weeks or if enough money is raised, to buy an inexpensive car to get K back and forth to work. Any funds left over will be used to help buy work clothes for her or school clothes for her kids or possibly to put a deposit down on an apartment.
  • There isn't much reward for anyone  who donates except to know that you have helped someone who is down on their luck have some hope again.
  • Any funds raised will go toward the purposes described above.

The Impact

Your donation, big or small is not going to change the world but it just may change one person’s life.

  • Give as little or as much as you can or will.
  • This is my first time doing this type of thing using a site like this.
  • She is a real person with real struggles. I worked with her previously and have known her for about 5 years.

Risks & Challenges

 The greatest risk is that no one will see this and or no one will respond. I can only hope that I have made my case and that somehow together we can make a difference.

  • If I do not raise the funds I will still help her and try to work out a way to get her to work on my own.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this with your friends and loved ones. You never know who might surprise you and do something extraordinary.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our Need

Hi, I'm Greg. I am raising funds to cover the cost of a portable AED device. This device may be used to save my life and the life of my son. The reason this life-saving device is so important is because genetic testing has recently uncovered a genetic mutation, in both of us, that causes an abnormal heart rhythm disorder called Catecholaminergic Polymorphic Ventricular Tachycardia (CPVT). If not treated immediately, the onset of this abnormal heart rhythm can lead to sudden death in as little as 10 minutes. The AED is specifically designed to treat this type of arrhythmia by shocking the heart back into a normal rhythm. Having this device nearby at all times will greatly increase our chance of survival if we were to experience VT.

What is an AED?

An AED (Automated External Defibrillator) is a portable electronic device that automatically diagnoses a life-threatening cardiac arrhythmia, such as ventricular tachycardia, in a patient and is able to treat through defibrillation, the application of electrical therapy which stops the arrhythmia, allowing the heart to reestablish an effective rhythm.

What is CPVT?

CPVT is an inherited condition and is believed to affect approximately 1 in 10,000 individuals. It can cause abnormal heart rhythms (arrhythmia) which can result in fainting, cardiac arrest, or sudden death. The abnormal heart rhythms usually happen under certain circumstances such as physical exertion or emotional stress. Although CPVT does not have a cure at this point in time, there are a number of treatments available to help prevent complications: medications or an Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) may be used.

Symptoms of CPVT, including sudden death, are most often experienced in the first two decades of life. This puts children at a greater risk of cardiac arrest and sudden arrhythmia death. (My sister died suddenly from an arrhythmia caused by CPVT at the age of 15.)

Your Donation Helps

Your donations will make sure that an AED with the proper accessories (child shock pads) stays in our home. Funding will be used to cover the cost of the AED ($1800) and the cost of the child shock pads ($200).

After the discovery of the CPVT causing gene I acquired an AED from St. John Ambulance. This AED currently resides in our home, but the full cost of purchase is outstanding. Your help is needed to cover that cost. There is currently no health care program (MCP or private) or government program funding available.

Any funds raised beyond the cost of the AED and the child shock pads will be split and generously donated to both the Heart & Stroke Foundation and the Canadian SADS Foundation.

"Have A Heart"

For every $10 you donate you will receive a "heart" and be entered into a prize draw (ex. A donation of $25 = 2 hearts). Hearts will be made by myself and Gabriel and entered into the draw with one heart being picked at the end of the campaign. If your heart is picked then you will receive a "Heart Healthy Gift Basket" with a $50 value!

THANK-YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Introduction

Hey, guys! I'm Greg Hyatt, a 32 year-old guy living in Kansas City. This November, I'll be running the World's Toughest Mudder, a 24 hour obstacle course race.

I've been running OCRs for a few year now and this is the next step.

I'm writing a book about my previous races, diet and training for WTM, the races between now and then, the race itself and my recovery. This is something I've been thinking about for a long time, something I am very passionate about and I want to share it with you.

With your help, I'll be able to self-publish the book and be able to focus on my training and writing.

What I Need & What You Get

I know I've set a pretty high bar. Let me explain where the money goes.

  • $1000 - This will cover registration and travel.
  • $2500 - Equipment. Things like a GoPro, batteries, a wetsuit for the race, shoes, etc.
  • $1000 - Training. This will cover gym fee, parkour classes.
  • $2000 - This will cover book fees. Editor, graphic design.
  • $1000 - Unexpected costs. Any unforeseen expenses or price increases.
  • $2500 - Printing and publishing.

    The Impact

    Everything helps. As I explained in my video, I've already registered for the race and there are no refunds. I'm running this race. I've begun writing the book. I believe this is a unique experience and I want to share it with the world.

    I'm doing this, but I could really use your help.

    Risks & Challenges
    I've already registered for the race. I've begun writing the book. At this point, what I need from you is help covering travel and publishing expenses.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can't contribute now? That's fine. You can still help. Tell your friends. Post links on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr. If you've got editing or design experience and you want to offer your service, fantastic. I appreciate every little bit of help.

    Thank so much, you are awesome!
